text:
Merritt's has become the go-to breakfast place for hubby & me.   We've always been pleased with our food and the service, but we don't go at their busiest times either.

I'm not a big breakfast person so when I'm not feeling like eggs or pancakes, I appreciate that Merritt's is willing to make me a sandwich at 9 am.   Our most recent breakfast trip included some great french toast and some of the best bacon we've ever had at a restaurant.

The atmosphere is most definitely dive-y.  Photos on the wall of winning racehorses from the late 70's and early 80's, wood paneling, etc.   Old, yes, but we've found it to be clean and friendly.

Awesome food at a decent price!. Yes it is rundown so be prepared for that but the breakfast I had was delicious. Merritt's is famous for their "scones" but everything they serve is good old fashion Dive food. Try it!

I'm gonna be very real here for a second. I love Merritt's. I've been a Patron since the tender age of 9. Great value, great portion size, great coffee, great scones. But I gotta say. Ever since the management changed and they got new honey, the honeys been weird. Which in turn makes the honey butter weird. Butter's weird.

Breakfast is ok but this place is about the Scones and Honey Butter... If you remember like I do the Warm Springs restaurant in Ketchum, Idaho then you will LOVE this place. When you bite into those scones it brings back all kinds of memories!

I would take meritts over IHOP or Sherri's on any late night. I wouldn't say they have the healthiest food, especially there scones. But it is a pretty good place to eat especially after everything closes down. Different environment but I like it.
Great food...anything you order is crazy good!  Especially the scones!  Little on the grubby side.  Not the cleanest joint but some of the best greasy spoon food in Idaho!

My wife and I  stopped by this place thinking it was a bakery since I read SCONES in big letters and was surprised to see it was a family diner. We were attended by a kid that just moved in from Florida and had a mix of scones. Very delicious and the service was great. We were also surprised to know it was open very late on weekends and since we are recent move-ins from Texas we are used to many places staying open late. So since we liked it that much, we went back for dinner with the kids after a late evening bike ride. Again we received great service from the Florida kid. We will definitely be regulars at this spot. The menu has a good variety of southern comfort food and the prices are very reasonable.

Perhaps the ultimate HOLE IN THE WALL! so this review is based upon that type of establishment. The atmosphere is exactly that of what you would want for such a place, its seen better days but people still throw a little polish on it occasionally, its become comfortable with itself so to speak. The service is usually very good to great. Now as for the food, it is simple, ample and done incredibly well. I have been here many many times and as of yet i have not tried anything else other than the chicken fried steak, there are others who do it prettier, thicker, and crunchier but it is the closest you can come to something that grandma used to make in a cast iron skillet. It is a cube STEAK, a whole piece of meat that has been flattened out during the tenderizing process. It is breaded simply and then cooked on the flat top i assume, you can cut this dude with a fork, the gravy that comes with it is a perfect complement, it tastes very much like a gravy made right in the skillet with all the drippings and crispy goodness stirred right in. Something else that this place does well is the scone, this is a  SIDE that you can have like a piece of toast but it is huge and fluffy and...well, you need to try one of these, a bit of butter and powdered sugar makes it amazing. I'll be back again and again and will always leave with leftovers.

Merritt's was always our favorite place to go for a late night bite to eat when we were in college. My friends and I would head there to relax after a long day of classes, studying, and homework. We loved that they were open really late on the weekends. The portions are great and the menu is very affordable. The best thing on the menu is their scones. They are sweet and filling. They are perfect for dessert or even just for a meal themselves. Their cheesy fries are also delicious and perfect for sharing with a group.

Just discovered this ... My new favorite breakfast place in Boise!  Probably drove past it a hundred times and Yelp review brought us here.  Dutch Babies are to die for.  They don't believe in small portions. Loved the young lady who waited on us.  
Been in business since mid 70's and still run by the founding family.  An experience not be missed!

Go here!  It's amazing and open 24 hours on the weekends.  I got a breakfast bowl.  So good,  biscuits and gravy with bacon, topped with an egg and cheese all in a big bowl for like $7.  Shared a scone too!  We'll be back, I need more!

Merritt's is the kind of down home cooking that I would drive from Seattle, WA. too Boise, ID for!  And, Yes I actually have done it... The SCONES are too die for... THE service is always EXCELLENT!  It is the kind of place you might expect too see on a long road trip through the midwest though!  It is not pretty, it is NOT fancy, and it is NOT super expensive!  BUT It is ALWAYS CLEAN, GOOD fast service, and great food that never leaves you wanting more!

NOPE. When I walked in I should have turned around and walked back out. It's truly scary in there. And the food is worse. I ordered a steak and it was nothing but gristle. I honestly have a really hard time believing it was actually steak. It was so dry, gristly and just all around disgusting. The vegetables that came on the side? Frozen. Disgusting. 

Whoever is cooking back there, needs to find a different line of work and they need to buy better quality food for the prices they charge. They should have paid me for eating that garbage.

We used to come here all the time after working late night because it was good, greasy, and filling food. The atmosphere and service were also pretty good.  Today we came in for lunch and the food was pretty good, like always. The prices (for what it is, and what you get) are a lil high. They only have soft drinks in bottles, not a good business decision but whatever...my friend got a 16oz. Coke and I got a 12oz. Diet pepsi (not by choice)...same price...anyone else see a problem here? Service was bad but atleast i left full. Like mentioned before...COME FOR THE FOOD, NOT THE SERVICE!!!
Best biscuits & gravy Ive ever had!! A must try...plus im from CA & had to try their "scones". Very good aswell!! Best 1st time experience, also service was on point! Good Job

I LOVE GETTING SCONED AT MERRITT'S! To those reviews that talk about the look and how bad the food is for you....well that's Merritt's. It was never meant to accommodate the Queen it was meant to  be a place for people to go indulge every now and then. If you want something a little less Dive then come to LA with the yupps they can help you out here. If you want some down-home, greasy, you only live once food head to Merritt's. I only get to go back home to Boise every now and then and I treasure the fun moments and good (but not so good for you) food I've had here.

Best hole-in-the-wall breakfast joint ever! My standard is the dutch baby scones and the biscuit bowl. If you are looking for a nice, cozy place to take the in-laws and kids, skip it. If you want a cheap breakfast that is the equivalent of a guilty-pleasure movie, like Leprechaun (it can get kind of dark in there...) or Waterworld (some of the customers in there could definitely be Smokers. And probably are smokers.), then go. And don't forget the dutch babies.

Small town restaurant that packs a punch! Large portions, so bring your appetite. And don't forget to leave room for dessert! Their scones are AMAZING!! Reasonable pricing and good food. They are a neighborhood facet as well. Apparently they have been around for quite awhile as I overheard some of the other patrons tell one of their servers that their grandparents used to frequent the same place.
This place was GREAT for after bar hopping!  Standard Denny's type fanfare.  Great selection and cheap!  Food was GREAT!  After the bars this is the place to go!

Unpretentious, solid execution, good food, nice staff without being overly intrusive.  They didn't tell me their names, and I didn't want to know.  Eggs over easy were done just right, bacon not too crisp but not underdone, hashbrowns the same.  If you can be perfect on the fundamentals, everything else works out.  Also, although there were several people in the place, it was quiet.  No music of any kind.  5 stars for that, alone!

This is one of those whole in the wall places that sometimes people over look but should never over look.  The food is awesome, as well as very cheap.  The portions are generous.  And the SCONES... Yum Yum Yum!!!  I could eat their scones all day every day and die a very happy (FAT) man.  Everyone should go here!

Merritt's is the definition of a old time dinner and one of the only places in Boise where you can get a chicken fried steak with brown gravy (the absolute best way to have chicken fried steak).

Skip the Cracker Barrel and head down to this fantastic hole in the wall treasure!

Why you ask?!
1- It will cost less.
2- It is locally owned.
3- It is been around for generations.
4- It is not a Cracker Barrel.

This used to be my favorite five star location for late night, early morning, and anytime food but the fact that they no longer have a soda fountain is a deal breaker.  $1.25/ea for a can of soda?  Wow, that takes this late night locale from five to zero stars.  Let me know when a soda fountain returns because neither me or my friends will be back until then.  Total ripoff.

TERRIBLE! Where to begin... :/ We ordered our food at 5:20pm. A larger group came in so the waitress recommended we get our Dutch babies (scones) with our meal so we didn't have to wait & we agreed that was a good idea. The waitress printed out our check at 6:47pm and we STILL hadn't gotten our Dutch babies. The large table next to us rec'd their's so I jokingly asked if those were supposed to be ours. At 7:37pm I texted my friend that recommended the place that we were STILL waiting. My sister paid with a gift card & the remaining balance should have been paid with cash. They did it vise versa (who does that? Now she has a few dollars left on a gift card). The waitress came to our table to say, "Because it's taking so long, I've brought out lemon and butter in to-go containers." I was shocked, laughed and said... "I thought for sure you were going to end your statement with, so we aren't going to charge you for them, but you didn't say that." Eventually, the owner was called in to reimburse us for the scones we never received because we were FINALLY told there was only 1 of 3 fryers working. When the owner arrived she was so mad she was shaking. She actually saw her employee slip and fall on the ground while we were talking and all she did was state her name in a super irritated way like "get up!" Can you say WORKERS COMP?!?! She reimbursed me for my meal after she was so frustrated trying to figure out to the penny how much she should give me back for my scone. When I said it would be good customer service to reimburse me for my full meal after all of this... She punched the buttons (mind you, she still shaking) and very rudely pushed the money at me and said "Here, enjoy your free meal!" All the customers were staring since she was making such a scene. She was so frustrated, I actually wanted to tell her to just take a deep breath and relax. (I'm the one that was in that place for 2.5hrs, I am the one that should've been angry). My little sister (who has 3 tiny little kids waiting patiently for their dessert that never came for 2.5hrs, before getting in the car for a 4hr car ride home AND she STILL TIPPED the waitress $5) paid with a debit card & the owner said she couldn't reimburse her for part of the meal on a credit or debit card "So here, have another free meal!" I told her that her incredible customer service would be on Yelp reviews tonight. I'm disappointed that I've heard amazing things about the scones (more like fair elephant ears than like a Starbucks scone) and now I will never be able to try one. I'd like to see the TV show "The Prophet" come in and rescue this tiny business that's been around since 1975 that apparently has "the secret recipe" for delicious scones. They need new ownership, a new location, new fry equipment, customer service training, more employees (those poor ladies were doing the best they could shorthanded) and safe working conditions. That poor waitress bit it hard on the floor and got right back up. Not sure if she's scared to say she's hurt to the owner or what?!?! L&I might need to be called... Someone needs to look out for the employees.

Came here for breakfast because this is close to where we stayed. Their breakfast was average, just another normal diner. But their scone was amazing! Huge portion and so evil with all the sugar on top. It taste good but I felt like I'm gonna get diabetes. We have to take half of the scone home because we were too full!

Sunday breakfast with the boyfriend is a sacred event that only the best restaurant can host. Merritt's is one of those! 

My boyfriend had never eaten here, so I decided to broaden his horizons. He didn't expect much from this little hole in the wall restaurant, with its very mom and pop feel. However, he fell in love with his first bite of food. 

You'll have to deal with a longer than usual wait, but in my opinion it's so well worth it for the amazing food! Customer service could be a bit better--we had to ask and track down for drinks and food, but everyone is incredibly friendly and accommodating! It's a perfect place for breakfast, lunch, or dinner!

I was skeptical upon driving up, but so happy we came! Great friendly staff! Very prompt service and a yummy breakfast too! Scones were not what i expected but quite tasty! They were pretty busy but kept smiling and serving quickly. Great old fashioned place, We will be back!

Hate leaving a bad review on such a local classic but I am fairly certain that I have had food poisoning form Merritt's twice in the past. The food is cheap and the portions are big, but you get what you pay for. 

I hope that they have got their kitchen staff figured out, but still I think I am going to be sticking with their amazingly good scones from now on. They are always a safe bet...

The scones at 3am is why I enjoy this place. The rest of the food that I've had is your typical diner food but the scones...oh yes, the scones-so much yum. Staff is super friendly and pretty quick service. Pretty eclectic group that staggers in after 2am lol. 
It's cheap, it's open 24 hours, so it's worth a visit :)

The scones are amazing!!  My girls love scones!!   But I've never brought them here and now I remember why..  Really really rough place.  The opposite of clean and bright.  Old and very dingy.  I was having a hard time reading the other yelp reviews while at Merritt's because of the drunk guys in the back raising hell..  So this is a must try scone place as long as your packing some kind of heat.   And have a get away car close by..  Will I go back?  Yes,  but not with the kids.. I will be hanging out with the drunk guys in the back raising hell eating scones at 3 in the morning when I don't care how clean the place is... Just saying..
I stopped in here with my two oldest boys for breakfast the other day. I hadn't been to Merritt's in over 20 years. Still the same ole place, good food and friendly service.

Their scones are the best I have ever had. Very laid back staff. They let you eat in peace while still making sure your water is topped off and you've got everything you need. Plus the jukebox is awesome.
It was good. You certainly get a lot of food.  The scones are like Indian fry bread.  They are great when they come out hot and then topped with melted butter and honey.  Yum!

I've this place! My idea of a scone is a little different based on my upbringing but these scones are to die for! 

I finally ordered something other than a scone and it was a great meal! Lots of food for a great price. 

Friendly staff and a fun juke box!

Merritt's is great for late night eats, which, generally, go along with prayers such as..... "Please get me sober so I don't feel like s&!t in the morning!!! I have to work in 6 hours, and I don't want to puke in front of my boss!" Similar stories to this can apply, but Merritt's may help with the hangover. It may, in fact, be their secret motto. 
I have been here before, late night, and it's been pretty dang busy. Although, I have nothing to compare it to, because I have never been here during daylight hours. 
I usually order bread like products. Pancakes, or waffles. Sometimes potatoes. Always a "scone". (Scone here = fried bread with lots of sugar on it, more like a donut than a traditional British scone). 
I can't say it's always been the best food, and I can't account for how much it actually helps my state of mind (or body) the morning after a bender, but I also can't argue, that it has hurt to much either. 
Thankfully Merritts and I have only met 3 times since I moved to Boise (in 2.5 years). I don't think I could handle the amount of drinking that usually brings me here very often. I am always thankful that when I do, this 24 hour restaurant is here to assist (me the morning after)!
This place looks like DIVE, I mean real dive! However the baking is terrific and the scones will bring you back. Simply give it a try and be happy.

First of all, I love divey greasy spoons.  They have great character and usually good food.  Not so much with Merritt's.  

SO and I went a few months ago to check it out as it'd been recommended.  I was very excited to try the "world famous" scones.  

The place is terribly lit and very crowded with tables.  We sat in the back with florescent lighting.  It was claustrophobic.  The people are friendly, but service is slooooooow.  I got an omelet of some kind and SO got chicken fried steak with a scone.  The gravy on the CFS was not great and had very little sausage in it.  

The scone is not a scone.  I'm not sure how they get away calling it that.  Deep-fried pizza dough would be a better description.  It was super heavy and pretty much gross.  We ate about 4 bites and left the rest.  Another reviewer called it a cross between a cookie and a muffin...if only that were the case.  It might be somewhat good.  I think what bothers me most is that the restaurant touts its scones and they are horrible.  Will not go back even though the rest of the food was ok.

Two words ........... Be afraid !!!!! ..............This place sucks. When my wife and I went in it was by far the epitome of a dive or hole in the wall. (not in a good way) It was busy so we overlooked the shabbiness of the place because we figured if that many people went there the food must be good. BIG mistake on our part. We were sat right in the path of everybodys way. Customers going to the  restroom, servers delivering food, customers coming into the place. Just in the way. It also took forever to get our drinks. Even longer to have a server get our order. Only one cook. Looks like she just got out of prison and so skinny it was obvious she didn't even eat there. We finally moved to a booth which was much better.

A family of 5 came in, mom, dad, and 3 girls at the table we were first sat down at. Only 4 chairs, and the servers didn't even try to get a 5th chair. They finally left because of the lack of attention they got. Finally we got our order placed and the server recommended the chicken fried steak. It took 30 minutes to get our order. Remember..... only one cook. My wife ordered an omelet. Got our food finally. Chicken fried steak so greasy it made my stomach upset withing 15 minutes of trying to eat it. Gravy sucked, eggs over done, toast cold. My wife's meal was not much better. 

So since this placed brags about their scones, we ordered one...... Waited another 20 minutes and never got it. Refills on drinks was a joke. I had to ask every time to get refills. Long story over with ..... We were there for a little over an hour and ended up not paying for my meal, but paid for my wife's and the drinks after I complained about everything. During our visit I had also seen and heard a few other customers complain about some of the same things that bugged us.

As I said before ............... Be afraid !

This place is super divey. You pull up and it looks like an old bar. You walk in and the walls are stripped and the booths seem to be repurposed from an 80's Denny's. But, it's a 24 hour joint and those are few and far between in Idaho. 

None of it matters when your scone arrives--you're there to get sconed, right? Merritt's has been making their famous scones since the 70's and yeah, they are good. Don't think scone like slightly hard but still delicious coffee shop pastry. These are what I have always known as Mormon scones, a sort of hybrid of Indian fry bread and elephant ears. Multiple toppings to choose from, they come out hot and delicious and with homemade honey butter. 

I have no idea about their other menu items, but if you want a delicious homemade dessert, give these a try! 

Also service was good, prompt and friendly. Can't go wrong as long as atmosphere isn't what you're looking for.

Best food, best servers, best EVERYTHING!!! Whatever you do, don't let the facade and decor fool you! This is some A+ diner grub. It's divey, but 24 hours and everyone is SO nice! Even the second time around was perfect!

This place is amazing. Great food, great service, and all at a great price! I had the scones and some toast. But everything in the menu is amazing. There are not a whole lot of breakfast/lunch/dinner places that are this good.

Ok scones were amazing and im sure we will return just for those and order them to go, they deserve 5 stars.  The rest of the food was meh and bleh. My biscuits and gravy were put on the table long before anyone else got food, sorry im not going to touch a bite before my kids are served. So she brought me a new one which was nice but honeslty wasnt much warmer than the cold one i already had. Also the gravy was chicken gravy not country gravy so it was a bummer which is why theyre more 4 or even 3 stars food to me. The waitress was kind of rude, when were figuring out drinks and i clearly cant find it on the menu maybe make a suggestion instead of standing there. The restroom did not have a changing table so I had to sit on the bathroom floor to change my newborn on my lap and there were multiple people in the resturaunt with babies so theres no excuse not to have one. The restroom and kind of rude waitress is why a docked another star.

We got a taco omelette and scones. Scones were good the taco omelette was a bit dry not really all that hype. Drink was empty for most of the visit with only 3-4 other tables and 2 waitresses. Otherwise worth the stop on a slow Thursday morning.

And almost half of American oil consumption is for motor vehicles.
T. Holden

The other half is consumed at Merritt's!
If you are looking for cheap greasy eats late at night this is your place. Big portions fill you up and the food isn't bad. Their scones are kinda like beignets and are pretty good in the local honey provided at the table. The only (very) negative was that my steak fries were raw inside. I love rare meats... But unfortunately they were raw, probably not defrosted before frying. 
One more noteworthy thing is that the juke box was spitting out some interesting tunes:
ABBA
Country music
Bob Marley
Jack Johnson
Back to country.
It was great!

Made a late night stop here with some family. I love to eat food but even I couldn't finish one of these. We broke two of the powdered sugar scones up into 5 pieces so each person had two pieces. It came with really tasty honey butter and lemon wedges. I am pretty sure this is the best sweet I've ever had. Thanks for the hospitality! Really nice staff.
Went there late one night with my girlfriend after a hitting a bar. It was a perfect place to pig out on breakfast food. Big portions that were all very good. Love it will be back!

If you are going to eat here be prepared..... to be waiting! Alot of people have recommended this diner to me over the years for the scones, so last weekend I took my kids to breakfast here, big mistake!!! When we arrived we were seated and then ignored for 20 minutes, and it couldn't have been because of the waitress being to busy- she was only working 4 tables, upon going over the menu we decided that we didn't want a scone- so we ordered traditional diner meals. I will start off by saying the biscuits are phenomenal!!!! However the grey colored gravy- ehhh not so much!! GROSS! The eggs over medium were cooked properly however had a very off taste to them- as my 4 year old egg lover says 'mommy, I don't like these' check the expiration date or something! Hashbrowns indeed were potatoes :) but appear to be premade and left in a warming pan - if your looking for the traditional diner hasbrowns, ya know - shredded with a crispy outide and creamy potato center - you will be sadly dissatisfied! Pancake- light fluffy wonderfulness, 4 year very pleased, even though it was cold by the time the waitress finally brought the syrup (note: who forgets to bring syrup with pancackes??????) Now the decore! I don't care about the decore from 20/30/40? years ago- but it all feels dirty and the flys didn't help. So- really really really slow service, weren't given water, had to wait for syrup, UTENSILS, and we were missing part of our order. The 3 other tables around us were experiencing the same poor treatment. I didn't leave a tip for the waitress, I will leave one for fellow diners- unless you are going for the bread products - PASS! on a side note- the dishes were clean :)

And from all of my kids and my perspective - This place needs to be on Gordon Ramseys 'Kitchen Nightmares' show.

Old time standby restaurant. Not the most attractive decor or setting but lots of rib sticking good food. Tables and chairs don't match. You know whats good by whats stained the menu, but the food is good. Have an omelette OR a scone, but not both! Don't go here expecting a "special" experience, just down home cooking and ample portions, and the BEST SCONES on the planet! Try the blueberry with ice cream!

This place was dirty. The wait staff ignored us for 10 minutes. When they finally got our drink order and food order they disappeared to hide or do drugs, or both. 15 more minutes went by and then they decided to tell us they didn't have what we ordered. We left. I don't know how their food is but I'm guessing by everything else we dodged a bullet not eating at the No-Merit Cafe.
Amazing steak and eggs, get the SCONES when you come here. Freshly made while your there and not frozen or anything, taste like powdered donuts.

Horrible, what happened to this place it use to be pretty good. It was always a great place to stop after a  night of drinking, and have a good meal to off set the drinks, but this place sucks. The food is over cooked and the service sucks. I would suggest spending your money someplace else. Its too bad was a great a place at one point.
It's not what I call a scone, more like a beaver tail. A greasy beaver tail. I had meatloaf and mashed poratoes and it was so bland. Went at the urging of a friend but I probably won't go back.

We eat at Merritt's at least once every couple months.  It is usually the go to breakfast place after a late football game or family outing the night before....the morning of October 25, 2014, was a Merritt's morning...After tailgating and watching BSU throttle BYU the night before the family was ready for some breakfast bowls, pancakes, and scones...we got there at 1140 and while crowded we were immediately offered a table over by the counter....we were glad to be seated so quickly because a few weeks before it there was a 30 minute wait...anyway....we were seated and coffee was served...then we waited...and waited....and waited....finally 20 minutes later our order was taken....then we waited and waited and waited....after one hour and 20 minutes my wife finally asked when we would get our three breakfast bowls, one pancake, and side of bacon....we were told it was almost ready...she said they were waiting for the bowls to be cleaned....they brought out my wife's breakfast bowl...me and my son waited another 10 minutes to get ours...mine was brought out on a plate.....then after we had finished our meal the pancake finally came out.....listen....I love Merritt's. As a Boise native I have eaten there all my life...but I cannot believe the horrible service...never a sorry, never a coffee refill, never a...'have a scone on us while youwait 2 hours for your meal....unbelievable.....I will go back....but I will make sure I have all day to sit and wait to eat.

I've haunted this place since it opened in the early 70s when it was a hang for the Les Boi crowd. It's had its ups and downs over the years but now it seems that this old place has found solid footing. 

The service starts with a friendly greeting and a quick survey of drink preferences. My order was taken almost immediately on a busy Saturday morning.  

The bacon was better than most and the eggs and hash browns were perfectly prepared. A biscuit and excellent gravy were offered in liue of toast.  Over all a solid effort. 

This is a greasy spoon joint that brings back a lot of good memories.  The walls are clad with vintage winners circle photos from the 1980s and, of course, a rendering of Boise's hall of fame jockey Gary Stevens. 

Merritt's will always have a special place in my heart.

My hat don't hang on the same nail too long. My ears can't stand to hear the same ol' song...cause I got ramblin' fever in my blood.  ...Rolled in from California years ago and got straight sconed at Merritt's!  What a gem of an old truck stop frozen in time.  Love to stop in every time I'm in town.  Can't figure out those strange bad reviews from a few kooks though.

OK here it goes. Ive eaten here twice both times around 0200 to 0300 AM. It is open 24/7 which is nice. They have a cool retro jukebox with some good tunes on it. But if the owner is reading this PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD TALK TO YOUR "WAITRESSES" OR FIRE THEM. 
They made the experience horrible! 
The food was pretty good, i would give it a 3/5 stars with good portions.
ORDER THE SCONE LAST DON'T EXPECT THE WAITRESS TO BRING IT OUT HOT OTHERWISE
if you buy the chicken fired steak meal it comes with a scone but the waitress must have the cook prepare it when preparing the food. The last time i went i asked the waitress to have to cook prepare my scone after i was done eating my meal. It still came out cold...shameful.
The waitresses are not friendly at all and look like they would scream at you if you ask them for anything....I ate there twice and had a different waitress each time...another story of bad service ruining a good restaurant...what a shame...

My boyfriend and I were craving breakfast late one night, and decided to give Merritt's a shot (I had never been) rather than Denny's or IHOP. 

I was a little surprised to see just how run-down this place is. I knew it was a dive, but I'm confused how they even pass the health code.

Since it was late, I was not surprised to find a large group of high-school or college-aged kids sitting at the large center table. We opted for a booth in the corner, hoping to find some quiet. (We had no luck.)

I ordered the biscuits and gravy, and was extremely disappointed. The food was... gross. The gravy was so bland and tasted as if it consisted of only flour and milk. If that wasn't bad enough, my boyfriend's finger steaks were RAW. In fact, I was kind of upset he didn't send them back. 

We got a "scone," as they are Merritt's claim to fame, and was not any more impressed. It's nothing that a scone should be, essentially just a funnel cake you'd get at the fair. 

To make it worse, the service was terrible.

How does this place have 4 stars?! YUCK! I'd rather have gone to Denny's...

Chantyll was witty and a lot of fun.  Provided great service with a huge smile.  Try the mushroom melt!   

Scone is awesome and we shared one (they're huge), plain with some honey butter and honey.  Light, fluffy, sort of like a donut---not like any scones I've ever seen or tasted.  Fabulous!

Last of a great dying breed!

I LOVE this place! I understand the lease is running out, or the building's up for sale so this place could disappear at any moment. (This may or may not explain why they don't spiff the place up a bit more, but that's sort of part of its charm.)  I spend a lot of time out of town and one of the first places I go when I return is Merritt's. And I'm always relieved to see it still there.

I love the pancakes which are humongous, the biscuits and the perfect hash browns. 

I love the tacky but dear waitstaff, the bottomless cup of coffee and the "regulars". Have a long conversation here with a good friend and watch the show or go by yourself and you're sure to get into a conversation with someone if you sit at or near the counter.

As franchise restaurants take over, savor Merritt's while you can.

We love diners like Merritt's where the food is plentiful and the prices are low., low, low. We really enjoyed the overall experience here as some of the food we ordered was truly delicious. I ordered the vegetarian omelet on a scone which was so tasty! My sister ordered a chocolate peanut butter milkshake and we all loved it. She also got a scone and it was delicious. The other two in our party ordered steak--one as part of a breakfast meal and one as part of a dinner meal. It was great to get so much food for so cheap but the steak (shocker) wasn't that good and the biscuits and gravy had no flavor at all. If we came here again, which we plan on doing, we would stick with diner food like burgers, fries, pancakes, omelets and milkshakes.

After reading reviews on Yelp and driving by this divey place, I HAD to try it.. it was good, but not great... the place was full of smoke from the kitchen and it burned my eyes the whole time.  The Scones are more like Funnel Cakes you'd get at the fair.
Old greasy spoon that has been brought back to life with good food, good people, and a fun jukebox.

Locally owned total mom'n'pop breakfast place with a menu reminiscent of Cracker Barrel. However, they certainly have their own solid takes on traditional American breakfast food that I'd call uniquely Merritt's. I'd eat breakfast every morning here if I could. Scones scones scones scones scones scones scones. Do it.
So good and so excited it's open all night on the weekends. Loved the breakfast bowl and the scones of course!

Service, Sweet tea, scones, make the a four star list but so-so on the rest of the menu. 

Don't get the steak of you expect locally sourced organic seared goodness. Do order the scones! 

Great atmosphere. Overheard, 
"Your energy is ahhhmazesauce!"
"I missed you!"
"You did what with your glasses and the sloth?"

The regulars are chatty and friendly. 

Overall if your looking for something to sop up your booze or make you smile sconily it's worth a stop in.

OMG. The scones! They're definitely not what I expected (British type), but more like Indian fry bread...but whatever, they are FANTASTIC. I also had a scramble -- awesome. Ingredients seem fresh, food was hot, service was efficient and friendly. The scones are one-of-a-kind, and will keep me coming back foreverrrrr!

Francesca's is exactly what Lakeview was missing.  A great, easy, casual place with amazing quality food!  I have been about 3 or 4 times already and I have been completely happy every time.  What's so great about it?  The sandwiches and burgers are just done really well.  The quality of the meat used is very obviously a notch above the rest.  Big Sandwiches, great flavors!
What to get?  The meatball sandwich is amazing.  The meatballs are perfect.  Tender, and the sauce is great!  Reuben is amazing!  Italian Sub is great!  Fried Grouper Sandwich is great!  Really good Burger (just upgraded from 8 to 10oz)...a big juicy, flavorful beef patty!  Frips?!?! When I read about Frips (something in between a french fry and a chip), I thought they sounded dumb...like why not just have regular french fries?  But the Frips are great!  Imagine a wide steak fry sliced thinner so its crispy.  I kinda prefer them to regular fries now.  After 4 visits, I feel like there is still more to try...and I can't wait.  I have my eye on the Boudreaux Pizza next! (pulled pork).  Prices are totally reasonable (despite one negative review about a $17 turkey sandwich.  I don't know what happened there, but there is no $17 turkey sandwich on the menu...so I wouldn't put much stock in that review)...and I definitely wouldn't waste my time ordering a turkey sandwich with all of the other amazing options to choose from.   If you can't tell, this is my new favorite place!  Try it and enjoy!

The Legend - roast pork and BBQ shrimp stuffed in hollowed out poboy bread.   Flavor is delicious. The only thing that kept me from giving 5 stars is the lack of texture in the sandwich. The pork, bread and shrimp are all soft.  The portion is huge so I'm taking my other half home and will make crostinis and use the sandwich filling as a spread. Mom has the Cajun Cuban. Also great. This one has flavor and texture. Staff were friendly. We will def be back!!

Went here with three other friends and had a myriad of foods. Grouper Sandwhich, Oysta Po Boy, Frip and Pamento Cheese, and you HAVE TO try the signature pizza, the Francesca. It has Prosciutto, Capricola, Salami, fresh basil, and fresh fruit (yes fruit!) I was skeptical about the fruit at first but it was rather good. Also, don't miss out on their daily food specials. Today (Friday) was a special Shrimp Alfredo and when I saw it come out on the plate I became so disappointed with myself for not noticing the daily meals earlier that I vowed to come back one day to try it. Gotta check this place out. Was very busy so not a place for those thinking it will be quick. Or maybe try going at a different hour of the day.

My wife and I stopped by for lunch and were really impressed! We split the grouper sandwich, the everybody loves Raymond sandwich(pastrami cheese coleslaw on marble rye) and an order of the frips which was a new word for me but they were awesome! We will definitely be going back to try the pizza and burgers which also looked great!

I had a great lunch here just a few days after the initial opening. I ordered the Boudreaux pizza which was packed with huge chunks of pork and garlic and covered in spinach. It was one of my favorite pizzas I've ever tried (and I LOVE pizza)! You order at the counter and the food is brought to your table. Even though mine was a pizza, which obviously took time to bake, it came relatively quickly. Staff people checked on us several times to see if we were enjoying our meal. Is definitely recommend next time you're strolling down Harrison.

Stopped by on a Saturday got lunch.  The meatball sub was legit and the Italian sub was also good that we traded them back and forth trying to decide what was better!  Always great to see Scot as well.  He was working the line to help execute his vision then popped out front to say "Hi" to people.  Can't wait to go back.

This place is delicious! Grouper sandwich, truffle Mac n cheese and potato salad did not disappoint! More amazing stuff by Scot Craig! The inside is super clean and new. It has a really nice local deli feel and the service is excellent.
Katie's is a must stop while in New Orleans.  Favorite things to order are the oysters slessinger and the blackberry jalapeño ribs.  Casual atmosphere.
Really, really good. We split The Legend poboy and while the sandwich was very good, the frips stole the show. Will definitely come back to try some of their other offerings.

Best pizza I have ever had.

I don't normally write reviews about restaurants but this pizza was so amazing that I decided to. The crust is awesome and perfectly crispy, and you could tell that all the ingredients are fresh. We got the seafood and meat lovers pizzas, and we all agreed that it was the best pizza we've ever tasted.

Nice new restaurant smell. Decided to try it. Glad to see this location making a comeback. Upon arriving we walked in and looked around. It's an order at the counter deli style place. We were greeted with a smile and I ordered a 1/2 of a Muffaletta and Charla got a Shrimp PoBoy. We also ordered some Frips with Pimento Cheese. So we went and got our drinks and sat down. Our food came out promptly. The Muff was right up there with the best in the city and Charla's shrimp PoBoy was stuffed full of shrimp.  She couldn't finish it all. We both left full and will definitely be back. Some folks at a different table had ordered pizza and it looked absolutely delicious as did the meatball PoBoy.

Stopped here for lunch yesterday because Katie's was doing some renovations. As expected, it didn't disappoint! Only think holding it back from being a 5 is the fries didn't hold the heat. Great when they first hit the table but quickly cooled.
Great first visit though and I'll definitely be back!

Had the grouper sandwich today, and it was by far the best grouper sandwich I have had to date. Many people say this place is a little expensive, but honestly, I would much rather pay an extra few dollars to get quality AND quantity. Keep up the great work yall! I'll definitely be back!!

Not a pleasant experience. I do NOT recommend this place at all. We had hot pot, and they didn't even cut off the root of the spinach! I don't know about other dishes, but for hot pot the price is not appropriate to the portion size at all. They claimed on the menu the base was bone soup, but when we asked to add soup they said they only got hot water to add. What? The waiter was very inexperienced and he didn't add any soup at the end. He didn't even clean up the empty plates. Btw, for my taste, all sauces have been added water to it. The sesame sauce does not taste like traditional Chinese sesame sauce at all. The beef in the picture is about 2/3 of the portion ($6)

I still haven't got my food. I have been playing Minecraft for the past 40 minutes and nothing except water. In fact I had to drink out of another kids water because I have not got my own. I just want to eat, man. But that's okay because I learns how to do laundry for a elephant so I am sort of happy with that. I just want my dim sung

This is a good, solid restaurant where you can order anything on the menu and it will taste great. They specialize in hotpot, but there are so many other great dishes that we haven't had time to try. The decor is no frills but the restaurant is clean and tables nicely spaced out. Service could be improved as they are usually understaffed. This place gets crowded when Wash U is in session.

Went for the hotpot today with our friends.  I had saw they did hot pot here when I last ate here with my folks.

Now if it was not for my folks describing where it was, I  would have no idea this place was a restaurant since I do not know how to read Chinese.  So unless you are fluent in reading the language you will past this right by.  You might not even know to find this on Yelp because no where outside does it say Tang Palace.  Anyway on the corner of Olive and Grant, across from Luu Luu's.

So first time having hotpot at this place.  Each little sides was about $3, $4, or $5 depending on the item.  I had asked if we get refills on the item since the plates was quite small for what they charge.  The waiter's English was not so good and he kept saying yes you can order more.  So I  have a feeling it cost more if you need a top up.  Our meal cost us a little over $124 (4 adults and 3 small kids that did not really ate). We split this with our friends, but still pricey for Hotpot.  Would not be a bad price if the portions on the sides was better.  But sometimes you dine out because of the convenience of not cooking and cleaning and to give you the opportunity to enjoy your company.  

The veggie was fresh, the meat could be better because it was big frozen chunks. Sauce was delicious and the waiter help show me a traditional sauce that they eat with.  Now I had been eating hot pot since I was in my diapers and never had I seen sauces like these. Maybe it was because my family is a Vietnamese/Cantonese influence. But the sauces with the hot pot is the cherry on top.  They have a house special shrimp paste that is more like a spongy block. Sounds and looks odd but it was a crowd pleaser and super yummy. 

The hot pot hit the spot for us. I would rate it a five star rating if the portion was bigger.  I think the portion would of been fine if I was just dinning with my spouse. But not for 4 adults.  Kids did not really ate to count them. All in all I would recommend this to another person who love hot pot or wants to try it.  It might be cheaper or more expensive depending on what sides you want to cook in the pot. We choose quite a few things. We were all extremely full and satisfied.  I would definitely come back for another leisure night or brunch. Hope this review helps you.

I've eaten their food 4 times -- 2 dine ins, 2 take outs.
Each time it took at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour for food to show up, despite the place being almost empty.
Resulted in 4 episodes of diarrhea.
One time the waitress (or owner) sneezed while carrying my bowl of noodles, and she had the guts to calmly set it on my table without saying a word.

Went here Sunday around noon.  There were a few tables seated, including a 10 top.  After seating us, the waitress told us that the kitchen was backed up so it was going to be slow.  I appreciated the honesty, but thought it was odd since the place was maybe 25% full.  She said we shouldn't order dumplings because of the wait, so we got the ribs and noodle soup.  Ribs were tough, overly sweet and lukewarm.  Duck noodle soup had zero flavor - broth tasted like water, no seasoning, and only a couple pieces of boc choy.  Duck had no flavor either and still had bones in.  Overall very bland and tasteless.  Maybe the dumplings are good, I have no idea because kitchen couldn't handle it, but everything we had was bad.

This is the least place I would recommend to eat in Olive. Ok, I will give 2 stars cause one time I had a great lunch, but today is the worst experience by the waitress attitude. I used to have a good experience with an old guy waitress and he gave me a good service and good food which recommended by him. Today, the middle-aged lady who wears white hat and sneakers treat me like garbage. I was trying to understand her because her ability to speak English is very limited, but her attitude drives me CRAZY. First, I was asking her suggestion and she was grumbling and rolling her eyes on me. Second, I was going to get a chili sauce, and she forbid me to get my own chili (I just took 1 small spoon of chili and she's panicked, so what if I like spicy food?). Third, she doesn't know how to behave as a waitress. I'm sorry, but she's clearly ruined my lunch mood that supposed to be a good experience, but became the worst experience I've ever had. The food is standard, nothing special. There's a plenty restaurants to eat with good service except this one.

I rarely write any negative reviews on the Internet, especially bad comments on the food, because such experiences are very subjective. Sharing my unsatisfactory experience with the public is unfair to the business owner.  But I really can't hold myself this time.

If you are just looking for food reviews, you can skip the rest of this post.

Six of us had a meal at Tang Palace recently and split the bill.  The middle-aged woman of Tang Palace got back, telling us one of our credit cards was rejected and asked for another credit card or cash.  I glanced at my credit card receipt and noticed the price was overcharged by 20%.  Same things happened to the other 4 credit cards as well.  I asked the woman if the gratitude was included because it was pretty common adding 18+% gratitude automatically for big groups in this area.  She said no.

It took her quite a while to confirm this was indeed a problem.

We later left the restaurant.  One of our friends brought up that she also had had this problem at Tang Palace.  We couldn't tell if these are just honest mistakes.

Tang Palace was closed for a month or so and only just recently opened back up--they are still working out some kinks as a result, so my friends and I were disappointed to learn that hotpot wouldn't be available until Thursday (8/10). We ended up ordering several items off the menu to share family style.

Service was slow, and the food took over half an hour to arrive, including appetizers. I wonder if there is only one person working the kitchen.

The food was good though--definitely the real deal, if you're concerned about authenticity, which generally isn't an issue on this stretch of Olive.

Mouthwatering chicken with spicy sauce - This was pretty good, although quite oily.
Shanghai style wontons (12) - A wonton soup. The wontons had some kind of chives in them and the flavor was refreshing, although the broth was kind of bland. Just regular chicken broth, I think.
Braised meatballs with vegetables - 4 large meatballs on a bed of bokchoy. These were so flavorful and one of my favorite dishes.
Mapo tofu - Not very spicy, but very good.
Shanghai style rice cakes with shredded pork - the shredded pork was good and had good flavor, but this dish was mostly greasy rice cakes that were slightly bland.
Some other spicy chicken dish - This came with chunks of jalapenos or some other pepper that packed heat. Not my favorite, but it was decent.

We had trouble getting anyone's attention to get more rice or water, and I think I saw a tiny cockroach crawling down the wall, so take that as you will... Food tasted good though.
Solid hotspot. Good prices, high quality. Was very authentic and service was great too. A classic 'Mom and pop' joint that should not be ignored.

what a "nice" price! Bad service! We wanna add more soup into our hot pot. Nobody did it even until the end. I don't know why they got such high rating on Yelp, but I didn't like it at all. The taste was horrible, and I myself can make a much better soup base. I don't think the base is bone soup as they claimed on menu.

Great little neighborhood gem! Authentic food served in a no frills space. I've eaten here 4 times so far in 2018. The Hot Pot is a great option for a group of 3 or more and there is a great selection of fresh food to cook in the delicious broth. I recommend getting the 3 sectioned Hot Pot to enjoy a variety. My favorite apps are the spicy wontons and the Xiao Long Bao (Shanghai Soup dumplings). Hand made, these are exceptional and I order them every time. The spicy won tons are steamed, generously filled, silky, and swimming in a nice hot chili oil/sauce. They put peanuts on top but don't mention them in the menu, so if you're allergic to peanuts beware! I make sure to order without peanuts and let them know I'm allergic. Other great items I've tried are the Salt & Pepper Tofu, Wonton Soup, a chicken dish served on a little flame (don't remember the name, sorry), and Mapo Tofu. All are delicious. Note: There is a cart of condiments to the right of the cash register for you to help yourself. There is an older gentleman that waits tables and he's much more personable than the younger man. I look forward to trying more dishes on my next visit, but will order the soup dumplings & spicy wontons for apps every time!

I've been coming here for quite a bit and have never doubted their service. From day one, Breve has always laughed in the face of hordes of tourists, loft-dwellers, and cranky corporate drones, all jonesing for their cup of joe. I've always gotten my order on time and with great service.

There's not a whole lot of things to say about this place, other than the fact that they tend to have more coffee flavors to offer than, say, Starbucks and Bread Co. They also have a very relaxing atmosphere, where you can spend your breakfast (or lunch) time reading one of the many papers set out for your reading pleasure.

The sandwiches here are reasonably priced and are very filling. It's nice to grab a bite here if you're on the go, since it beats waiting for your beeper to go off at one of the bigger coffee sources.

However, I suggest making sure your parking meter is sufficiently loaded. I've seen the meter maids hover around like vultures to carrion.
Breve Espresso ha great coffee and their sandwiches are wonderful as well! I miss working downtown because I can't go there anymore!

It is located inside the AT&T building.
The coffee was ok.  I didn't order anything to eat.
There was a slight smell of  old/burnt food in the place. 
I was not feeling it.
Permanently closed. The AT&T building is being vacated and this location has closed and will not reopen. Breve website needs to be updated as they show this location as still opened.

This place is so convenient because it's on the ground floor of my office. I often hit it up for breakfast bagel sandwich (yum) and tea. While my breakfast sandwich is always delicious the wait time leaves much to be desired. Now this did take place awhile back, two times in one month my order got "lost" between the front and back. After 20 minutes I was informed they were just starting my sandwich and offered me a free bottled water as a sorry. Not really acceptable to me.  Even without this, you will definitely wait for anything that requires cooking. If you are in a rush I strongly suggest calling ahead to place your order. If they happen to have cinnamon rolls in stock, buy one. Nuke it for a few seconds and it's very decadent.
Excellent paninis. Great, friendly service. All of the food I've had is good, but I'm definitely in a panini rut.  I average 1 a week for the past 5 months!
Chicken Panini was delicious. coffee was great. the soup i believe was red pepper it was good too.
Fast service and good food. The people who work here are super friendly too. A good place to grab a quick lunch.

The coffee was OK, the lady behind the counter was very kind, and the selection looks pretty awesome although I didn't get any food... However it's not a comfortable coffee setting; with cafeteria style tables and chairs and a location inside of a major office building that's difficult to get to. I will not be coming back.
Excellent coffee and panini sandwiches. Staff is quite friendly. Holly who makes the fancy coffees early in the morning is a hoot!

Yummy burritos and nachos! Less expensive than Moe's and I think just as good. They do not have tofu but vegetarian black beans and brown rice. One downfall no liquor license but Dunderbacks is next door so can't really complain!

A healthier version of Chipotle/Qdoba/Moe's?! Can it be?! YES!! I recently tried this restaurant with my sister and her fiancé. All three of us enjoyed it.

The restaurant it set up exactly like the other burrito chains--you walk in and order your burrito Subway-style. Machismo's offers several types of tortillas; I opted for the jalapeno cheddar tortilla (a healthier wheat option is available). I had it stuffed with brown rice (nice!), black beans, steak, chipotle queso (slight additional charge), jalapenos, sour cream, cheese, and lettuce. The meal included chips and salsa. It was about the same price as the other burrito chains--like seven or eight bucks.

Huge bonus points: the selection of hot sauces. It definitely reminded me of Tijuana Flat's selection of sauces--more than thirty options. Impressive.

More bonus points: there's a cool eating challenge here. For $25, you can get a FIVE POUND burrito. If you eat it within an hour, then you get a free shirt and your picture on the wall--and a refund of your $25. If you fail to finish all five pounds of the burrito, then you still get a shirt and your photo on the wall... but they keep your $25. As of last Sunday, no one had taken the challenge yet.

I had a little chat with one of the co-owners while he was making my burrito. Apparently there are several of these restaurants in Pennsylvania and Virginia. This is the first one in Florida and they're looking to expand. I asked how many customers had taken the five-pound burrito challenge up north--out of several hundred attempts, only four people have managed to down all five pounds within an hour. CRAZY!!

Considering that this little restaurant is boldly attempting to compete with the dominant burrito chains, has an awesome selection of hot sauces, and promotes eating five pound burritos, I'm going to give this a five star rating. Well done, Machismo. I'll be seeing you again soon.

Based on the good reviews I decided to give this place a try. I walked in at 12:30...not a soul in sight (not a good sign). I was greeted by a pleasant fellow who seemed a bit confused and most unsure of himself. I mentioned to him that I had found the place on Yelp...no clue. I asked how was the food...no answer. I then asked if he was the owner, at which point he mentioned that he had started 3 weeks ago.

I ordered the special since a Burrito with drink and chips for 6 bucks was hard to pass up. The burrito was smaller than a Chipotle burrito but for 6 bucks I'm not going to complain. My complaint is with the taste, or rather lack thereof. The chicken was flavorless and undercooked. The tortilla tasted old and was tough to chew. I decide to try my drink....water with some raspberry flavoring rather than the raspberry Iced tea I had poured for myself.

On a positive note, the chips were flavorful...the salsa NOT. Suffice it tosay I will not be returning.

Well, rats!  I was hoping to be first to review.  So glad to see everyone calling it 5 star.   This small joint is the Mexican version of Subway-fresh, filling, and fewer calories.

Select one of six flavored tortillas.  I chose jalapeno cheddar.  They warm it.  Load it with your basic fave--brown beans, black beans, chicken, steak, pork, tofu crumbles--or today they started fish.  I chose beans.  Now layer in the fixin's.....guac, salsa medium, onions, black olives, corn, green peppers were my choices.  Top with cheese, romaine lettuce, cilantro.  Dare the guy to fold it (ha, he does every time).  It's a two-fisted sandwich.  They boast 38 hot sauces if you wish to add flavor--mine didn't need it.  You get a few chips and some salsa on the side.  The chips were great for mopping up burrito explosion spillage.  They''re a Pepsi place so I chose agua $1.25.  The hearty eater might choose their tres leche cake dessert.  I couldn't "go there". ha    The ginormous burrito was only $6.  You can choose to get it as a "bowl".  You can also choose tacos at $2 a pop.  They have two kinds of rice, queso, quesadillas.  This place is amazing for healthy eaters, healthful eaters,  Mexican lovers, and simply pigs! LOL    You leave with a little sting on the tongue and a desire for more.  They cater, deliver, and have a freebie punch card.

I was really excited to try this place, but it was a big disappointment. The meats are boiled and stored in water. They actually charge you .75 to add cheese! The menu is very uninformative , it doesn't explain what comes with your burrito, it doesn't even list a kids option. I didn't even know they had fish tacos until I had ordered and sat down. The burrito was very bland and boring, It tasted like water with salsa. I will give the salsa a thumbs up! The seating is very limited and if its slow, be prepared to be awkwardly stared at by the people behind the counter. I'll stick to Moe's and California tacos.

This place was pretty good for the price. The special was a chicken burrito chips and a drink for $6. The burrito was huge and you get like 10 chips with a more than modest helping of the pico. 

Best thing to have is add the cilantro to your burrito. Plus the pico was some of the best pico I have ever had. However, it's got a little kick so be ready. 

Over all pretty good. I give 3 stars because it's not quite Qdoba or Chipotle.

I hate to have to leave a rating, especially only one star, when i haven't eaten here, but Yelp for iPad doesn't have quick Tips.

We drove 20 mikes to try this place, arriving at 8 pm on a Saturday and they were closed!  Their hours don't match what Yelp says, so beware and call first.

The manager was really nice and helped us pick out what to get. Also they have a ton of different hot sauces. It was better than chipotle burritos but they only have three different meat types. If you are into toppings and different tortillas go here.

We are from AZ and are visiting friends in DE and decided to stop by Mazzellas for dinner. It was delicious! The portions are large (enough for two to share) but you can order 1/2 portions. Bread and butter was provided as soon as we sat down. There were 2 different kinds of bread and they were great! We ordered full order of manicotti (3 tubes), 1/2 order of gnocchi sorrento, 2 shells w/4 meatballs, a slice of pizza, kids penne w/butter and we were not disappointed! I would strongly recommend this restaurant to everyone!
Hands down the best pizza in the entire area. Soooooo yummy. I hate red sauce and theirs is phenomenal!! Love this place!!

Love Mazzellas! This is our go to place at least one a week for dinner. Everything is good and the portions are enough for two and include salad or soup and homemade bread. The service is great and everyone is friendly. Some of our favorites are the eggplant sandwich, Penne Vodka, Chicken Parm, and Spaghetti and Clams. Also great pizza! All at reasonable prices.

I had the Shrimp & Scallops Parmigiana with Linguine and it was delicious. The portion was very large and had a generous amount of seafood. There were a bunch of small bay shrimp, several scallops and a few large shrimp, a perfect portion. The service was also fantastic, very efficient. The food came out in a decent amount of time considering we were there during the dinner rush. Nothing was needed because we received everything! Will definitely be back and recommend. I liked the atmosphere as well and the staff and customers were very friendly.

Food was just OK. They give a lot but there many better Italian places. Pizza was not great.Service was very slow and our waitress was the PITTS! Training will not help her. I better not name her but She should be known as miss ATTITUDE!!!  Meeting her assures there will be no return visit. Oh yes the picture reminds me of the packet of KENS dressing thrown right in the middle of my Salad,which was such a nice touch!
Food very good I get the pizza very good sometimes it a lil grease with the pep, but very good and the wings are good as well
Great food and if you enjoy it, try the Penne Vodka, its amazing.

This place has the BEST penne vodka! For the past few years this has been our go to place for family dinner outings. The portions are outrageously big! A meal lasts my husband a few days and trust me that says a lot. If you're going for dinner try and get there early because parking can sometimes be a nightmare.

They are usually pretty good but completely messes up my takeout order. Veal Marsala (an unusually small portion) was given with spaghetti and red sauce, yuck!  Also, I ordered angel hair pasta instead of spaghetti. They forgot the dressing for my salad as well. Check your takeout order before you leave!

This place is yummy!!  Very homey and relaxed!!  The food is very good, the antipasto is very good, we get it chopped!!  I had the Gnocchi Sorento and it was cheesy, saucy good!!  The cheese ravioli were good and plentiful!!  My only complaint, the garlic bread needs more garlic!!

Happened to stop by this place for lunch with my niece while I was getting an oil change! I've been hearing a lot about this restaurant for a long time so I was excited to check it out! First off the menu was full of a large variety of different options which was impressive! We ended up settling on the fettuccine Alfredo for myself and the chicken finger kid meal for my niece. We also order an appetizer of garlic bread. Both of our meals were delicious and we really got our money's worth. They serve pretty large portions which works for us cause we love leftovers! 

I really only had two cons. First, I really didn't like the garlic bread that was served. It was very hard and didn't have that fresh garlic flavor. Secondly, t seemed like the staff were really rushed. Don't get me wrong the staff were phenomenal and kind and attentive, I just worry that during lunch rush there might not be quite enough staff. 

I will definitely be back to try out more of the menu!

Probably the best pizza in North Wilmington.  I only order take out, so I can't comment on the experience when you eat in.  The pizza is just the right crust thickness and the sauce and cheese are perfect.  Lasagna is without a doubt the best around.  The only down side - and it's minor- is that parking can be a hassle sometimes.  The parking lot can get crazy.  But it's worth it.
Highly recommended.

. I would normally give it five stars, but the pizza has changed the last few times I've been there. There are fewer toppings (altho still more than other places), and there was barely any sauce on it.  The onions were raw, not cooked with the pizza.  The antipasta is great, and so is their spaghetti sauce.
I love this pizza so much.. well all of their food.. The staff are wonderful and they burn my pizza the way I like it.. Just look at the lunch specials.. I look forward to Thursday's.. Lolol
I have to admit I only go for pizza. But it is the best pizza around. Have only eaten in restaurant 2 times, meals good both times. A little dark and dated inside. But again pizza great.

Ok - I admit it - I can be a snob when it comes to Italian cuisine - particularly southern. But the seafood linguini that I had here last Saturday evening was a feast.  The pasta was perfectly cooked - not over or under - but perfect. The sauce was seasoned very well and had a nice spice, generating a little heat over time - very nice.  The scallops were good and the shrimp excellent (having lived in FL for five years I was spoiled by the Mayport shrimp) but these were flavorful and stood up to the sauce well.  But most impressive was the crab meat generously and strategically mixed in.  Excellent.  

The only reason I did not give 5 stars was that my wife's stuffed shells were okay - not great - but okay.  The other point was that they were noticeably slow to seat us in spite of available tables. The service overall once we were seated was very good.  

We will be back.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant. The food is excellent! The service is very good too! I Gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because we don't like the bread that is served . We would love them to get some good Italian bread! My favorite is the seafood rose' penne! Delicious every time !

Penne vodka and the eggplant Parmesan sandwich are amazing. 

Ask for the fresh garlic in the oil with your bread. They don't give a sauce with the bread... just butter and there is oil at the table. Also ask for it first. It takes a while for them to make/bring.

If you are looking for a good restaurant that gives you a great amount of food for a inexpensive price, this is the place to go! They are all friendly, helpful and professional when they are waiting your table. Never had an issue when I go there. The best part is if there was a mistake with your order, the cook won't hesitate to correct it asap! Must go!

The place doesn't have much atmosphere, but it sure smelled good when we walked inside.  They seem to do a great take out pizza business.

I ordered the chicken parm, which came with spaghetti and red sauce.  The chicken was a huge piece of breaded goodness.  The red sauce was just ok, and the spaghetti had been sitting in water WAY too long (ie: nasty).  Love the chicken part though.

My friend ordered stuffed shells, and he said the filling was kind of gritty, and could have used an egg (give that a whirl guys, and do a taste test).

You will get bread while you're waiting, and it will be warm, which I find preferable to other places which serve cold bread with cold butter.

I will come back, and try a pizza, the next time I'm in town.
Omg! The vodka sauce is amazing...the crab and shrimp dish was full of seafood.  going back tonight.

I went here one time after visiting a friends church. He recommended it & his pastor. But it's a good amount of food for what you  get & worth every penny. But I wish I had one closer. I'm not really a big fan of Italian food but this Italian food was amazing. I could see myself going back here again.

I must tell you that I had a very bad experience at this place.   The way one employee spoke to me was rude and unprofessional.  It's unfortunate that the owner or manager was not there.   Whatever you do,  do not compliment the waitresses there or be friendly with them.  I was eating there to much anyway let's see what the owner does.  Justin your young and immature let's see how you do in business. Because of you your boss lost 3 customers.

The food and service are great. I recommend this place to my friends and family. I have so many favorite dishes but the ones I order the most are chicken parm and baked ziti. The only 2 cons I have are that I wish they served freshly made in house pasta and I don't like how they put the dressing package on top of your salad. It should be placed on the table next to your food because who knows how many people touched the dressing pouch or if it was on the floor before it touched your freshly prepared salad.
The food here is so good. I go here for take out and have not been disappointed.  There entree portion size are large and tasty.

Found this gem by mistake...Thought it was just a takeout pizza parlor with a small restaurant. OMG, we're we mistaken. Very family friendly restaurant, does have a small bar, booths and tables. Food is as incredible as their prices. And don't expect to leave without a doggie bag. Get there early because it hard to find parking  and it get crowded every night. They also have a takeout restaurant if you just want to grab your meal to go. This restaurant is hard to miss unless your looking for it, but if you like good Italian make sure you stop by. Don't forget to order the calamari, it's fantastic!

One of the BEST restaurants I have been to. I come here every time I come to Wilmington. The penne vodka (without the bacon since I am Vegetarian) is the best thing in the world. They even had samplers of chocolate covered canolis which were amazing. Their eggplant parmesan and wings are delicious and their pizza is a bit over priced but tases great as well!  Highly recommend!!
The best Italian food in Claymont. Fresh crispy salad, warm bread and enough food for 2 to 3 meals. Seriously try it.

My husband and I are regular customers at Mazzella's! The food is phenomenal & come in huge portions! The staff are always friendly and helpful in every way possible! Mazzella's is our go to place for special occasions too! The catering menu is so easy to understand and place an order! Enjoy your time here!

Mazzellas is our go to Italian restaurant when I'm not in the mood to cook and want a nice meal in a laidback, casual atmosphere. The staff are super friendly and the service is very efficient. I'm obsessed with their eggplant rollatini, tortellini mare (with crab and shrimp), and lasagna. So good! You can't get a bad meal here and they do excellent take out as well. My pizza favorites are the spinach-tomato-ricotta and their cheese. They also sell pizza by the slice. The portions are huge and entrees come with soup/salad and bread. The parking lot can be a pain to get in and out of but I suppose that's the price you have to pay for good food. Highly recommend!

Order for a office party....so it was a big order with 3 X 16'' of 4 varieties of chicken and veggie pizzas....each of them was awesome!!..There were no leftovers....thought should have ordered more!!

Complimentary Additions Provided:-
Jalapeno's on the side
Plates
Glasses for coke
Napkins
Fork/Knife

Very thoughtful!! And well prized. Much better than Papa Johns or Pizza Hut!!

Keep up the Good Quality
Their pizza is AWESOME. We just moved to the area and I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.

Mazzellas is my "go-to" pizza place, but their real claim to fame are their portions of their entrees. My fiancee and I stop in on occasion for dinner when money is tight. We know that ordering dinner at Mazzellas meant that we'd have enough left over for a late-night snack, as well as for lunch tomorrow. I've never seen anyone finish a plate before. Lamberti's Cucina is it not, but it's great for a weeknight.

The decor isn't so hot, and it is located in a little strip mall with a tax place, a wawa, and a chinese takeout place - but don't let that fool you. It's decent food, cheap, and you get a *ton* of it. 

Pictures of some of the various times I've been there are available here:
http://www.thisiswhatimeating.com/2010/06/05/dinner-from-mazzellas/

http://www.thisiswhatimeating.com/2010/07/07/pizza-2/

Love the food here. My wife and I have 3 young kids so we always have done take out so I can't speak on the eating in experience. As for the food, everything is delicious! You honestly can't go wrong no matter what you get. Great place if on a budget since the portions are so big my wife and I always get a full portion and split it. One of my favorites is the penne primavera, a meatless meal, and I'm a guy who believes meat should be in every meal, and who never eats eggplant, except in this meal. Best Italian around.

My favorite plate here is the Lasagna. I like their pizza hot and crispy. The portions are nice and the prize is not bad. Service is pretty consistent . I have seen the same servers for the last four years. I line that , gives me some sense of consistency.
I wish they had a promotional point system along with delivery.
Best service around, the food is great too! Ask to sit in Pamela's section.

Ordered a large pie half sausage. The ingredients are of great quality! However, the pizza is a bit undercooked for my taste. After the first slice I popped the remaining slices in the oven for 15 min & they came out delicious. Can't wait to try the pasta.

This place was recommended to me by my roommate and it is always very busy every time I'm in the shopping center so I have been here a few times to check it out for myself. The place itself is nice enough and the staff is very friendly. The food is reasonably priced and the portions are huge. I've had the penne vodka a couple times and it's pretty good. Not amazing by any means but good. I've also had the pizza twice but that unfortunately is not that good in my opinion. The crust is pretty good. It's soft which I like. The cheese and sauce however are kind of gross for lack of a better word. I'm from New York and I think I know pizza and this just isn't there strong suit. Not a bad place but not not the greatest. You do get a lot of bang for your buck here though.

Huge portions, so so service, microwaved bread and salad dressings served in their packages. Not much garlic or other seasonings. Next time, if there is a next time, I'll stick to the pizza and lunch specials.
Vodka sauce is amazing. Huge portions so you have 2 meals for one. Pizza ok, crab shrimp pasta was full of seafood. Parking sucks.

I eat here very frequently and get take, as I only live a 3 miles away. There pizza is delicious and so is most of there pasta dishes. The staff is very friendly even being that they're so busy sometimes with takeout you can't get through the door. The only reason I can't give them 5 stars and it isn't really there fault is it's  location. There isn't enough parking at all. Sometimes your forced to park on the shoulder of philadelphia pike and just have to be careful getting in and out of your car.  They do so much business they deserve there own building with their own parking. Will post pictures next time I eat there
Great for a date night or a family outing. I love their white pizza, I have had a lot of white pizzas and the one I had here was definitely in the top three.

Mazzellas is the the restaurant our family always chooses when we want to go out casually, and get a delicious, hearty meal without spending a small fortune.  Both the food and the service are consistently good. The wait staff is always friendly and attentive, and well informed about the items on the menu. We tend to order the same dishes over and over again because they're so good!  We particularly enjoy the eggplant parmesan, the baked gnocchi, the chicken alfredo, and the clams with marinara sauce. The only area in which I've noticed room for improvement is their homemade bread, which while always nice and chewy, is often very dry and a little stale tasting. The entrees are the stars here, though, and the large portions always yield enough for a leftovers lunch the next day!

Way too much sauce! Not at all what I expected based on the reviews. The aurora sauce taste like tomato soup. Everything had the same taste because all you could taste was the sauce. They charge $5.00 for additional sauce which may be the reason the entire plate is covered but new customers should be warned. I've been waiting to try this place for awhile but definitely not impressed at all. The garlic knots were great and our server was sweet as pie. We ordered the ravioli granchio and ravioli with shrimp, mushrooms, and crab which was the special for the night.

We have been in the mood for a really good pizza.  Hubby is from New York so he can be very picky when it comes to pizza.  When we lived in Claymont we ordered from Sciarrino's all the time we loved there pizza but since we moved we haven't ordered from there because they don't deliver where we moved to plus it's out of the way for us to pick it up.  We have tried several local pizza places and we just haven't found a place that makes a really good pizza.  I'm sorry to say Mazzellas pizza was not any better.  I really had high hopes from all the good reviews and seeing the pictures plus the parking lot is always packed when we drive by but was disappointed when we finally ordered a pizza from here.  

To start with when I called they didn't have any pizza specials. When looking at their menu a large pizza is $12.50 and each extra topping is $1.75 so to get pepperoni and mushrooms the pizza would have been $17 when they have a combo pizza with six toppings for $19.  So I went with the combo I got extra pepperoni, extra mushroom, extra cheese and bacon to get the six toppings.  When hubby got home with the pizza the toppings were off the part of the pizza because there was way to much.  Trying to get a slice out was impossible because the center was so soggy everything just fell off.  By the time you got it on the plate it was a pile of pizza not a slice.  Had to eat it with a fork and knife.  It just wasn't a good pizza in appearance or taste we ended up throwing over half the pizza away.
