I know from looking at the pizza the sogginess was from the extra toppings but I couldn't see paying $17 for just two toppings.  I just can't justify paying $17 when I can go to Little Caesar's and get two deep dish pepperoni pizzas which aren't that bad for less then one pizza at Mazellas.  I would really like to try a basic pepperoni and mushroom pizza from here if they ever have a pizza special.

This is my "Go To" restaraunt for amazingly delicious food and great service. From take out pizza (my absolute fave in the area) to reserving the banquet area for a special occasion and everything in between...I am a huge fan of Mazellas. I've been coming to this local spot for over 15 years and have NEVER had a bad experience. Hands down, my  favorite dish is the Arrabiatta Penne...extra spicy.  They give you so much food I always have enough to share or a second meal.  I pick this up frequently when I need to "bring a dish" and everyone loves it! It comes with salad and delicious bread (made right on the premises). You cannot beat the price!!! The service is always pleasant and quick (Tip: call ahead for the quickest service).  I have seen the same staff there for YEARS...which speaks volumes!!! As well giving young people their first job at the take out counter. Not only are they like family...they treat their regulars like family too...which makes me love this place even more. The owner, comes over to speak whenever he's there and the manager is always pleasant. (Also, check out the chicken cheese steak stromboli....DELICIOUS!!!). Mazellas is, hands down, my favorite Italian restaurant in the Wilmington area.
This is by far the best Italian restaurant in the area. The chicken Oscar is off the chart the soups are phenomenal the pizza is great the portions are outstanding
We went to Mazella's for my Birthday and we loved it. The portions were huge. The staff was friendly and we will definitely  be going back!!!

Wow!! Recently discovered this great Italian restaurant after reading other positive reviews on yelp, and I can't agree more.  In fact, we loved the place so much, we went back the very next night.

The first thing you will notice as you look around the restaurant is that most every table is full.  This is always a great sign.  As you watch plates of food being delivered, you will be blown away by how good everything looks and the size of the dinners, HUGE!  The menu has a great selection of pasta, chicken, veal, and seafood dishes.  Also lots of appetizers and salads to choose from. Plenty of wines to compliment any dinner.  Finally, make sure to save room for dessert.  You can't go wrong with any of their 10 super yummy desserts.  The dinner prices are very reasonable for the quality of food and portion size.

The servers are very friendly and always hustling about.   Great service on both of our visits!

This is also a great place for takeout.  We noticed a steady stream of customers coming in for takeout.  Their pizza's are enormous and looked really good.  Also noticed lots of folks taking dinners to go.    

They are located in a strip shopping center next to a Wawa and Pep Boys just a few miles off I95, very easy to find.  Parking can be a minor inconvenience on the weekends as the lot is rather small, so you may have to walk a little bit, buy hey, that helps work up a good appetite.

Mazzellas is our new favorite Italian restaurant and we will be coming back with friends.

My favorite Italian! 
I always order the same meal and it is always the same. Our family comes back often and have always enjoyed it.
Great food with large portions, and they always expect and anticipate that you will take some home.

A solid local option for italian food. Eat in or take out, the pizza is pretty good, with a solid New York style thin crust it might be the best go to option in North Wilmington to get a decent slice. The pasta dishes are also pretty good, and the prices are reasonable. Definitely don't go out of your way to eat here, but if you're out of luck on trying to get pizza in Wilmington, give Mazzella's a try. 

I know a lot of people that live in Bellefonte and love this place that aren't on yelp and would probably give it a 4 or 5, so give it a shot, maybe you'll also really enjoy it.
At first glance, this looks like your average Italian place. But the portions are enough for at least two meals and they have some of the best penne vodka, I've ever had.

Come here for the pizza. Subs are just OK, and we've seldom tried other types of entrees, but the pizza is terrific. You can see why the takeout area is standing-room-only every Friday evening, as so many families end their workweek with a big circle of cheesy Italian goodness.

In addition to whatever type you order before coming, I recommend trying a slice or two from the pizzas they have sitting on the counter. Sadly, the selection is very hit-or-miss; you may find delicacies like buffalo chicken pizza or white pizza with tomatoes and broccoli, or you might only see plain. P.S. The thick-crust sicilian pizzas are good here too.

(P.P.S. After writing this review, I tried to order a pizza for three people to split, but Mazzella's refused to make a pizza with a particular topping on 1/4 of the pie. So much for going that little extra distance to please the customer!)

OK - not the highest-class, but dang good food!  They serve big portions.  They are very helpful.  AND - they have gluten free pasta and pizza!  The gluten free pizzas are really good and they have all the usual really-tasty toppings!  It's a real community place and they pride themselves on being good community members.  It gets crowded for dinners!
Awesome Philly Cheesesteak, mozzarella sticks an pizza. I'll be going back to CA a very happy girl.

Great pizza! You can always rely on their food to taste good and serve more people than you can bring. The takeout there is a lifesaver - the dishes are gargantuan but not at the expense of flavor and quality. It's located in an area of sub-par dining options and constantly dying businesses. Considering all that, this restaurant is desperately necessary for hungry locals!

I would have to say this is currently my favorite local Italian-American restaurant by far. Their food is made with care and focus on presentation. The prices are more than reasonable for the breathtaking feasts sent to your table with each entree. Wonderful classic dishes and surely the most impressive chicken-parm you will find in the state. 

There's probably enhancements that could be made to the decor and a few severing tips shared with the waitstaff but I like that Mazzella's doesn't try to be anything it's not.   Just a really satisfying homey restaurant for those who like to eat well and be merry!

Not bad!  I went here for lunch today with an old friend and colleague of mine who loves it here.  She had a 4 star Chicken Parm (1/2 order - was huge) and I had a really small, but tasty piece of Lasagna - the $6.00 lunch special.

Lunch for 2 with tip was $26 - can't beat that!

I will definitely be back.

I really like their food, so that's why they're getting 2 stars instead of 1, but this place just stole $5 from me. I got takeout, and within that takeout order I ordered a piece of cheese cake that I DEFINITELY paid for but did not receive. Unfortunately, I didn't notice until almost an hour after I picked up the order and my family already started eating, so I didn't want to waste the gas and time to go there and try to get my food or the money when I'm sure they wouldn't believe me. I get it, accidents happen, but this is ridiculous. How could you not check an order before you give it to your customer? They also often leave out the bread in takeout orders (not this time; but I'd much rather them have left that out accidentally than something I actually paid more for).
I absolutely love this place.  Great food and HUGE portions for reasonable prices, something I think is hard to find in Wilmington.
Simple and awesome.  The best Penne Vodka I have ever had with pancetta.   Bellisimo!

The wings were awesome. My friend got a kid burger and it was the size of a normal burger anywhere else, he said it was also very good. One of the best blood Mary's I've ever had. ( I got the vegetarian.) Our waiter was cool and the food came pretty quick.

Burgers to die for! Amazing food. Simple ordering system, basically you circle what you want on an order form and then it appears. Ive eaten here twice and Ive been pleased. Parking can get a bit tight but other than that the bathrooms are cool the food is good and its worth a trip!

Grass fed burgers were great, sweet potato fries were the best I've ever had. The Jr. Stacks are good for kids and come with fries/chips. 

We sat in the 'middle dining room' which houses a great 10 person table.   The space is open and bright. 

Definitely, worth a visit.

Been here twice and no complaints about the food. First time, I built my own burger, sans bun, with grass fed beef, buffalo ranch sauce and egg and bacon on top. Yum. Hand cut fries delicious. Second time, I got the brisket nachos. I've been on a nacho kick lately and these did not disappoint. However, the service at this place is questionable. We were there on a Friday night, so it was somewhat busy, but seriously, over an hour to get our food??? One of the people at my table didn't even get his food because the server somehow forgot to write it down. So, he had to order it again, when the rest of us already had our food. So, if you're willing to wait...and wait...the food here is great.
What a gem of a restaurant!!! Best pretzels and fries pickles we've ever had. And the wings were excellent too. Our waiter was helpful and efficient. Will def go back!
Really cool burger spot. Build your own burger and sweet potato fries. Enough said. Cool soda and ice cream options. Burger of the month. Have a large separate room for a waiting area with games.

Freaking love this restaurant. Choosing either to BYOB or order off the premade menu is one of the hardest decisions in life. The staff are always friendly and the burgers are so tasty. My tip, always order your burger on a pretzel bun, can never go wrong.
This place is so out of this world!  Great burger off the beaten past and such friendly service!!

Love this place! The atmosphere and the service are always great, and the food is delicious! This is my go to dinner choice and I take all of my friends here when they come to visit. The 60/40 burger is my favorite!
The food was fantastic. I made my own burger, but I ended up getting food poisoning. However, I will go back again and make sure to get a more thoroughly cooked burger.

The guacamole bites and Parmesan wings were awesome! We all built our own burgers and everyone was very happy with our picks. Finally a place that knows how to cook a burger. This place was such a fun unique local spot. Exactly what we were looking for on a Sunday afternoon. Highly recommended!!

I love burgers. Stacked is a great place to get a great burger fam. It has swag. Get bbq on your burger. It's good. I love their ketchup as well. It has a really cool twang to it. The service is good. You should go here if you are looking for a good place to eat.
Simply the best burgers in St. Louis!  I'm completely addicted to the Wakey Wakey...The Chef's brilliant combinations of flavors make every one of their specialty burgers amazing!

LOVE this place! I don't know what they do to their hamburgers, but this was definitely the best burger I have ever tasted. I have My Big Fat Greek Buger and it was a delicious blend of flavors from the Kalmata olive tapenade to the hummus. I will definitely be back. And the service was outstanding.

Seriously one of the best burgers I've ever had. The goat cheese and onion jam on top of a perfectly cooked burger: to die for. 
The Bloody Mary was exactly how a $9 BM should be. Boozy and delicious. 
We sat at the bar and Rachael was the best server. Fun, outgoing, provided amazing service. She put a candle in my burger since it was my birthday and it was too cute. Will definitely be back weekly and ask for her. 
There's usually a wait for the place. Seriously, stick it out, you will not be disappointed.

Yummers! I was just browsing on yelp and I found this little jewel not far from my house! 3 minutes away actually! Service was good, our waitress was very attentive. I got the create your own black bean (veggie) burger and my husband got the el fuego burger (I think) He devoured his in minutes and I took my time to enjoy every crunchy pickle, onion, lettuce that was on there. The fries were good, especially with their homemade spicy ketchup! We managed to get out of there with spending no more than $21. It would've been cheaper if I didn't get the soda for $2.25!  Besides that I really enjoyed the decor, the friendly staff and the food. 5 stars!

I had great service and a great burger. Now, my one complaint is that I don't like having to eat a hamburger with a fork. I prefer the sloppiness of picking it up and eating it the way it's supposed to be eaten. It was impossible to do though. It was still good. The guacamole bites - a little more guacamole in the would have made them even better (and a little wider ranch container). Decent beer selection. Small space-at first I thought there were more tables on the other side or upstairs, but I was wrong. They did have two TVs. Now, a pet peeve of mine at a bar......when the stool won't push up to the bar top and I have to reach and lean in for everything...that drives me crazy.
This place never disappoints!  Burgers are one the best in St. Louis if not the best. The fries are addictive!  We've eaten here numerous times and are never disappointed.

This place has the best fried pickles I have ever had. Perfect bread to pickle ratio. I have been twice and had the kahuna and goat burger. Both were top notch. This is the best burger joint in St. Louis.

This place is amazing! It's very small inside but the staff was really nice. Great beer selection and the burger are the best ever!! It's hard to find a good place to take a toddler and this was a great choice. Fun for mom, dad and baby.

Food is good but they don't season the meat all the flavor comes from your toppings. They do know how to cook the meat to the right temp which seems to be a lost art these days.

The service is some of the worst you will ever get unless you come with a large party. Took 35 min to get two burgers and fries. Waitress never refilled our drinks or even asked how our food was. We were there for almost two hours.

Food is pricey and the charge for everything extra. For two meals and two sodas it was over $30. I will not be going back.
I didn't eat here just had a drink. Service was ok but the scene was on the older side, which is fine but not really my thing.  Can't wait to try the burger I've been hearing a lot about.

This place really impresses me.  This is third time we have been here and it's gotten better each time.  The rundown is this:
Solid Beer Selection: Local and Craft are represented well here.   Still have some of the NASCAR beers too I think like Busch and Bud.  
Burgers as you may guess rule the menu. Our table tried four different burgers from the make your own variety to their specialty types.  All very good.   The fries are also a standout too.   Get them with cheese or try the house made spicy ketchup.  
The place is also really kid friendly.  Our waitress made sure our son had plenty of crayons and pictures to color.  He was super proud that they put his picture on the wall.  Nice touch.  We will be back.

Tried Stacked for the first time tonight.  Very inventive menu and if it's not creative enough for you they have a build your own option!  
I went with their limited time offering E-I-E-I-O burger which they'll have till the Perennial Ale Acorn Squash Purée runs out.  My burger also featured candied bacon and goat cheese.  They partner with local food producers (and breweries) to create one of a kind offerings.
My bf went with the build your own option.  Both burgers were well prepared, his rare and mine medium rare leaning toward medium.  We were pleased with our choices and after hearing mine was a limited time offer I was really glad I got it.
We both went with sweet potato fries which were really tasty.  Hand cut and crispy fried.
We also ordered the red pepper hummus which comes with pita and an assortment of veggies for dipping.  Very generous portion and nice flavors.  I could see splitting that with another couple sometime.
Good draft beer options too.  I went with Six Row's Vanilla Bean Porter and he had their 5 day IPA.
Service was friendly and timely especially considering they had a crowd for the Mizzou football game showing on the big screen.  We'll definitely be back to try other burgers and enjoy the atmosphere... Especially since the waitress gave us a loyalty card to fill up for free food.
Ooh and Monday afternoons and evenings are buy one burger - get one half off!

Place is okay. A little overrated if u ask me. I've had a better tasting burger at Culver's.  Also Kind of expensive for an average burger joint. Neat concept but wasn't impressed.  Tried it twice and probably won't go back. Server was pretty rude too.

This place was great! Probably the best burgers we've had they were cooked perfectly and I loved the combinations my boyfriend got a burger with strawberry jam on it and it was amazing I got the blt burger which was delicious and if you go you gotta get the fried pickles!!!  I highly recommend this place
Best burgers in STL. Great staff and great food. I'm coming back, all the way from Sweden.
Great place! Burgers are amazing and highly recommend the buffalo chips as an appetizer!

My favorite place to get a fantastic burger that I can make myself.  You can either order of their menu or get the make your own burger checklist.  I can get the ordinary toppings like bacon, mushrooms, lettuce, or a plethora of cheese's.  However they have some more interesting toppings like fried pickles,  bourbon bacon maple jam, breaded jalapeños, and a brat.  There are many more toppings to choose from and this is just a sample.   Their hand cut fries are some of the best around and the curry ketchup is amazing.  If your looking for a great burger definitely go to Stacked!  I am going to have to go right now just thinking about it!
Fantastic burgers with awesome variety and creative combinations.  The house made fries are also fantastic!  A definite must try if you love burgers.

Now this burger place is probably one of the best burger joints in St. Louis. The atmosphere and service are grade A, not to mention the food, one of the best burgers I've had. If you go, I'd reccomend using the card they give you to customize your own burger, from choosing the condiments, sides, the buns, and even the meat itself. It definitely gives so much more freedom to appease to everyones tastes. The wait usually isn't insanely long, but if its packed (which it has been in my visits), it will probably take a bit to get your food, but trust me, the wait is worth it.

Oh yes. Yes YES YES!!!! Wait.... Give me a minute....

Ok. Now that I've recovered from the amazing burger, I'll tell kiss and tell you about it.

I had the BLT. Delicious but not overwhelming bacon, spring mix lettuce and garlic roasted tomatoes, with a bourbon strawberry jam, served on Texas toast that is pan goldified.... My mouth is watering just thinking about it. 

I drove fifteen minutes from downtown because I was craving St Louis' best burger, and I believe I've found it. I Was worth the drive all the way! Oh and add the friend egg to it. Trust me. You will not regret it. Now stop reading this review and go get a burger already!

We've been here twice. Both times I have been very impressed. The first time I had the Greek burger and it was awesome. I felt that the chips were very under seasoned though. My girlfriend got the Wakey Wakey. She said it was delicious.

That visit was so enjoyable that literally the next day we got carry out. My girlfriend enjoyed the Wakey Wakey so much that she had it again. I decided to try the BLT wedge salad. It was far and away the best wedge salad I have ever had. The bleu cheese dressing perfectly matches with the smokiness and sweetness from the grilling.

I intend to explore the menu further but it will be hard to not get that salad every time that I go in.
Stacked was very good, sat at the bar tonight ordered a Schlafly and a grass fed custom burger. Burger was cooked properly and was very flavorful.

Simply put... this was the best burger I have ever had.  Started with a Stag and the mac and cheese balls (also phenomenal!!) ended with the Wakey-wakey. Definitely add the strawberry jam!!
 My girlfriend had the guacamole bites and kept raving about them. Her BLT Burger looked phenomenal as well. Definitely coming back here for sure!!! A new favorite. Kristen was an awesome server!!

Was in Saint Louis for less than 24 hours and picked this place on a whim. All 5 people in our group loved their meals. The portions are large and everything is resonantly priced. I had the black bean veggie burger with sweet potato fries. It was really good. The chipotle aioli was delicious. The traditional fries were also really great and one of our group members got the homemade applesauce and love it. All around a great pick!

We were craving a burger and Stacked STL came up in the search near us so we figured we would try it; not knowing what to expect. We were seated immediately and finally decided on the Greek burger and the Wet Nap. Words can't describe how amazing these burgers were.  I was full for hours afterwards but still craving more. Do yourself a favor and check it out!

We went to this restaurant on a Saturday night. Arriving at 6 PM. Shouldn't be a problem to get a seat right away, right? Wrong. Even at 6 PM there was a 45 minute wait. Thankfully, they had a room set aside specifically for waiting. Although, judging from the layout of the restaurant and bar area it seems really obvious that it was not designed to accommodate its popularity. The bar is in the first room where you enter the restaurant. Smack dab with the majority of tables where people are eating. That area is so crowded that it is nearly impossible to try to get a drink while you are waiting for your table.

Once we finally got our table, the service was wonderful. Just the right amount of attentiveness and privacy. My friends each had various hamburgers while I had a chicken breast. I found the chicken breast to be one of the tastier chicken breasts I have had. The barbecue brisket which was on top of the chicken breast was also very tasty.  While I found the chicken breast to be wonderful, my friends thought their burgers were just average. Honestly, though, burgers are so hard to do anything really special. So, perhaps the fact that they weren't terrible, is a simple win.  

Overall, the food was good. I will say that I do not know if it was worth a 45 minute wait. For that reason alone, I doubt I would ever go back on a weekend night.

This is a great place for a burger and a beer.  Service was friendly and prompt.  I got the Wakey Wakey burger and it was done perfectly and very tasty.  I got the creamy slaw as my side and it was excellent.  My group split the Carmel browny with a unique coffee and cumin spiced ice cream.
Best burgers in STL!!  Great burgers with ridiculous amounts of options!!  Not the cheapest, but you definitely get your moneys worth.  Will be back again.

Went for lunch and liked the place immediately.  Good service and great atmosphere. Just had a good burger, so I was a little worried about burger burnout. Had the pineapple, ham, bbq burger. Awesome. Good comments on both the chips and the fries. Half pounders, so come hungry.

Very Good Burger. We got the grass fed beef and it was delicious, worth the up charge. Didn't love the wait. Waited 30 minutes just to sit at the bar. We gave up on getting a table (just for 2). The service was average, nothing exceptional. The fried pickles were some of the best I've ever had. The live music was a nice touch. 'Just an old dude with a guitar who was pretty good.

So good! This is St. Louis' equivalent of Bare Burger in New York. The only thing that could be better is if the food was a little more consistent. One time when I went there the fries came out burnt. I'm not a fan of sending my food back, so I just ate some. I think a quality check before the food comes out would solve this problem.

I was hesitant to try this place because of all of the reviews that said the meat was not seasoned. I don't think this is the case. I had the Goat grass fed burger with goat cheese and onion jelly. I tasted the burger without anything on it, and it was flavorful and not in a solely meaty way. My husband had the turkey burger. Whenever we go someplace that has turkey burgers, I let my husband order them first because so many times they are not seasoned well, and I detest the taste of unseasoned turkey. Again, this burger was also tasty.

We had a side of broccoli (yummy red pepper flakes) and fries which were crisp and well-seasoned.

We also tried the guacamole bites for an appetizer which were a bit of an indulgence, but worth a try. They are like guacamole fried wontons.

Our server was darling and helpful with suggestions. She seemed like she enjoyed working there and the food she served.

So, yeah. We'll be back.

So looking for a great burger today. Thought of a couple new places to try but decided on Stacked which we've eaten at twice before. First time excellent. I always have make your own loaded on the sourdough. We've tried sweet potato fries and Mac and cheese bites. Both good. Second visit was great after my fries were switched for hot fries. Others raved on jalapeno burger. My make your own great burger. Tonight it was an average wait 25 mns for table and  about 24 mns for good to come out. Accepted on a Saturday after 5pm. We had side salads and both were above average and freshly made. I made the mistake of paying up for the grass fed but thanks all I eat now. Again mine was made to order and waited for my medium burger which was mooing. The waitress who like all staff was busy yet friendly and hustling said it can be thrown back on the grill otherwise over 25 mns for a new one. I knew that was a bad idea and shoudve picked around  but she took it back. It was brought back out new bread,tomato and lettuce. The waitress said they always undertook the grass fed....that would be been nice to know when ordering. My guests burger was also medium and cooked perfectly. I stupidly took a bite and it felt like,alpo in my mouth! Not cooked much more. I picked around the uncooked burger. The texture us still blech@

I currently live 2 blocks from this place and we go there often. Good burgers, great toppings, however they do nickel and dime you to create a burger exactly how you want. It's a good place but its not a value of you're looking to save money.

The guacamole bites are amazing!!!! The specialty burgers are also good but can be a bit much. I got the en fuego and would get it again.  My boyfriend got the one with the brisket and that was pretty tasty say well. If you don't like a bunch of fluff on your burger, they do have a build your own option, which is very accommodating. Carondolet square is a cute area but I wouldn't wander too far in any direction...it can get a little sketch.  We will be back for sure!

Our Uber driver recommended this gem. I had the black bean burger, which was clearly freshly made. Husband had the En Fuego. The guacamole bites were unique and yummy! The host was as charming as could be. Service attentive. Local Craft beer is also available

Stacked is located in the Carondelet/Patch neighborhood along the historic Ivory Triangle.  It's a busy casual restaurant and it is great for the neighborhood.

They have a full bar with lots of options including an awesome bloody mary.    The standout menu star is THE BURGER with many varieties of meats and options -  all hand made.  They also have a large breakfast menu, salads, lots of homemade apps, hand cut fries, brisket, fish, and several vegetarian options.  I had the grass-fed beef build a burger with several fresh ingredients that I paid to add.  The hand cut fries were thin and marvelous.  

The patrons vary from conservative, to neighborhood folk, to tattooed and pierced, to "Joe factory worker."  Other than the slow service and time it took to get our food, I enjoyed my experience and I will be back!

While I stand by my earlier review of great food and service, I'd add that as they've gotten more popular, the wait times have gotten longer. I sure wish they used the No Wait app. Their wait area is uncomfortable and if they were using the App, we could be waiting elsewhere and arriving in time for seating.
Food and service was great!  I'll definitely be back and will try other burgers. The options were endless!

I've only been there once and I'm already hooked. It's a very chill small neighborhood joint. I'll admit I'm kinda picky sometimes so I built my own burger. I was not disappointed at all. You can tell they make everything fresh there. I also had fries, guacamole bites, applesauce and a small caesar. Yes I was hungry that night. I really recommend trying the applesauce. Only thing I was bummed with was that they were out of mac and cheese bites. They said it sells out fast. Besides that great place to grab a burger.
Best biscuits and gravy I have ever eaten in my life. Very reasonable prices and decent service. I can't wait to return!

I had the 60/40 burger, it was outstanding. They have an enormous selection of toppings to choose from. I believe that you have to try this place multiple times before you can find the perfect combination.  They also have a good selection of craft beers to choose from and interesting mixed drinks.

I really liked the burger I had the first time, it was one of the better burgers I have had in ST.  The brisket sandwich was ok, but I wouldn't go there for barbecue.  It's probably better as a burger topper which seems like what it's intended for anyway.  I liked the "Hey Arnold" (iced tea, American Honey, lemonade).  They should probably just take the bloody marys off of their featured bar menu because they're not that special and they are kinda taking up space.
Not at all impressed! By the 2nd bite, the bottom bun was pure mush. Guacamole bites sounded like they would have great potential, but we're extremely lame.

I don't understand all of the hype. Their burgers are good but nothing spectacular. Their specialty burgers (tasted four of them) make the mistake of loading so many different ingredients to the point that it overwhelms the taste of the actual burger. They do offer the option of building your own burger which might be a better option if you want to taste the actual hamburger itself. 

The beer on draft is limited to very specialized styles/tastes (jalapeño flavored and citrus flavored to name two) when a simple Budweiser on tap would do. 

The restaurant itself has limited seating but a fun, casual atmosphere. The service is enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and opinionated (in a good way) about the menu. 

Overall a "good" experience but nothing that warrants a return trip.

5 burgers ordered.  5 awesome burger renditions.  Best burger apart from home-grilling.  Decent beers.  Downgraded from 5 stars only due to nit picky things like maybe seating could be better, maybe bathrooms could be better, etc.  Sit down service.

Just stopped in with my wife for dinner to celebrate my birthday and our new house in Carondelet. Just great. I had the burger of the month. Ample, fresh bun, a beef patty that had been gently molded by hand, not mutilated by a machine, bacon, goat cheese, and sweet potato purée. Juicy and perfectly cooked, but not excessively messy.
Ordered it medium and that's exactly how it came. Wait staff were very welcoming and helpful. Met one of the owners. Happy to be moving into a neighborhood with this place close by.
The place is in a lovely location with parks, fountains and other restaurants. The Ivory Theatre is just across the way. Fine selection  of beers. I had the Urban Chestnut Oktoberfest, perfect with a burger.
Had the Hawaiian burger and fries, absolutely delish, best burger and fries I've had in St. Louis!!! Service a bit slow to start, takes a bit before they notice you're there!!!
Best burger I've had in a lil bit! Awesome people and environment...will be frequenting for sure!!

I've visited Stacked three times now and am always so impressed with this place. The quality and value of the food is phenomenal and the service is always so friendly and prompt. I will continue to visit Stacked and share the good word about this fun  neighborhood restaurant!

Whenever I have a guest visiting from out of town this is the place that I take them.  Their burger of the month is always good, even if the description doesn't sound like it should be!  Our office always goes on Monday's to get the buy one get one 1/2 off deal.  They need to put the Crab Rangoon burger on the menu permanently!

Just what the Dr. ordered! When we got there, they were busy, but the wait was not as long as anticipated. We started with the guacamole bites, Yums. Took us a bit to build our own burger, so many options but that made it fun. I had ground chuck on brioche, my daughters had ground chuck on pretzel and black bean on wheat. Too many toppings to remember who had what, but we all shared and it was delish. Loved the parmesian fries. We will definitely be returning because we were too full for desert.

There's nothing like a great burger to wrap up your weekend.  When we first landed in the Lou, the local restaurant and eatery scene was something that really stood out.  As transplants from a big east coast city and Missouri transplants who chose to live in the City, we were excited!  

Stacked is the real deal for big, plump, juicy and delicious burgers.  They offer something for everyone, from meat loving fanatics (they even have a mixed beef and pork patty) to  poultry devotees (there is a turkey burger, as well as chicken tenders on the kids menus) to vegetarians.

The atmosphere is great; a mishmash of tables, spacious and clean tables.  I loved the menu -  It was really more like a dossier, four pages in an old school office folder.  Loved it!

The kiddo had the grilled cheese (a gooey, cheesey dream on texas toast) with housemade chips, while the spouse and I did the make-your-own-burger option.  I opted for the ground chuck with cheddar and bacon on the brioche bun, and the spouse chose turkey with cheddar and caramelized onions and spicy mustard on brioche.  The burgers were excellent.  The soft brioche buns were toasted with butter to perfection. The patties were nice, thick and juicy.  And the toppings were perfect.  The burgers are served closed face, with lettuce and tomato on the side.  I liked that they kept the hot and cold components separately.

And the sides!  With the make-your-own option, you get to pick among 6+ sides.  I chose the house cut fries, smothered with chili and cheese.  The chili was great!  It was made in house, not out of a can. And they used the same cheese served with their bavarian pretzels-  It makes a great combination with the fries and cheese.  The spouse chose the Parmesan and herb fries and they were consumed before i had a chance to grab a forkful.  The only negative was the house made chips were a bit stale.

The service was excellent!  Jordan was our server and kept tabs on us throughout the meal!  

I see us becoming regulars.  :-)

Build your own...enough said!

But it you need to read more...

More choices than you can manage at home

Great friendly and helpful service

Not a chain

Well prepared

I like this place a lot! I've eaten here twice now and haven't been disappointed. They have awesome burgers that allow you to get creative with your toppings and fixings such as fried pickles and jalapenos, among others and I love the check list of options they have at the table. They also serve breakfast on the weekends which was great. I haven't been there later at night, but I've heard good things about it and I'll definitely be there to see for myself one of these days!
BEST BURGER IN SOUTH City!!!! Build your own or choose from an awesome menu. Parmesan wings to die for for an app. Best service ever here. Best way to spend my last meal here!

I love this place! I live in the area and come here often. Last week we walked down with our doggie to go to the pizza place across the street but they were closed. We went over to stacked and asked if they could possibly put a table down outside so we could sit outside with our pooch. They were incredibly accommodating, they seated us outside and brought water for Otis. They were so friendly and welcoming even though they had to make special accommodations for us. It was so nice!! Food is always great, they have a nice local/microbrew beer selection and the service is excellent!
everything was perfect...the food, the drinks,  the atmosphere, and the staff. we are stoked to find this place so close to home.  we cannot wait to go back!
Gave it a second try . Still not impressed. It's more like a big messy burger with no flavor than a flavorful burger with condiments to enhance
Best damn burger out there it's not even a competition!!! From the BLT to Their Turkey Burger absolutely fantastic also The sauces are amazing. Go get some!

I've been to Stacked many times and every time enjoyed myself very much. The food is great and the create your own burger means you will always get exactly what you want. I was on a pretzel bun kick but recently switched back to the brioche bread. I've had the Wakey Wakey and Big Kahuna from the menu, both are delicious by the way, but the rest of the time I custom order. You can spend some time going over all the choices on the custom menu, luckily they give you a pencil --with-- an eraser! If you do too badly they also give you a pad of menu papers. ;) Give them a try and I bet you will like what you find.

Very good food and burgers were awesome. 

Tad pricey but worth it. 

Build your own burger is an excellent idea.

I really liked this place! Lots of options to create the perfect burger or you can order from the burger menu which comes with toppings preselected. I got the fries for my side and they were crunchy and salty which is exactly how I like them. Only complaint was the wait time and some of the seating was a little odd. Otherwise great and I would visit again!

I've been to Stacked twice now and have thoroughly enjoyed both visits. On both occasions I ordered The Goat burger (topped with goat cheese and onion chutney), and I have to admit I'm going to have trouble trying another burger because of how much I like this one. The onion chutney is so tasty that you could slap it on a plate with some goat cheese and I'd eat it with a spoon - the onions are almost candied. I've had both the garlic fries and the Parmesan and herb fries as sides. Both were good, but I prefer the Parmesan and herb fries. The garlic fries didn't pack much of a punch - garlic flavoring is more subtle than I was hoping for. 

Also tried the fried pickles and boneless buffalo wings. Fried pickles are fantastic, especially with their house-made spicy ketchup (the sauce served with the pickles is tasty as well). The buffalo wings were also quite good.

Service is good, and both the waitresses we had were helpful and courteous. The only reason that Stacked doesn't rate as a 5 star for me is their tendency to overcook the burgers just a bit. My husband and I ordered our burgers medium on both occasions and they were more like medium well. Just know going in that if you like your burgers with some pinkness to them (or even a little bloody), you may want to order medium rare.

Incredible burgers, sweet potato fries, and appetizers. House salad is also great. I appreciate the grass fed option!  The bacon bourbon maple jam is so good. Every time I come back I am reminded how phenomenal the burgers are! So good!
Wonderful atmosphere, very neighborhoody!! A bit small but worth the wait for seating! Marvelous menu with many options, even build your own burger! Many unique beers on tap that change often!

My only first thoughts are wow. We had tried this place awhile ago and loved it and I have no idea why it took so long to come back because the second time was even more amazing than I remembered. It is tucked away in south city, but absolutely worth the find. They do not take reservations so have to luck out at the right time or will have a bit of a wait but definitely worth it for the best burger I've had in STL so far. The en fuego is my favorite. Breaded jalapeños and chipotle ranch are two of my favorite things and make for an amazing burger. You can get your fries topped with cheese sauce and idk which is better the cheese sauce or the amazing homemade spicy ketchup. Their menu is full of different amazing crafted burgers so there's something for everyone. If you're in the mood for amazing burgers and fries this is the place. I definitely won't be waiting so long to go back this time I was in a happy food coma the rest of the day after visiting stacked this past weekend! :)
This place not only had amazing, custom burgers, but a great atmosphere and service to boot. I'd highly recommend.

Ok...I've been on a best burger in St. Louis quest for awhile..I read the reviews on here so decided to check it out. First off waited 45 minutes for a table for five of us. Dont mind the wait if its worth it.  The place is loud.  Couldn't hear each other talking..I ordered the "dictator" burger, came with a brat and sauerkraut on it. Gave my kraut to somebody (I dont like it)..I ordered it a double.  Waited a half hour to get it..again dont mind waiting if its worth it..well it wasn't.  The patty crumbled on my first bite, had to scoop it with a fork to eat it, lacked flavor.  Burgers ARE NOT supposed to crumble apart!!! It was like eating a flavorless meat pie.  The brat on it tasted sour. The server said it was because of the beer it was in.  Must of been a really bad beer, because that was horrible. Gave it 2 stars because the server Kim was excellent.  It would have to be a pretty special reason for me to go back. This place is all hype and no substance

Great and interesting burgers. Amazing fries. Everything customizable. Quality meat. I can't say enough good things! You've got to be exceptional to get 5 stars in my book, this is a great place I'd recommend to everyone. Friendly staff and awesome atmosphere!

Ordered to go and was told 20 minutes til ready. I arrived to pick up my order within 20 minutes and it was more like 30 minutes AFTER I arrived. To top it off, they forgot the Strawberry jam I ordered (and was charged for) on the Wakey Wakey. 

I would probably give it another shot in the restaurant but not pick up.
Love this place! Friendly staff and good food. I'm giving it four stars though because I really miss the breakfast buffet! Seriously, bring it back pleeeeeeease!

Best burger bar in the Lou,  this place has got it! I can't imagine anyone not loving this place.  The choices you get to build your burger are amazing,  the service is awesome! You have got to try their homemade chips and get them stacked with garlic and parmesan and herbs,  and their fries stacked with chili and cheese,  OMG! They always have a different burger of the month,  which are always awesome.  Now you can go with the menu, which are very good burgers,  but I recommend building your own, the choices are almost endless on the b.y.o.b menu.   Great apps,  their fried guacamole is awesome.

Yummy!!! Fried pickles the right way...chips not spears. A grilled romaine salad...and a great fish sandwich. Yep, at a burger place!! Next time I'll definitely go for a black bean burger. Friendly service by Rachel even though she's busy.  Our first time but won't be our last!!
I absolutely love the check sheet so I can choose exactly what I want on my burger (although I tend to overdo it.) I have had dry turkey burgers though. The staff was attentive and great though!

Wow this place was delicious! The burgers are tremendous. Super atmosphere! One of our favorites were guacamole wantons:) Family or date night for this creative cuisine! Wait Staff very nice and service was super!

Great burgers.  As you like or their special choices.  One of the few places where I can get a medium rare as I like it.  An abundance of fries comes with your sandwich served on a red and white checkered paper over a pizza type pan.  Needed as the fries fill a big portion of the plate.  Server was very accommodating, where as owner seemed a bit reserved.  No matter, burger was fresh and delicious.

I had the 5 ounce burger with lettuce, tomato, onion, and blue cheese. It was really good. Also the slaw, and I stole French fries from my husband. We had 6 at our table. Everyone had a good meal. Fun beer list. Good service. 

We had to go back later for just iced tea. It was good, too.

My favorite bar to go to is Stacked.... Not only for the amazing food and quality taste... But the fact that the staff makes you feel like one of the family. I grew up watching the show Cheers and Stacked is very close to giving me that same feeling. I can get something different every time I go but the service is always excellent. Kimmie the bartender keeps every glass full and gives every face a smile. I highly recommend this to every one I know.

Was very disappointed this evening when I called to place a to go order with Rachel and was told I couldn't do so as they were too busy and only doing it for their "regular to go order customers".  I was told we could come in and sit at the bar and order drinks and place the order and when I explained that my wife had just gotten out of the hospital yesterday and was unable to leave the house with bilateral knee replacements she said I'm really sorry. I guess our once a week visits to their establishment is not considered "regular" enough. Maybe I should have also stated that we are local business owners right down the street. Looks like my stacked days are over as are my recommendations.

I kept going by stacked about 10 times a month saying we need to go there again finally went last week for lunch with my wife and my son his wife and my granddaughter. We sat in the booth in the middle of the dining room which is great go little ones.to make a long review short , i had the best grass fed burger I've ever had, my daughter in law said the grilled cheese was excellent and everyone else were also very complimentary. The server who's been there I think since they opened was very attentive. It's not real fancy but damm they serve a mean burger.
Hands down the best burger you can get in St. Louis. All the burgers are completely customizable w/ toppings you wouldn't even think of! Also, pretzel appetizers are a must have!
One of the best burger joints that I have ever been to. Reasonable pricing, great beer on tap, excellent service, and the burgers are to die for. We WILL be back!

Exquisite without being too fancy. Perfect blend of casual meets exceptional. Who is the owner? I must thank her or him in person! Thank-you for amazing brisket nachos and the best build a burger! God Bless You & Your Team!!!!

The bar, the booze, the BURGERS the owner SAM who greeted us @ the door & took care of us along with Melissa AMAZING!!! There is a reason these guys have won best burger in STL the past few years. My bestie & I are the toughest customers & we have nothing but great things to say about STACKED. Located in the quiant  Holly Hills neighborhood its a perfect example of why STL is FOODY heaven. I had the guacamole  bites, mac & cheese bites, BLT grilled wedge salad & veggie burger & was more satiated than last Sat night when I ate a petite filet @ Ruth Chris! God must have a hand in STACKED cuz IT WAS HEAVEN!!! Why are you not grabbing your keys & going there NOW man!!!!
I loved all their burgers, especially the wakey wakey burger, and this coming from a person who doesn't care for burgers at all. Enough said.
I must say when I saw it on here, I knew I had to come. I got "The Goat" burger and its made with goat cheese and onion jam. One of the best burgers I have ate and I definitely will be back....Thanks

Love the build your own burger and the buy one get one half price is great. Come hungry because the burgers are big.

The guacamoli bites are a great starter, you won't be disappointed with them. You might even want to order two.

Great breakfast for a great value!  $8 buffet with options to order French toast, pancakes or made to order eggs included.  I like this approach because you get fresher food.   The buffet had fruit, bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, biscuits and gravy.  The only 'meh' on the buffet was the scrambled eggs but I'm not a fan of scrambled to begin with.  The biscuits and gravy however were excellent.  Biscuits were not dried out as is often the case with buffets.  Gravy had great flavor.  We ordered French toast to split.  There were a number of options, we went with cranberry. The cranberry was subdued but that wasn't a problem.  The French toast was well made.  I washed it down with their vegetarian Bloody Mary, one of the best I've had.  Simple and delicious.  He enjoyed a coffee.  Our total bill was $26 before tip so this is a great value for the quality delivered!

Must say this place is awesome and I am surprised we had not ran into it before. The bar is awesome the have the bottle beer selections hanging from above the bar and also had a good draft selection. Staff was super friendly. We ordered the bbq brisket nachos to start and must say that it was quite delicious ok well one of the best nachos we have ever had and it was huge. We both decided to build our own burgers and was very happy to see local grass fed beef on the menu as we love supporting local farmers. The burger was amazing cooked perfectly and was way bigger than I had imagined and the hand cut fries were great. This has become one of my favorites and I will definitely be back very soon

Burgers to suit your craving! Great portion of meat, not an overwhelming amount nor are you leaving hungry! I enjoyed the option of picking from the different toppings which range from slaw (my fave) to strawberry jam. Definitely worth a visit!!

One of the best burgers in town. Large portions and decent prices for a local restaurant. The sriracha burger is off the chain. The pub cheddar tasted terrific on the burger, but it dripped all over the place. You might want to stay away from the pub cheddar if you don't want to make a mess. The parmesan garlic fries were great, and there were a lot of them! The service was good.
Just a few blocks from my apartment and one of my favorites. If you are downtown give this place a try. Grwat burgers and loaded fries. Give it top 10 in STL for burgers

I have been to Stacked about four times so far. Each time I go I receive a different level of service. The overall experience has been enjoyable.

I have tried two different hamburgers that I really enjoy. The Herbivore, is a really great black bean vegetarian burger served on a soft whole wheat bun. It's comes with a little bit of lettuce. I believe you can ask for tomato and pickles too but it didn't really need much more. The burger itself was very tasty indeed!!!! I always opt for sweet potato fries when available. They have really great sweet potato fries here!!! It is all served to you on a large metal pizza platter with parchment paper underneath the burger and fries so you can really spread out and enjoy cutting your burger in half and putting ketchup on your plate, eating your fries etc. 

I have also ordered the En Fuego burger. It is a hamburger with pepper jack cheese, jalapenos and a spicy sauce. It's hot, but not too hot! 

The service on a couple visits has been exceptional! Very attentive very informative and very friendly. Awesome. 
This last visit for some reason the wait for our appetizer was 45 minutes, for nachos, after we ordered .... And then another 30 minutes after that until we received our burgers. There was no apology or any reason why it took so long. There was a large group in the private room ... so possibly that could be the reason why. But it was frustrating. 

That being said, after a few weeks of forgetting about the last visit's service, I would still go back for the food!

Saw the advertisement in one of the food magazines or new openings, not 100% sure  which but it intrigued me enough to try.  I dragged my husband along since burgers are not out of his normal comfort zone.  We were greeted right at the front door by a guy we later learned was the owner, it was  a little awkward and made me wonder what happens when a staff member doesn't happen to be right there when you walk in......we found out later when a family of about 6 came in and sat down at a large table and no one noticed them (really!) for about ten minutes.

Food:  We ordered wings with ranch dressing - very good.  I created my own burger, I love this concept! Burger, fried egg, spinach, tomato, fried jalapeño slices,  chipotle sauce on sourdough, husband ordered a cheeseburger.  He liked his, I loved mine once they replaced the plain jalapeno's with the fried ones I asked for.  I really enjoyed the burger, so I would like to go back,  also wouldn't mind trying the breakfast.

I am concerned about the service as mentioned above, it doesn't seem as though there is a specific process for greeting and seating people.  Our waitress was pleasant enough and seemed a little on top of us for the first part of the service but no where to be found once we got our food and I had to ask someone else to fix the jalapeno issue.  The owner stopped by to chat in the beginning and seemed friendly enough if somewhat young and awkward.  Hope it will still be open when we venture back again.  Some service issues can be overlooked by awesome food but seems like the owner couldn't rectify those issues from prior restaurant, so it doesn't look good

Very good burger, best I've had so far in St. Louis. Not of the same flavorful excellence as my favorites in Chicago (au cheval, kuma's), but definitely worth a return trip. 

Not skinny griddled patties - you can get a good medium rare piece of meat here. They're very...loosely packed, though. Where I would usually eat half a burger and save the rest, I was easily able to get through a whole burger here.

Simply amazing!! I had the BLT, perfectly cooked, and the garlic roasted tomatoes on it were pure heaven!! Husband had the blue cheese burger almost as great as mine!! Brownie dessert made me speechless!! Service was terrific!!
Burger was good side was not edible for me .... The slaw tasted like flour which was very unpleasant. Service was okay.
Wonderful burger bar and grill.  Really loved the place.  Great selection of beer and burgers, dishes were were prepared.  nice bar scene.  Go here for one of the best burgers in St. Louis

Very easy to sum up this establishment....come early and often !  Awesome servers who take the time to accommodate as best as they can.  Great variety of burger options to satisfy any taste preference.

It was my first time here. Came in on a Saturday night with a couple of friends. The restaurant was at full capacity and it was a 30 minute wait. Friends wanted to go try Fitz, but I convinced them otherwise. We were seated after the wait and serviced just fine. We ordered the Garlic Butter Wings, BBQ Nachos, and a cup of chili for apps. The wings were good just need to roll them around in the butters. The nachos was good there was come brisket and jalapenos on there which was great. The chili was way better than I expected it to be really good. For the main course we ordered the Fuego Burger, The Dictator, and I created my own. My friends enjoyed their burgers except the Fuego was too fuego for my friend. My burger consisted of a 60/40 bee/pork patty with pub cheese (I still don't know what it is), lettuce, fried pickles, bacon, and an egg topped off with BBQ sauce on a pretzel bun with a side of Parmesan and herb fries. It was fantastic and cooked perfectly. I believe they get their buns fresh from a bakery down the street which is a plus. The fries were good, but I'm opting for the chili cheese fries next time considering how good the chili was. Overall it was a great experience and a great meal. Will be going back more often.

The food and service is great! Have been here several times and have sampled many of the burgers. Today I built my own burger with the 60/40  patty on a pretzel roll with bacon, pub cheddar, pickles and onion. I believe this is the best burger Ive ever eaten. Delicious! The guacamole bites are also great. I always get the sweet potato fries and ask for a side of maple syrup for dipping. Yum. My husband is vegetarian and always gets the herbivore. He says its the best veggie burger in town.

Yummy!!!
This place has a great burger and unique selection. Grass Feed beef option for extra $2.99.
Atmosphere is good. Bloody Mary was best I've had in a long time.
StackedSTL has become my go to when I want a burger.  I've recommended them to so many people and no one has been disappointed. Love my create my own burger so I just order it every time

Found this new gem on our way home from a cards game.  Refusing to pay for ballpark prices we knew we needed to find something.  Hubby was craving cheeseburgers, while I was not craving fast food.  

Pulled out yelp as we were driving down the highway and this place came up.  Hours stated they stayed open until 1, so we thought we'd give them a try.  The place was near empty when we strolled in, but it was still inviting.  It was obvious we weren't there for the drinks when our waittress came over and said that the kitchen closed at 10.  Damn, we were like 5 minutes late.  But, they offered to ask the cook if they would stay open for us and he did!  Relieved, we got to placing our orders.  

I had the junior burger while hubby had one of their build-your-own.  He loved the concept and fully indulged.  We also ordered their regular fries and sweet potato fries.  The burgers were really good.  You could tell that they're made fresh.  It was almost like biting into a steak, so good.  My only complaint was that the junior didn't come with lettuce and tomato, ah well.  The fries were perfect.  Sometimes the sweet potato fries can taste too sweet, and that kind of ruins it for me.  Not these.  These were perfectly savory and crisp.  I couldn't stop eating them.  The regular fries were thin.  Reminded me more of steak 'n shake fries but with more flavor.  Prices are very reasonable too.

Overall, we really enjoyed our late night meal!  We'll be back during regular kitchen hours for more good eats!
Love Stacked. Love getting to order a rare burger with a gluten free bun.  One problem tonight:. No pool table.

We drive 20 minutes to get here once a month and we are never disappointed.  We always get the burger of the month and it never disappoints.  The guacamole and buffalo chips are must have for an appetizer.  Try their Cole slaw as a side.  I could literally drink it from the bowl they serve it in.

The only reason I didn't give the full five stars is because the bar is very small. That being said, the room the bar is located in is also very small, so there's not much that can be done about it. 
I've never had a burger I didn't love. The flavor of the beef is fantastic and they have a good selection of toppings. It's our go-to burger place. They also offer a veggie patty so our vegetarian friend can join us, which is nice. 
It's just really good. If you want a delicious burger, this is where to go.

One of the best burgers in town. I did the build your own burger option and it was delicious. Especially with all the different combinations to choose from. If you like burgers,  you'll love this place.
Ehhh its OK.  Not a bad gourmet burger spot, but honestly there are others out there with better food.  I found the house burgers a little too fancy and went with the make your own option.

I love coming here and introducing my friends to Tungus restaraunt. The Burgers are always great especially the burger of the month and the fries are always hot and crispy. Go here if you want a hot and delicious meal.

The last time I visited I sat at the bar and a gentleman who is a regular kept me occupied while waiting for service. We both commented on how slow they were and how sitting at the bar sure didn't help. He mentioned that if things continue how the whole shebang would eventually fall apart because he wasn't interested in being a regular any longer. I figured a bad night would pass and there'd be lots of chances to make up for it. Nope. The simple truth is the service does sort of blow and they have a bit of an attitude as if something isn't going so well in their day. Not a smile on the bunch. Two guys walk around policing tables but as though they're walking a beat in a terrible neighborhood. Ask for a beer, it could take 10 minutes or more and smiley will bring it because your server would have done everything but that. 

The food is ok. I sure like their burgers and they have some interesting choices. I had the Greek without Kalamata olive spread. It's too powerful and takes away from everything else. 

I still recommend this place for a burger. Who knows, maybe they were just having a bad day (s).

Super good burgers.  I had the turkey burger and it was juicy and we'll seasoned.  My husband built his own and he said it was fabulous.  Fries are good,  shoestring style and even the kids burger was well prepared.  

The only drawback is the wait.  The burgers are worth waiting for,  but they take a while.  Took us at least 20 or 30 min to get our burgers.  Super friendly service though so just plan for a little more time than usual

We had the bbq brisket for a late dinner at 9pm on Saturday night, it was delicious.  My son had a stout and I had an IPA, good selection of dradfts.  Rachel was the bartender and she was super dupper!  The neighborhood is wonderful, great homes and parks.  I love this part of south city, safe and friendly!
Best turkey burger I've had in St. Louis to date!  The regular ones are also good, I'm glad it is within walking distance.

Can't say enough good things. Burgers are almost on a Kobe level. If your a beef fan you can't go wrong here! Cesar is phenomenal for a burger joint. Homemade croutons and some of the best homemade anchovie dressing in town! Reasonable prices. Portions are perfect for the clean plate club! What are you waiting for git em up!
Pretty good thing going on here burgers were good service a little slow it was the lunch rush. Need to remove a table or 2 fir a little more room to get in and out

The food was amazing! We got the Mac and cheese balls and fried pickles as an appetizer, both were fantastic! I got the en fuego burger and it was awesome! Service wasn't the greatest, but not terrible!

This place is always clean and the burgers are great!  There is a build your own option but I always order from the menu.  Trust the chef and try something different, it's worth it!  Great service too, they definitely know what they're doing and you're never left waiting.  Their cocktails are great too!

Stacked is a great place to grab a high quality burger.What sets this place apart is that you can customize your burger to your preferences. To start off you can pick your meat which includes options like turkey, grass fed beef, and even black bean if you want a veggie option. You then fill out what bun and  toppings you want. A few standouts are the different cheeses, onion jam, roasted red peppers, bourbon bacon maple jam, and many more, These are NOT your basic burger toppings! I highly recommend the fries with your burger. They are delicious!

Loved it here!!!!! Everyone was so nice and the food was so filling and delicious. We got the veggie burger and fries and it was fast and GREAT portions.  Jim is our fav server. 

Cute atmosphere, felt fun and happy!

This is a SHOVE YOUR FACE and LICK YOUR PLATE CLEAN type of place. Honestly until Stacked I hadn't eaten a burger in about 2 years. 

I started with the Black Bean Burger and I got hooked fast! As I watched my friends try and create different burgers I went out on a limb and created my own I like to call Burger a la ME. The 40/60 patty, pretzel bun, fried pickles, pub cheddar and topped with chipotle aioli sauce. YUM! Then I ventured out to The Goat and now I'm on to the Wakey Wakey. If your not a big burger person as I once was they have a great salad selection with my personal favorite the Honey Mustard Chicken or start off with some Guacamole Bites.

This is the best hamburger I have ever eaten.  The fact that you may order at any temp you would like is awesome.  Try the goat cheese and onion jam on a med rare burger; so fantastic.  Also the deep fried guacamole is amazing.  A must when you are in STL.

I've been here twice, and I see no end in sight. Great, friendly service in a cozy atmosphere. Beer selection is admirable. The burgers are five star, especially the Wet Nap, and sweet potato fries are done well. The brownie dessert wasn't the greatest, but it wasn't bad either. Besides, I don't come here for the desserts, I come for the dynamite MEAT!

Finally got a chance to swing by here for lunch and received a solid STL burger. Service was good and really enjoyed the atmosphere BUT fries were lacking... poor French fries (for me) can kill a good burger plate. I do recommend The Goat burger!

Great burgers, great service, and cool place!  Went for lunch and opted to "make our own burger" - and it was delish.  Our waitress, knowing it was our first time, was patient, knowledgeable, and chatted with us about different pairings.  Our meal was awesome and was only complimented by the friendly  staff. Will definitely be back.

Great place for a burger in St. Louis. Great sweet potato fries too. I tried the pretzels as an appetizer and those were good. I built my own turkey burger it was delicious. I had the choice of adding fried pickles to my burger which is best decision ever. The place is bigger than it looks. I sat in the back room which was nice to be away from the live music. The music was great but it does make for a loud atmosphere. There are board games and tvs in back so it was perfect for my friend's daughter to keep her occupied.
One darn good burger, casual fun atmosphere. Would definitely come back to try more!!
First time here and the burger was great.  I had the Whakey Whakey and it was cooked perfectly.  The side salad was good as well.  Great food and service.  I highly recommend this place for a burger.

Great idea , check list :

A check list to build your own burger, and what a list to choose from.
The burgers are one of the best and very juicy , the fries are a bit over done BUT they give you so many that you can pick and choose the best.
Everything is served on  a pizza pan and it filled with burger fries and what ever you choose to stack it with.
The service is fantastic and our waitress Jamie is so funny and very attractive to look at.
She loves joking around while making sure that we had a fun lunch time adventure.

Yes we recommend you stop in S.City and try a burger or what ever you choose from the menu..

Thanks Jamie for a fun Two Hour Lunch... see you soon

Enjoy this place quite a bit. I would give five stars but the place is small and you're always shoulder to shoulder with everyone else eating their dinner m 
That might be ok for some but it makes me feel a little claustrophobic! Other than that it's pretty great!

Met friends there yesterday and were very pleased with the food & service. Two of us ordered burgers (their specialty), my wife grilled chicken and our fourth guest chili and wings. My burger was prepared perfectly (med rare) and topped with lettuce, tomato, cheese and avocado. The option to create your own sandwich is what attracted us to this restaurant. All the other food was delicious also
I have been here multiple times and love it.

This place is shut-your-face-good. We split some guacamole bites that were really crispy on the outside and filled with fresh corn and guac on the inside.  My boyfriend built his own burger which had fantastic ingredients including guac, a fried egg, red onion, sriracha aioli and some hella good bourbon bacon jam on a pretzel bun. I got the wakey wakey on brioche and almost cried with joy.   So juicy. So flavorful. Add a friendly bartender Sam and craft beer and you have yourself a great dive with great dinner.

Back to Stacked tonight.  Another tasty burger.  Went pretty plain tonight and it was kick ass, as usual.  I almost went for the burger of the month again, the Thanksgiving on a bun, but I went old school. You know you have a good burger when a pretty plain burger is great!

This place is pretty solid. They have a decent bar and the servers/bartender are attentive without being annoying. 
I tried the guacamole appetizer and it was decent. 
I got the wakey wakey with bacon and strawberry jam. It was delicious. The egg could have been a little more runny for my preference but it was a good burger. 
My brother got the hairy pig and it was also delish. 
The vibe was chill. TVs were located at good angles to catch the Cards game. I'll come back to try out more of the menu.

Been waiting to try this for quite some time. It was definitely worth it. The selections of burgers is fantastic. The staff is super friendly and the food was Amazing!!!!

We got the En Feugo and Wakey Wakey. They were cooked to perfection. The fries were great too. The spicy ketchup had a nice kick. And we also ordered a fried pickle basket. The dipping sauce was fantastic. They have a nice selection of beers on tap and bottles. It's nice to see the local microbrews on tap. Will definitely be telling people about this and be going back.

this place has amazing burgers!!

there is a large selection of burgers to choose from, on the small menu, but if none of them are something that you'd like they have a build your own burger that's perfect for the finicky eater. As if that not enough options they have a burger of the month.  Although I wish that they had a selection of meat besides beef. I would like to see bison added to the menu. there is a child's menu & a few more tables outside 

I was there with a few friends and sampled the burger of the month the "Billy Madison" very good!! my burger was just as good but on a whole other level then then peanut butter and bacon. 

the restaurant is very tiny plan to wait. there are not very many tables  or much room to move. hope that they expand or get a second location closer to me. my experience with the wait staff wasn't as good as it should of been. our server was average but the bar staff wasn't attentive at all. we stood in the bar area next to the bar and no one asked us if we wanted anything to drink for about 15-20 minutes. good thing I wasn't thirsty. 

We tried the guacamole bites for an appetizer and wasn't thrilled with them. the chips on the Billy Madison burger & the garlic fries were just meh. I thought the garlic fires tasted greasy but a friend really liked them. Not a big fan of shoe string fries though.the homemade chips were hard  and not tasty at all. 

this place is in a run down slightly shady looking area, but I think they are trying to revamp it. the  building that it is in needs up dating. the décor is unique and fun. there is only street parking so if you have anything of value keep it out of plan view. it is near a few trendy places like the ivory theater, across the street, the casino is just about a mile south of this place. 

definitely going back to try more of the burgers

I usually try different things when I eat somewhere but my go-to has become, "The Goat" with a side of potato fries and some Chipotle aoli.

The Goat is simple. A delicious burger topped with perfectly sweet carmelized onions and a tangy goat cheese. This burger has the perfect mix of flavors but I usually slap some Chipotle aoli on a few bites for the extra zing.

I had the El Fuego, which the server said was the most popular menu item. If you're a big spicy-eater, this one probably won't really hit the spot. Even with fried jalapenos (delicious), it kind of lacked that kick that I expected. I usually like to get my burgers done well, but I think that was the wrong choice here. It ended up tasting really dry. My partner got his burger medium well though and he loved it. So that could make all the difference. 

I thought the fries were pretty bland too. The texture was good, but they need some seasoning. 

I was also a little disappointed that the speciality sodas weren't in bottles, but I guess that was a misread on my part.

Also, if you're an environmentalist, you might like to know that they use styrofoam take-out containers and put straws directly in your drink.

So, final verdict: I would go back if friends wanted to, but I wouldn't suggest it.

This place has great burgers! I'm getting a craving even thinking about it. Tucked away in deep south city, this gem is worth a try. They have a bunch of different pre-designed burgers on the menu, varying from gyro-burger to goat burger and everything in between (I'm not sure what's in between a goat and lamb, but just go with it). You can also build your own which I decided to do...but it was tough. They offer so many options. I had MO raised grass fed beef patty on brioche bun, with tomatoes and lettuce, cheddar cheese, and Chipotle Aioli...with a fried egg on top. OH baby it was good. The hand cut fries are delicious as well, but it's hard for anything to stand up to that burger. 

They have a ton of beers on tap and some tables outside. The atmosphere is cool and service was good. 

Pros: fantastic burgers!, cool atmosphere, good beer selection
Cons: it's going to ruin every other burger I'll ever have

Great value for a burger. Burger is large and comes with a large side order (I personally prefer the homemade chips). Fried pickles are thin and crispy, almost chip-like. Staff is always well educated on all parts of the menu. Kind of feel like all the toppings of the burger overpower the meat itself. Overall, great place.
I ordered the burger of the month (June '15). It was ground chuck with pulled pork, potato salad, and their mustard sauce. By far the most delicious burger I've ever had.

This place is really good! Got the guacamole fritters as an appetizer to start. Ordered the burger special that was made with a cream sauce and jalapeños. Delicious! Oh and sweet potato fries were good too. Lunch was crowded but no wait. Highly recommend. Waitress was very polite and was knowledgable about the menu.

I went here with a fellow Yelper. I was tired of reading everyone else's review and I was really craving a good hamburger. I was greeted at the door and assigned a seat, my dinner companion arrived shortly. We got a table by the restroom, I know this because every so often I got a whiff of the place. The waitress was a little slow, I got a Blue Moon. I had already scanned the menu on line and I knew that I wanted the Greek burger and sweet potato fries. I asked for no bun, which was not a problem. The presentation was perfect with grilled onions and cucumber slices across the top. The burger nestled on a dollop or greek sauce and a bed of feta cheese. I am glad I opted for no bun because it was fun to watch my dinner companion eat his VERY VERY messy burger on a bun. The sweet fires were cooked to perfection, but way to many fries. It took a bit to get the check and even longer for the waitress to come back and collect. I will be back again because the food was great, just hoping for a more efficient waitress.

Wow... That's a delicious burger. Hands down my favorite burger in the city. Excellent grill flavor but also fresh beef flavor, cooked to perfection for me both visits now. Service was excellent, we we're welcomed warmly and waited for a table they were on it ASAP. the bun also is big enough to hold up to the size of the patty, and as many toppings as you want.. Highly recommended. Wish I lived closer.
Great burger. Great service. Cool atmosphere. Location is a few blocks from a sketchy area of town but a must if you are already close.

As a vegetarian this is one of my favorite places to indulge in a solid meatless burger. My carnivore friends swear it's their favorite place for a full patty of chuck. Great tap list and even better pile of fries (add fire salt).
Great burgers and cheap prices. Fun place to get some drinks. Sunday brunch is super cheap and really good. Get the sriracha patty it's one of my favorites.

YUMMY!!! This place is delicious! I came here for dinner and waited about 20 minutes to be seated. Luckily, they have a nice waiting area. When we were seated, the menu had many many options. I don't eat beef so I was nervous, but they had turkey and black bean burgers. I ended up ordering a fried pickles and a turkey burger. Both were fantastic!
Wow Pash M is one of those people. I'm glad I don't have to deal with him. Over $6 he gives the restaurant one star. At least rate the food you cheap mf. This place is delicious. BLT rules!
A bit overhyped.  It's trendiness and formula for being cool don't make up for the average execution of their food.

Stacked Burger Bar is a hidden gem in south city. 
I'm a carnivorous gal and these are some serious burgers! You can customize to your heart's content or go with one of their amazing burgers off the menu.  Vegetarian? Not to worry- there are plenty of delicious vegetarian options, too.
Tonight I had the Big Greek, which is the featured burger of the month (SPOILER ALERT: this phenomenal burger will be featured on Food Network & The Chew next month!) Roasted red pepper hummus, pickled cucumber slices & red onion,  kalamata olive tapenade, and feta cheese. So good.
Bottom line- 
* huge, delicious burgers at fair prices
* friendly staff
* craft beers & great cocktails
You won't be disappointed!

As my fiancé and I were driving down a long and lonesome road, we both heard a loud rumble like a wild animals fearsome growl. Turns out it was my stomach and it was then we realized we needed food. As we searched high and low for an eatery of some sort she noticed a place called Stacked STL on yelp. We followed the path and out in the distance we saw a shimmering light shining, as if a beacon to all those traveling wayfarers to enter, eat and be merry. 

As we walked towards the entrance it was as if they were truly expecting us, for the door opened for us before we could reach it! Walking in was as if we were catching a glimpse of the halls of Valhalla! The meat! The alcohol! The atmosphere! We sat down wherever we pleased and looked at the menu, no! Not just a menu! It was as if it was our menu! We could make our own burgers however we pleased! We then placed our orders and anticipated our meals coming to fruition. Lo! The chef himself! He exits the kitchens with two of the most delicious looking burgers I've ever laid eyes on! As I take my first bite my senses are overwhelmed. The bun, the juicy sirachi patty, it was like a fire chicken danced the two step on my taste buds, and to wash it all down with an ice cold beer. Now that's what I'm talking about St. Louis.
