This is where burgers are made and hunger dies, so yea, I guess you could say I liked it.

All I can say is that's it's nice to finally have a specialty burger joint in town! 

I tried one of the menu burgers. ..otherwise known as "The Goat." This was a good sized burger....at least two hands to hold....It came with melted goat cheese with an onion jam.. don't ask cause I don't know what onion jam is. I'll be honest it looked like chunky black tar. However it tasted of Heaven! I'm serious here I've never eaten something that looked like melted roof tiles but tasted that awesome! 

I love goat cheese and was skeptical that this was going to be real but I was pleasantly surprised with the authenticity and taste of this cheese. It covered the whole burger and was piping hot. 

The only detractor to this meal was I ordered my burger medium rare and what I got was a solid medium. But I can overlook this slight mishap because the flavor profile was over the top delicious. 

I am a bar sitter. Mostly because service at a bar is much more personal and acceptable than having a distant server wait on you and 90 other people.  This was no exception.  The bar tender was very nice and definitely knew the menu and her profession very well. 
All in all if the chef could have gotten the meat Temps down this would have been a five star rating!

After ordering delicious quality burgers and the house made chips, 30 minute time hit the spot and kept us full for the rest of the night (3:30 pm lunch). And to top that off, offered desert choices was the Apple Pie bites. Let me say those were amazing.. Would definitely come back again to dine. We wanted to know what amenities were nearby this location and if it was a franchise-it's the only location. Check it out. Free soda refills too.

I got the burger of the month which is PBJ, pineapple cream cheese, bacon, and fried jalapeños. I added the onion jam bc that's just so darn good. This was so delicious and cannot wait to bring the hubs back. But the guacamole bites was bar far the best part of the meal!

I am continuously impressed but this Burger joint!  the Buger of the Month(BOTM) is usually my Go to if it is something I even remotely enjoy.  The unique flavors they add together are so amazing.   The BOTM for Jan was the RANG- 40/60 Pork/beef patty, with Crab Rangoon spread, a crispy wonton, with a sweet and sour glaze.  This is one of the best burgers I have ever eaten.  The 40/60 pork/beef patty is a whole new ballgame for me...Go on a limb and take the risk adn even split the BOTM with your table and try it...I went 3 times in january and took different people with me everytime...they all loved it!

A gem tucked in the Patch, formerly Ivory Coast Bistro, across from the former Melt, and cattycorner to the Ivory Theatre. Overall, an interesting corner of the city.

The decor has been updated, it's a little cheerier,  and hipper, with lots of tasty cow silhouettes on the wall and tables. 

I about jumped in my seat when I heard they had Abraxas on tap, I'm no beer snob, but this thing is special, a coffee/chocolate stout like no other. Fit the meal perfectly. They've got some other drafts and AB.

Our server was on point and cheerful, clearly a fan of the food, and hustling the entire dining room, she was excellent.

Most importantly, the burger was great, very beefy, a beefcake if you will. I made my own topped w/ bubbly glistening fontina, fried pickles, and chipotle aioli. It was awesome, the brioche bun is the way to the go. My friend got the Rooster, topped with Sricha and spicy slaw, she was also impressed. The spicy ketchup at the table was real nice.

Teetering on a five if only.....

...the hand cut fries had been fresh, I tasted my friends and they were nearly hard. My sweet potato fries were average.
Perfect burger!  Got s pretzel bun bacon burger and OMG was it good.  Big burgers.  Fries were tasty too.

I've had stacked STL bookmarked for awhile and we finally decided to dine here for late lunch/early dinner. At first i thought it was a very small restaurant but it started to get busier and I was wondering where everyone was getting seated. Apparently they have another room lol. Anyways, I ordered en fuego burger. It was good! It would of been nice to have a little more jalapeño. I will ask for extra next time. My husband had some kind of mushroom burger which he enjoyed. My sister in law had the dictator, it was huge! I tried some of the sausage and it was pretty good. She enjoyed her burger too. My brother in law has the wet nap and that was also huge but he loved his burger too. We all enjoyed our burgers, they were really good. It was that or we were starving because we haven't ate all day lol. Fries were really cold, not fresh or hot at all. Mac n cheese balls were also great! My 11 month old enjoyed them!

Service was phenomenal! Our server was super friendly and very attentive. We will definitely be back to try other burgers!
This place not only had amazing, custom burgers, but a great atmosphere and service to boot. I'd highly recommend here for singles and families.

Such a fun burger joint for dinner! We sat at the bar to eat dinner since there were no tables available when we came in. The bartender, Rachael, was efficient and friendly. I had the hot chicken wings and a side salad as my meal. The dressing was delicious and light, and the croutons were crunchy and flavorful. The freshly shaved Parmesan cheese was a nice accompaniment, too. The wings came out piping hot and flavorful, although I could've had them a little saucier. The skin was nice and crispy while the meat was juicy! The boyfriend had The Wet Nap burger. It was huge and the toppings were plentiful! The fries were just meh- we've had better. They also have a build your own burger option as well. If I had wanted a burger, I would've gone that route. I don't get too crazy with my hamburgers. 

Overall, it was yummy, decent prices, and great service and not too "out there" for a burger place.

Hands down one of the best gluten free buns I've ever had. I got the "goat" pictured here. Goat cheese, onion jam. Delicious. Fryer isn't safe for celiacs so go with the apple sauce or broccoli as your side. Menu marks items with gluten in them but it wasn't 100% accurate so be sure to ask questions.

Service was good. We were greeted and seated right away. I ordered the En Fuego burger and it was good but it would have been better if cooked to the temp I asked for. I asked for med well and it was closer to med rare. The hubs asked for his Wakey Wakey Burger to be medium and it was well done. Also he added bacon, which they forgot and then rushed his bacon which resulted in undercooked flabby fatty bacon. I would go back for the buy one get one half off deal on Mondays, but don't think it's worth what they charge for a burger.

This has to be the best place in STL to get a burger. One of the best indicators about a restaurant is how full it is; Stacked STL was PackedSTL on a Tuesday night at 6:30. We had to find a hidden table but were immediately recognized upon entry. Racheal waited on us, she was attentive and over-flowing with contagious enthusiasm about StackedSTL. She got us a couple drinks quickly and then off to the ordering options... so many burger options, so little time. Add to that, one can build their own if the house concoctions don't suit one's fancy, it felt like we couldn't go wrong. I love the optional upgrade to grass fed, yum. We started with some fried pickles, crisp, flavorful and not at all soggy, like many competitors... The Burgers showed up as we finished the pickles, perfectly cooked, excellent bread, exceptionally flavorful and beautifully presented. Nothing fancy, just a burger w/ side of fries, no nonsense just good stuff.

I am not surprised StackedSTL is STL's Yelp Choice for best burger, great enthusiastic staff, great drink options and burgers off the chart. This is a place to add to your restaurant bucket list...
These burgers are the best! If you want a real burger you must come here. I'm hooked!

We went here for the first time the other day, and we have to say we are definitely fans of the burgers here!

He had the Big Kahuna, and as a burger lover and connoisseur, he is very picky when it comes to burgers! The pineapple was chunky enough to be tasted on top of the juicy burger, and the brioche bun was nice and soft too. Everything just went well together on the burger and complimented each other! He said the burger he had was definitely up there with the best he has tasted, and wants to go back to create his own burger.

She had the Big Fat Greek Burger, and enjoyed it a lot. She said the burger was great, but would have preferred a brioche bun instead of the wheat bun the burger came with! All the toppings and condiments that were on the burger worked great together.

If we were rating this solely on just the burgers, and not the whole meal and experience, we would have given it a 5 star rating. However, what let the meal down were the fries - they were a little soggy and whilst they may be fresh cut, this left the impression and taste that they weren't! Also, the server we had wasn't sure on what the happy hour specials were, and didn't tell us appetizers were half off, along with the beer specials she did mention.

A little brush up on staff knowledge of the menus and specials (we weren't informed or aware there was a burger of the month), and a little work on the fries and our review would definitely be a 5 star review. The place itself is cool and quirky!

Overall - we will definitely be back for more burgers, and highly recommend this place to others.

I've spent little to no time in this part of town, but it looks absolutely sweet! And we had no problem finding parking on the street at around 2:30p on Labor Day. 

There's no hostess station at the door and there wasn't a waitress around, so we sat ourselves. Mostly because it's a somewhat small space and I felt uncomfortable standing right next to a table of people eating. 

I scanned the menu, but didn't find a burger that was quite crazy enough for my tastes so I grabbed the Create-Your-Own Menu. They have a pad of them and provide a jar of pencils so you can select everything you want. Start with the patty - I was happy to see they offer grass-fed!! Then your bun - I went without (I kinda wish they offered a lettuce wrap). Then your choice of any the free choices - lettuce, tomato, pickles, onions, etc. Then all the pay extra items. Many different sauces. But I went with the brisket and bacon.

The grass-fed patty was very juicy and very flavorful. The two bacon slices were thick and and delicious! I can't say the brisket was anything terribly special. But it was pretty tender and definitely added to the pile of meat on each fork full. 

My biggest disappointment - they were out of sweet potato fries!!! Very upset!

So, I went with the park fries instead. They were fine. They were thin and sometimes a little over-cooked and crispy and they were mildly seasoned. 

My husband got some kind of burger with fried jalepenos with a side of broccoli and loved everything! (Although I think the serving of broccoli seemed quite small, especially compared to my heaping pile of fries.)

Overall, I'm pretty sure we'll come back. Probably on another Monday so we can take advantage of BOGO 50% off burgers.

I LOVED everything here. We waited a little bit for our table and for the bartender to take our drink orders (she turned out to be our waitress as well). She was so sweet and quirky and made our drinks so well. I had the Hot Tomata Bloody Mary and it was the perfect amount of spice and flavor. Then I got the En Fuego burger. It was cooked exactly to my preference and was super juicy and full of flavor. The fries were great as well! I'll definitely be coming back!

It was fate that landed me at Stacked. We were supposed to go to another place in the area that wound up being closed on Sunday...and thank goodness for that! The food was amazing!

I came in with zero expectations. Another burger bar, I thought. Ho hum.

I decided to create my own burger. There's so much to choose from, I think you run the risk of really screwing it up if you pick too many toppings. I went with a ground chuck patty, topped with fontina cheese, caramelized onions, fried pickles, chipotle aioli on a pretzel bun. I wouldn't have changed a thing! Everything was just so incredibly good and just seasoned perfectly, including the hand-cut fries. A flavor explosion is what it was!

I will be back soon for another burger. This was one of the best I've had in a while. If I can prove that this first visit wasn't a fluke, I'd put this burger right up there with Seamus and O'Connell's...and that's saying a lot!

Best burgers in my area, in my opinion. We've been here on several visits.. table for eight?? Not a problem. Last visit for a birthday dinner of eight was perfect. Eight burgers were ordered and served all together, each cooked exactly to specifications. You can order from the menu or "Build your own" with many, many options. I myself had two craft drafts.. one the Red Irish and the second the Nitro Stout. The Red was very good but The Stout was outstanding,  dark with just a hint of bitterness. It came with a nice head and was absolutely perfect. Excellent food, great beer and excellent service makes this our go to place for burgers.

Absolutely delicious burgers. There is options for all walks of life, beef, pork, veggie, and bean burger. Several bun options including my all time favorite pretzel buns. And how can you not give a place 5 stars who offers 4oz of delicious brisket for only a dollar. Every time I'm in town this place is a must visit.
Delicious burgers. Large space. Good service. Lots of things on the menu. Casual. The salads are also very good.

Absolutely, hands down THE best burger place in St.Louis! It's not close. It starts with awesome service from the owners Sam and Matt, to the bartenders like Kim. Great menu, which is burger centric but offer other fare. The build your own burger menu is my favorite! 

If you are into fun, funky places that don't take themselves too seriously, then I recommend this place 10 times out of 10. Get there, order a beer and a burger. Have fun!

I have mixed feelings. Anyone who knows me knows I am not a fan of street parking, so no parking lot as I pulled up was an immediate downer for me. The location is not the greatest. The chairs are uncomfortable. But the waiter was so pleasant and attentive without being intrusive. My burger was tasty. I had the En Fuego and although it was not all that spicy, it did taste good. I wish I had ordered it medium well instead of medium but that's on me. I did not care for the fries. Very thin and over cooked. Over all it was fine but I wouldn't choose to go back.

Best Burgers in Saint Louis
Friendly and Courteous Staff
Gets busy in the weekends, so plan accordingly.
This place is amazing. What a hidden gem. The burgers are the best I've ever had. You can taste the difference with the grass fed beef. If you haven't been here you have to try it.

I've visited this place 5 or 6 times and never had a bad experience.  I have eaten at the bar and also at a table with a friend and found the service to be friendly and attentive each time.  Considering everything is made to order, you have to wait awhile for your food but it is worth the wait.  

I don't think you would be disappointed with anything on the menu but I've only had the burgers and fries.  I have had several specialty burgers and burger of the month as well as a build your own.  All outstanding.  I would add that because the fries are cut shoestring they cool off quick.  

They also have a  wide selection of beers on tap so if they don't have what you're looking for, it's probably not made.  They also have a full bar and pride themselves on their bourbon selection.

Great burgers with a yummy selection of craft brews. Everything tasted fresh and perfect. The only challenge was that although my husband had indicated that he no longer ate ice cream, the brownie came to the table with it on top, anyway. However, I was happy to take care of it for him. We will return.
Stacked is my favorite burger joint! Their burger of the month is always new and exciting and the staff is always warm and welcoming. I live down the street, so I try to come in as much as possible!
Fairly unique bar and grill. I would recommend bringing some friends over and have a few burgers and beers. This place has got a pretty good atmosphere to speak of!
Always great food. Love the choices for your burgers and the apps great place to watch the game have a beer and enjoy the great food.

This is a must eat! The bavarian pretzel and mac and cheese ball appetizers were delicious! The pretzel may be the best i have ever had. The fried pickles were not the best however. The burger was cooked perfectly and I customized it to make it the perfect burger.
This is a burger place that takes itself seriously, and for good reason! A high quality beer list compliments these burgers too.
Ended up eating there as a fluk, but it was definitely yummy! All four us enjoyed our burgers. I'll order the BLT (maple bacon jam, field greens, garlic roasted tomatoes) again!
This place is a true hidden gem! The food was AMAZING!!! We also liked that they serve local beer and soda. And the device was spectacular!!

This is a great lil pub. had great house drinks & house food but most fun was the custom build your own burgers. mac/cheese appetizers were insane. We loved the buffalo ranch & chipotle aioli sauces. They offer the Best customer service & have a side note on the drink menu to buy a bucket of beer for the chefs....So we did!

I love this place. I had my boyfriends 30th here and the staff is so friendly. This place does take a little longer then your average restaurant/bar but it is more then worth the wait! They have Buy 1 Get 1 1/2 off on Mondays which is amazing!

I went to Stacked over the weekend with a small group of friends for a birthday party get together. My friend said that she called ahead in an attempt to make a reservation, but they only do those for groups of 10+ (there were 5 of us). However, the lady said that she made a note of it in "the book" for when we came in. The guy at the door said that absolutely not we don't take reservations unless you have 10 or more people, we would just have to wait like everyone else. We were a little upset, but oh well. We sat down to wait (approximately 45 minutes).
About 20 minutes into the wait, a couple of people went in to get drinks from the bar. The lady behind the bar consistently ignored them and would serve people who came up later over our people. There wasn't a line or anything, she just didn't want to serve us.
45 minutes came and went and we didn't have a table. People who arrived after us were being seated before us, even though we were regularly asking the guy when our table would be ready--to which he always said we were next. A total lie.
By the time we finally got seated it was after over an hour of waiting. Our waitress came and she was relatively nice. The chili came quickly, but that's the last decent thing that happened.
Our food took 55 minutes to get to our table. And if that's how long it took for everyone, fine. But there were tables of people who arrived after us, got their food, and left before we even got our food. I had another arrangement that I had to be at, so because the service was so terrible and took so long, I had to get my food boxed up before I even had a chance to look at it.
The burger was decent at best and the fries were soggy. The only way I would eat anything from this place again is if someone brought it to me.
I have never been so upset with the service I have received. We didn't even receive one half-assed apology for the wait.

Went for lunch today with friends. The food was really good. I got the En Fuego burger. It was busy but not crazy. The service was pretty bad. We were waiting for a table and there was no bartender and no one asked if we wanted a drink. And then we finally sat at the bar for lunch and it took forever to take our order. Would have drank more beers but the waitress rarely asked is how we were. 

I will go back if someone else wants to grab a burger. But I don't plan on bringing this place up as an option when thinking about lunch. It's unfortunate, was excited to have another burger place in town.
If you're going to splurge this is the place to enjoy a HAND PATTY BURGER that you can create yourself or try one of their's.
Love this place. It's always amazing. I make my own burger and it's perfect every time. The area it's in is a little scary. Some questionable people out but we've never had an issue.
Delicious burgers, fries, chips, wings, appetizers, all of it!  And if you don't see something on the menu that you want, you can make your own!  Service was good, folks friendly, food was fantastic!

This place is between Broadway and 55, south of Loughborough and north of the River Des Peres. Simple U- shaped bar with a handful of local beers on tap. There are 3 tvs with sports on.

The burgers are very tasty. I had the En Fuego. A variety of sides are available; I got the sweet potato fries. 

I would actually rank this place higher, but the service was poor. They may have been understaffed the day I went. Go and decide for yourself. I'll try again because the burgers are worth it.

My favorite place for a great Burger!!  Order from the menu or build it yourself, how can you go wrong with choices of beef, buffalo or pork prepared to your heart's desire.  Love the atmosphere and their beers on tap pretty good.  Highly recommended...
By far the best burgers in St.Louis! If you are looking for the next perfect burger you need to try this place

Love it. This is our favorite restaurant. I always get the en fuego, he gets the wakey wakey with a beef patty. You can't go wrong here. This place is gonna get huge--props to the owner for this amazing restaurant!

We decided to starting hitting up all the Stl top 10 best burger joints. This was on the list and was yet another average burger place. Should be  2.5 stars.

The Good: people complained about service  here in the past, but we didn't experience any of that. Server was fast, drinks fast and food was fast. Sweet potato fries were good.

The Bad: only 4 craft beers on draft. I understand this is a dirty south city area location with mainly bud drinkers but through us craft beer junkies a bone!

The Ugly: I am not sure what the deal is with so called "top burger joints" in St Louis, all of them so far don't season their meat. It's cooking/grilling 101... It's called salt and pepper....don't be afraid of it, it's your friend! Nothing is worse then as a customer I have to season your burger for you. If you don't properly season your meat, then it has no flavor and you are relying on your toppings only for flavor. 

So far our best burger places we have found so far are 1. Epic Pizza, yeah it's a pizza place but with one of the most amazingly seasoned burgers. 2. Five Guys... Yea a franchise... But they figured out how to be successful by seasoning their meat.

The Word For Today Is.....Seasoning! Lol

I come here at least twice a month it never gets old. They are known for their burgers which are extraordinary!!! Despite being the place for beef 70% of the time I get the"Gobbler", the best damn turkey burger I ever had!!!! 

I had an aunt and uncle visit on their way through town from  California to Indiana and  brought them in they loved it! They were so impressed on their way back through they requested a return visit to Stacked!
Yelp got us here before theater at the Ivory.  Interesting burger concept. 100% approval from group.  Anxious to return.

I love burgers!  Always have and always will.  Grew up on McDonald's . . .

Heard about Stacked STL but never made it down to their location at 7637 Ivory Street in South City.  Wanted to go during the week to avoid the crowds and tonight was the perfect evening to eat there.

After looking at all of the burgers on the menu, I decided to "build my own."  So I had the 60/40 8 ounce burger with cheese, honey mustard, lettuce, pickles, onions, relish mustard on sourdough bread . . . BEYOND DELICIOUS!!!!  I am going to ONLY order this burger next time I'm there - which will be soon.

If you are wanting a delicious healthy-size 8 ounce burger that is delicious - along with great service and wonderful atmosphere.  Don't forget to write on the chalkboard in the men's restroom - I guess you can go in there if you are a lady . . .

Went to Stacked and loved it.  Burgers are great,  Starter was great.  Atmosphere was fun, friendly and upbeat.  Reasonably priced.  LIke it a lot.  Will go back.
Robert P

The food and prices are good. I customized my burger using the check sheet at the table. I thought was awesome. That way your food comes out right the first time The staff was really nice. The atmosphere was really not to loud.  Recommend trying if you want a good burger.
Decent burgers, but they don't follow the cooking guide I learned. Their medium is medium-rare, the well done are medium-well. Order acvordingly.

Hands down the best place for burgers! Build your own burgers any way you could possibly want!
Appetizers are also amazing from fried guac, nachos! Love this place! A bit more expensive than a regular burger place but WELL worth it!

Thos place was GREAT! Good meat, good drinks, good potatoes, fun atmosphere- will return! The boy mentioned the only thing that would make it better is if there was an option for Buffalo meat.  I didn't get any pics this time, which is usually a great sign that the food looked too good to remember.

Everyone in the family loves this place! Very cool vibe and they have bogo 1/2 on burgers on Monday who couldn't pass that up?!! Great bar food. We usually always start with the guacamole bites which are both spicy and satisfying and hold us over until we put our burger order in and receive our meal.. I haven't yet ventured out and tried any of there speciality burgers nor put any of the seasonings they offer for your fries yet but some day I will! I just can't pass up building my own burger  Do check out!

We really enjoyed Stacked! They have quite a burger menu. Lots of interesting albeit weird combos to top your burger. In fact, most of the combos were a bit too strange for us. 

I got the Goat. Burger topped with goat cheese and onion jam. It was really good! The meat on the burger was juicy and tasty. My only complaint was the onion jam. It tasted great but there was just a huge gob of it on top of the cheese. Would've been better if the jam were on the opposite side of the cheese and much less of it. Hubby had the Wet Nap, burger topped with beef brisket and an onion ring. He liked it but I have an issue topping meat with a different meat (except bacon-lol). 

If you just want a basic burger with a piece of cheese you have to fill out a build your own burger menu. It would be nice if just a plain burger was offered and you didn't have to fill out every little choice on the BYO burger menu. Just a suggestion!

The fries were awesome- shoe string, crispy and nicely seasoned. We also had a house salad with house vinaigrette. It was good, could've  benefited from a touch more dressing but nice fresh greens, shaved parm, veggie and homemade croutons. 

Loved the trendy little corner where the bar sits! It's a small place with maybe 12 tables, off street parking. Good service and friendly people. We will be back!

This place has been on my STL list for a couple years now. It was worth the wait, just wish I didn't choose to wait so long. 
The location is unassuming as its in a lil shady neighborhood but kinda cool at the same time. Plenty of street parking, just lock your doors. STL isn't the safest places unfortunately. 
Once inside, it has a couple eating area options, one in and around the bar area and the other in a back much quieter room.  I like those options. 
We chose the hot wings first and they were good. I always order my wings crispy because I'm not a fan of the skin pulling off like a rubber band.  They could have been cooked even a lil more. Great flavor though, and perfect size. Decent price too for 8 wings, $8.50
Now on to the burgers, oh my.....they were outstanding.  My son built his own. He ordered the house chips with his and they were just avg. I order their most popular, The En Fuego. It was one of the best burgers I've ever had. Period. I can't wait to try a new one soon. 
Prices are decent for what you get.  
App, 1 beer, 2 burgers was $37.50 before tax.

AMAZING burgers!!  Hubby had the En Fuego (holy YUM!) and I had the bacon blue cheese burger.  Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.  Fries were delicious as well!!

Service was great during the Sunday dinner time rush.  Will most definitely be back!

I'm giving four stars on the food and the benefit of the doubt that the huge private party in back was the reason for the slow kitchen. We waited quite a while after ordering, but when we got out food it was delicious. It sounds like others have seen service impacted by private parties though, so hopefully they learn how to balance. My only other complaint is their beer list, or lack of. It seems they had some decent beers, but no list, and the bartender didn't seem interested in running through the options. I'll definitely be back for another shot and hope some of the problems were a one time issue.

We saw lots of good reviews and had to check it out. It's in a part of town where you feel like you are in Mayberry or something. I am almost 50 years old and had a lot of burgers but I have to tell you this is the best I have ever had. I got the goat burger. Lots of gooey goat cheese and this onion jam that was out of this world. My husband and son got a mushroom burger and they both said the same the best burger ever. The only negative is I got the house made chips and they were really hard and salty. My husband got fries and they were good. My son got a side salad and it was not a normal salad, had lots of toppings and he loved it. My daughter got chicken fingers like she always does, she loved them. Service was very good . It does take a little while to get your food but it's very fresh and worth it. If I had one of these inLittle Rock I would be in trouble because I would be here a lot

I really enjoyed this place! A huge variety of burger choices or if you can't find one you like, build your own! They have many unique sauces, toppings and cheeses. The burgers were excellent! The house made spicy ketchup is awesome and adds a nice "kick" to your fries. 

    Not only is the food great, but the service and atmosphere were warm and inviting. We were there on a Friday night and there was a guy doing live cover music, which added to the atmosphere. Staff were friendly and welcoming from the time we walked in the door until we left. Stacked also has a great local beer selection and a variety of mixed drinks, including a spicy Bloody Mary. Great, casual place for a delicious burger and a beer!

This place is the bomb dot com every single time!!! Crazy great food , cool people fun times, great entertainment! Great price!! 
Don't miss out
Been here a few times only to never be disappointed. Their bloody Mary's are great and each burger has its own unique taste signature that will rock your socks off.

Went here before a concert at Enterprise Center.  Amazing burger.  A real meat burger and not a smash burger   Create my own to take me back to Dooley's downtown.  Pub cheese and carmelized onions.  Fries, think SteaknShake if a real chef made them.  Skinny, skins on perfection.  Homade cheese sauce.  Need I say more.

My mom was in town and we were both having a serious craving for a burger.

I had been wanting to try Stacked and I thought it would be less crowded than the Dam (which I also REALLY want to try) so onward south we went!

I think we went around noon on a Saturday and it was full but not packed and we didn't have to wait for a table. We met Christine F. and her mom there too which made it even more fun! 

We all ordered something different, but all got what we came for..burgers. My judge of a good burger is really quite simple: 1) does it have some seasoning (but not too much)? and  2) is it cooked how i wanted, which is always, medium. Please tell me WHY hardly any place get this right??? But guess what? Stacked nailed it! YAY!

I got my burger on sourdough which was perfectly buttery and toasty, cheddar and bacon. It was perfection!

Everyone else loved their food too. And my mom was in town a few weeks later and guess where she wanted to go?.....and yes, it was just as good the 2nd time around. Can't wait to go back!

Incredible burgers, sweet potato fries, and appetizers. House salad is also great. I appreciate the grass fed option!  The bacon bourbon maple jam is so good. Every time I come back I am reminded how phenomenal the burgers are! So good! Update: love the grass fed burger with bacon maple jam, garlic tomatoes, caramelized onions, and sweet potato fries! As always, the grass fed burger was cooked to a perfect medium rare. Great service and house salad as well!

I've searched far and wide for a burger joint like this one. The burger options were creative but not overdone to the point of being annoying. I ordered The Goat, which had "melted goat cheese topped with onion jam." It was simple and perfect. The quality of the meat was the best I've had in St. Louis (and pretty much just as good as I've had anywhere), and the burger was cooked to the exact temperature I ordered it. The server was friendly, knowledgeable, and not overbearing. If there was one disappointing aspect of the visit, it was that the bar was slow to the point of seeming like it was empty (I went on a Saturday night). Hopefully more people catch on to this great new spot so that the people-watching becomes one more reason to come here. I can't wait to come back for breakfast.

Went tonite trying something new. Best black been burger ever. Potato fries good. Go very hungry though it's so much food for great price. Could only eat half of it. The best fried pickles too. Our waitress was friendly and great. Will go back again.

Seriously, The Holy Grail of burger restaurants, the pinnacle of Culinary expertise, this place redefines what it means to eat a burger, it changes the name from ''hole in the wall'' to hole in God's secret kitchen where he cooks burgers fit for angels! It Surpassed my expectations by leaps and bounds. So I chose the option where I could Custom make my order, and little did I know I would be making a masterpiece, a Van Gough of ground beef succulents. I couldn't believe how much flavor could be packed into meat between two pieces of bread, it was amazing in itself just to marvel at that fact alone. And not to mention they introduced me to their home made spicy ketchup...let's just say, I feel it's a sin to consume regular ketchup after experiencing that. Then that first bite, it was unlike anything I've ever had in burger history. I couldn't believe what I had just tasted, the meat had a level of tenderness and texture I could feel was something extraordinary. The BBQ sauce was dripping off the thick cut slices of smoked bacon, with an unmatched regin of tangy delicious power. It was all converging together with the jalapenos adding a spice that danced off my taste Buds asking where, where did you get this incredible food? The bun was like 2 buttery golden pillows designed to house an empire of what was hands down the best burger I have ever had in my life. Stacked STL. you have stolen my heart when it comes to a burger, that simply cannot be beat. For that, I say thank you.

This place has gotten muuuuch better since their opening week (my last review). Their beer selection rotates around and the vast majority of their taps are quite good. I love all those Civil Life and Perennial brew they put on!

The burgers are great, though the custom burger order sheet overwhelms, so I always go with the pre-defined recipes.

The folks at Stacked are great neighbors to the Carondelet community.
Best burger in STL hands down! Love this place and their food! You will not be disappointed

I enjoy many items on the menu but I love the burgers let me say this... there aint a woman alive that is Stacked STL better than the burger I get with those sexy warm buns every time I order. You think it's a joke go see for yourself. Friendly atmosphere clean and very polite waitresses. The parking is not so great at times but heck the food is worth you coming in so catch a darn bus and don't make a fuss. LOL. You want to know about pricing go see for yourself. LOL

We saw lots of good reviews and had to check it out. It's in a part of town where you feel like you are in Mayberry or something. I am almost 50 years old and had a lot of burgers but I have to tell you this is the best I have ever had. I got the goat burger. Lots of gooey goat cheese and this onion jam that was out of this world. My husband and son got a mushroom burger and they both said the same the best burger ever. The only negative is I got the house made chips and they were really hard and salty. My husband got fries and they were good. My son got a side salad and it was not a normal salad, had lots of toppings and he loved it. My daughter got chicken fingers like she always does, she loved them. Service was very good . It does take a little while to get your food but it's very fresh and worth it. If I had one of these inLittle Rock I would be in trouble because I would be here a lot.

I was craving a burger which is rare for me, I asked yelp about the best burger in town and here I sit. Let me start by saying the staff is great!!  I really felt like they wanted me to have the best experience. They had pumpkin beer on draft, I asked them if they could rim the glass with cinnamon sugar, a Boston thing and no-one in STL will do it and lo behold they were more than happy to accommodate me!! Now time for the menu, right away I spot "The Goat", right up my alley with goat chz and onion jam, sauteed onions with balsamic, cooked to my liking. Delicious!!! My fiancee got,"En Fuego"  he was more than happy, we both got the homemade chips next time I'm getting the sweet potatoe fries!! Yes there will be a next time!! I almost forgot the salad!! We got the Caesar, homemade croutons and just the right amount of anchovies in the dressing!!  I'm thinking I like this place....A LOT!!!!

yes please! from the decor to the people to the menu everything is great! I built my own burger. which was a 60/40 patty with pepper jack cheese, Chipotle aioli, caramelized onions, guac, bacon, raw onions, pickles and spinach all between a gluten free bun. which held up and tasted very good which is sometimes hard to find. they do a decent job indicating which items contain gluten but do miss some but the staff does know what's going on. I am a huge drinking of water and my glass never got less than half full which is super impressive way to go Kim. if you on the Southside of the city or just in search of a great burger come here.  lots of drinks, full menu, even vegetarian options too.  a great hidden gem to take friends, family, or even a date. the spicy ketchup was great addition to the fries which were some of the best I have had in a while.

My second time here at Stacked and as I'm eating my burger Im trying to figure out why it took so long to visit again.  The menu contains a selection of specialty burgers and the option to build your own. There a few appetizers and salad ootions as well. I ordered the BLT specialty burger.  It's what I had last time and it did not disappoint this time. ot comes with this bacon maple jam that i thought would be gross with the burger but its soooo yum-o.

Stopped in last Sunday to grab a burger and watch football.  The restaurant is cool and the food is awesome! Had the burger with Siracha!  The bartender was awesome. Defiantly a place the next time you want a burger

Its my second visit.  The place was crowded but the waitor keep walking by me getting other people who came in after before me.  Finally, another waitor picked up. Food was great and I will be back.  Great burgers.

I love seeing great restaurants open in South City! Stacked is in a cute building in Carondelet. The menu at Stacked is really good, with choices like grass fed beef and even a vegetarian burger. The burgers are hand made and huge, plus great local beers on tap. I've been there a couple of times and the service has always been good; the waiters are friendly & attentive. Highly recommend!
Excellent burgers! So far my fav in the StL area. We opted for the build your own burger. Perfection. Fries were stringy with skin on. Very good as well. We will be back!

Totally dope burger joint; best I've bad in stl. I tried the Greek burger with some chili cheese fries - was not disappointed. Definitely plan on going back and "creating" my own from their detailed spread sheets provided on the tables. 
The area Stacked is in in south city is a little sketch but the square it's on is definitely up and coming. Cool bars and restaurants. Would totally recommend to anyone wanting a good burger.

I found my experience to be mostly positive, but not perfect.  I was very disappointed by the atmosphere, it felt like a smaller, local version of a chain restaurant.  The meal itself had high points and low points.  The BBQ brisket nachos were quite tasty, and the mac and cheese balls were great (but the portions were odd; plenty of nachos, barely any balls.  Even it out a bit.)  The beer I had was okay, but they were out of the stout for the drink I ordered (the mad cow) and suggested sustituting what I was drinking, which was a poor fit.  My burger itself (the wakey wakey with egg and jam) was great, but the fries were awful.  My date had the goat and sweet potato fries, both got positive remarks, although she stated the onion jam was excessive.  In writing this, I feel like I've improved my memory of the place.  I was really irritated my the mad cow, and the fries were a bummer, but the burger was great and the appetizers were good.  Price was reasonable.  Good end of average, I suppose, if you like the atmosphere enough.

Blt burger with an egg on top was great. Very flavorful burger. The seasoning on the fries was good but they were limp and warm, but not hot. Really let down with the fries which colored the enjoyment of the entire meal.

Soooo yummy! Went there for early dinner/late lunch today... Walked in and immediately felt comfortable and relaxed. Excellent food and our server was adorable (drawing a blank on her name! Young blonde gal)
She was knowledgeable and helpful.  
Can't wait to go back
Incredible burgers, sweet potato fries, and appetizers. House salad is also great. I appreciate the grass fed option!  The bacon bourbon maple jam is so good.

I finally tried Stacked after I had heard so many great things about their burgers. I ordered a Bloody Mary and the En Fuego burger with sweet potato fries. My burger was cooked perfectly, medium rare. It was the most delicious burger I've ever had. Can't wait to come back. Our waitress was extremely attentive as well.

Went for the first time last night after hearing great things. Got seated right away but it took a long time to get our food.  It was just okay.  Not what we expected.  The food was alright but there are many places in the area with much better burgers.

I have recently moved into the neighborhood, been here before, but I have to say MICHELLE  is top notch on service and knowing her customers! She remembered my asking about the Buffalo Chips as a side, and even the type of burger I liked! I watched her with other tables and she was just as good as it gets! Nice to have a local good eats place with friendly people! Kudos to all of you!

This place is really out of my usual way, but I came recently for lunch after a craving for a veggie burger. Parking is street but not hard to find. I LOVE the option of building your own burger. As someone with very picky... er discerning.. tastes, I enjoy picking it how I like it rather than saying "no" to some toppings or asking for others on the side. 

All three of us built our own burgers. And waited... and waited... and waited. Unfortunately, I had an appointment to get to, so the long wait really put a damper on my eating experience. We didn't expect burgers to take so long (around 40 minutes after we ordered). Our food came and we had less than 10 minutes to chow down as much as we could and leave. I wish I had expected the long wait as I would've come earlier. We came after the lunch rush (around 1) though it was busy. My burger was good, but I didn't get to enjoy it (or finish it) because I was so stressed out about getting to my appointment. The fries were ok. I will return sometime, though it being out of my way, it may be awhile.

I have been to stacked 3 times, and I'll definitely be back!!

They have a pretty unique burger menu, plus a great build your own option!!! 

Awesome service, great food!! Sweet drink menu as well. I love the whiskey flight. 

Busy place. I suggest going early to make sure you get a table!!!

My mom and I were looking for a place to have lunch and we were in the Carondelet area. Since my brother worked in the area I called him for a suggestion.
He said Stacked had great hamburgers. It is a small place on a corner.
Who would have thought this little  place would have the most amazing hamburgers
 I consider myself to be very picky, so I loved the idea of the build your own burger.
 I chose the grass fed beef which is definitely  worth the extra $2.00. 
This burger is so amazing you could eat it plain I can't wait to take my husband and daughter here. The staff was very friendly too.

Great great burger place. And they will cook it how you like. I love a good rare burger. Lots of choices on the menu but I liked the build your own burger menu. Mine was perfect. Home cut fries were delicious.  Wasn't a fan of the fried pickles here, not bad just different from what Ive come used to.  Service was stellar and friendly. I will be back

Really good, homemade, wholesome food. I don't eat meat (ya, crazy to try a burger joint, right?), but they had an amazing bean burger. My wife cannot eat wheat, so they grilled up one of the very best burgers she ever ate, without the bun and was very happy as well.

We ended up meeting the young owner and what a cool dude he is! The story of the restaurant is impressive to say the least. 

I wanted to try a beer, but was driving and I'm pretty sensitive, so I didn't have the Milk Stout on draft. The owner gave me a sample and wow!

Our only gripe was that they seem to put MSG is most things and this was a little challenging for my wife with Celiac. Their food would actually be great without the added MSG. So, feel free to encourage them to get away from that and I'm sure it will all be great no matter what.

Give them a try!!

Road trip! Went to StL for the weekend, happened to be in the neighborhood and stopped in based on the reviews - I'll believe this is the best hamburger in town as per Pitch. Great meat, perfect preparation, well-thought our combinations and the option to just DIY for picky eaters who don't appreciate the chef's curated flavor profiles. Yum. I'd drive back just to try more of their menu.

Our neighbors told us about this place.  They loved it...  Now we do, too. We created our own burgers, and loved them.  They were big and delicious.   The service was very good.  I want to go back and try the wings and nachos.

Food is amazing! Burgers, Fries, everything is delicious. I'm only giving 4 stars right now though, because we went last night around 10:30 after I got home from work and drove the 20 minutes from home only to be told that the kitchen is closed. Asked what time, and was told 9PM. So the bar is open super late, but don't come expecting food. That's way too early for a bar to close their kitchen in my opinion, but whatever it's their restaurant and they can do what they want. The PROBLEM is that this is not mentioned anywhere. Not their website, not here on Yelp, not even on the door when we got there. I checked the website first to be sure because I didn't want to drive out there for nothing. We didn't find out until we walked in and were asked if we were there for drinks. This is all a shame as I had been looking forward to dinner all day. Very disappointed, Stacked please fix this ASAP! .

MOOOOOOve over, lame burger joints. Stacked is in town.

The hubs and I decided to try this place after having seen it on several trips to Ferraro's. It's a smallish casual yet hip burger bar in The Patch. There is a game room attached to it somewhere but we got so focused on the food we forgot to investigate. The eating area is open and loud-ish with tall ceilings and casual decor, like rustic hipster maybe. 

Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and had advice to give if it was wanted. She listed off the special and the beer options. I went with a vanilla porter and the hubs got a wheat. Oh, and those with an aversion to craft beer - they do have Busch on tap and some other bottle options as well as a full bar. She checked on us often enough, our waters didn't go dry, and more beers were brought if wanted.

We both opted to BYO burgers and had fun doing it. Now for review and experience sake the hubs suggested I eat a "real" burger and I semi reluctantly went with that. He built a turkey burger on brioche with swiss, lettuce, tomato, pickle, red onion, and spicy beer mustard with fries stacked with "fire" (which is some sort of seasoning). I built a local grass fed beef burger medium well per servers suggestion that well would be too dry) with a pretzel bun, swiss, spinach, tomato, red onion, spicy beer mustard, Sauerkraut, and sautéed mushrooms with house made chips. I didn't taste his but he said it was almost so good he couldn't tell it was a turkey burger - this coming from a dude that likes red meat but can't eat it due to an allergy, well, that's a pretty big deal. His fries were good but not my type of fries as they were hand cut but too skinny. However, they were good with the seasoning and I would recommend choosing a seasoning if you opt for fries. Mine was fantastic. Well done on the outside, medium on the inside, flavorful, juicy, and my choice of toppings suited me very well. I opted for housed made chips and they were ok. They were crunchy-ish and looked seasoned but tasted bland and had an aftertaste but I would give them another chance.

We will most def be back and I'll give the house made black bean patty a whirl.

This place was great! I loved the atmosphere, really good services. I did end up just eating wings and fries because I had to run but I will def. be back for a burger I was so jealous as they were bring them out looked and smelled so good! Great place to meet up with friends on a Friday after work. Can't wait to go back!

Lunch for 6 of us today after touring nearby Jefferson Barracks Park. All of us loved our meal! At an average of $10 per diner, Stacked STL can't be beat for delicious and freshly prepared food, excellent service, and casual/cool ambience in the Patch area of Carondelet. Sitting near the big windows allowed us to enjoy the neighborhood street traffic at this bustling intersection near the Ivory Theater - nice to see how vital this area has become. The menu here is burger heavy, and we ordered several different variations. The choices include not only beef, but pork, turkey, and veggie burgers for example. The chef has designed some very creative and exotic topping combos for the burgers, or you can dress them yourself. We loved them all, from build your own, to the smaller 5 oz burger, to the house specialties like the En Fuego (hot and spicy everything-pepper jack cheese, jalapeños, house-made spicy ketchup, chipotle mayo, etc). The brisket sandwich was melt in your mouth tender and topped with creamy cole slaw, which tempers the spiciness of the BBQ sauce nicely. The sides we tried also got rave reviews - thin cut French fries, sweet potato fries, slaw, homemade apple sauce. Little touches like serving the slaw and apple sauce in little glass jars to keep the liquid from running on the plate and soaking your sandwich bun is the kind of thoughtfulness I really appreciate. We tried several of the cane sugar soda options today, and enjoyed a nonalcoholic lunch, although a full bar is available. Service was super friendly and the right amount of attentiveness. Everything was served at the right temperature too - the hot dishes were piping hot, and burgers right off the fire for instance, while the cold items like the slaw actually retained their chill when presented along side the hot entree. I feel like you get a lot of bang for your buck here. Fantastic!

GO ?for the Food, not The Service.
We should have walked out when our primary (#1) server stood at our table asking us for our drink order and had HIS FINGERS on and in HIS NOSE. I know he was just scratching it but I just looked at him with my finger one knuckle deep as I requested a Tea with lemon. He figured out why I was doing it . I am not going to even assume that he went back and washed his hands afterwards, He was just not a good waiter. The other server (#2)  whom was working, was good. He constantly was taking care of all the tables including ours.  

Glad I read the previous reviews before we went here. I had more patients for wait time and quality of service.  We were promptly greeted and seated.  

The good: the choices of burger toppings were amazing, I went beyond my comfort zone and had the celery slaw added to my grass fed burger. Both were delicious. The applesauce side was good. not great, too much Cinnamon. all the food was correctly cooked to our request.

The Average: sweet potato fries, bit thin for my taste, the sweet potato taste was not real strong. the Ice-tea was not bad. don't think it was fresh brewed. never received the lemon or asked for a refill. nor was the water refilled.

The Bad: One of the two waiters we had (#1). Besides the nose scratching, I watched him wander around, check his phone, and not really doing anything at all. We ended up getting better service from waiter #2 including getting the check brought to our table. The catchup bottle was 98% empty on our table and the one at the next table too. Really? at a burger and fries joint? Tomato slice had the stem part still in it, lettuce was wilty, and I just stopped looking for more at that point. or I was going to loose the rest of my appetite.

Go back, Not. Had we been served by #2 this may have been a less critical review, but my curiosity as to how bad it could get from server #1 kept  me entertained.  I will find a Burger bar, not a Booger bar.

This was my first and last time to this place the service was the worst the bartender actually looked at us and walked away to take care of other people that came in after us which by the way we had been sitting for at least 10 minutes!  I am a waiter tip well spend well would not go back!!!! Horrible we left after finally getting one beer which was good after work. Only reason we stayed was a group of us so you lost a good amount of money!
Sooo good! Built my own and everything on it was perfect! Casual dining with great options from the burger, the bun, the toppings for an amazing burger!

Hidden gem of deliciousness!!

This place is awesome with fresh and local food.  I had the burger of the month - the Patch - with sweet potato purée and whipped goat cheese. I will always get the goat cheese - it's amazing. My hubby got the en fuego, the guacamole was fresh and delicious. I got the fries which are like shoestring fries and he got the sweet potato fries, both were good and made in house. My kids got a reasonably priced grilled cheese kids meal. We had the applesauce which is probably the best applesauce I have had. It is made in house and is of the cinnamon sugar variety - I may get it for myself next time. 

There is a wide selection of local beers and they use other local products when they don't make in house (buns). I would like to try the guacamole app which is guacamole fried in a wonton wrapper. 

Can't wait to go back. They are undergoing a renovation to add more seating, the waiter was concerned that the wait times might go up. He said it is a longer wait during Friday and Saturday nights. We went about 5pm on Saturday and had no issues.

Great little build your own burger bar! Burger cooked to perfection.  The spicy catchup is a very good without being too hot. Our waitress, Jamie, was awesome. She explained how everything worked, gave us good advice, and was very attentive. She explained how everything worked, gave us good advice, and was very attentive. Will  definitely make this a regular.

Garlic wings were below average. Highlight of the meal was the pretzel bun. The burger patty was just ok, something you could do better in your backyard. The up-charge got grilled onions should have gotten me more than a few thin short slices. Not a memorable meal, but nothing was bad. Just your average bar food.

I don't usually crave a burger, but a few weeks ago I was really in the mood for one and I knew just the place to go thanks to Yelp! 

It was a Friday night around 7 pm and when we arrived there was still about a 25 minute wait. The place is small and there really wasn't a good area inside to wait. The night we went was pretty cold and standing outside was not ideal, but since there wasn't a place inside I just sucked it up and stood outside until we could be seated. It seemed like the longest wait ever, but eventually the hostess came out and asked us if we wanted to be inside or out...ummm can't you see I am shivering out here? I don't want to sit outside! So she told us that it would still be a few minutes since they don't have anything available yet. Eventually we saw 2 people leave the bar and at the moment the hostess came out and asked us if we would sit at the bar-YES I will gladly sit at the bar to drink and eat as long as I can be inside where it is warm! 

We sat down at the bar and there was 1 bartender working. Again, the place is small so having 2 may have been a terrible idea. My date and I noticed that she was "in the weeds" and so we didn't mind waiting a little extra before she greeted us. We could tell that she had to get a ton of drink orders out before helping us. No biggie. By the time she was able to greet us we already knew what we wanted to drink so it was a quick process. I asked for the "create your own" pad which she had in hand. While she went to get our drinks I selected my items for my burger. I ordered the turkey burger with swiss cheese and sweet potato fries. It was a simple combination. 

Our server/bartender brought over our drinks and took our orders. She was definitely busy! We each drank our drinks and just enjoyed the people watching. We even noticed that they have a pretty busy "take-out" section. There must have been 5 or 6 people who came in to pick up their orders (which the bartender was responsible for)! She had a lot going on. 

Our food came out and looked amazing! My burger was so juicy and the fries were crispy and flavored just right. I don't usually eat everything on my plate, but I was starving and ate every last bite-it was that good! 

Overall, the food is really good and the location is great for me. I would just like to see additional help at the bar if possible because the service wasn't as good as I would have liked. We had to flag her down a few times to order additional drinks. I also think it would be nice if they had room for people who were waiting for a table, it is just so crowded inside I don't know if this is even possible. Maybe with the warmer months it will be better since people can wait outside...but on cold nights and during the colder months this just isn't ideal. 

I can see myself going back, but maybe on a less busy and warmer night!
Great food, drinks, and service!! They accommodated to my party of 22 with ease! I called a couple of days ahead and they will super helpful!!!! We shall return!

This being my third time here, I though I'd write a little something. It being a holiday, a Monday, nice outside, and is being in a hurry were all factors in this lunch. 
Memorial Weekend=everyone is off and going to eat
Monday=Stacked has BOGO half off burgers
It just took kind of a long time to get seated, to get our drinks, and to get our food. 
It's a small place, and isn't very heavily staffed so I am taking that into consideration. At the same time, we had three beers and wine, two burgers (the wakey bakey and the gobbler) and fried pickles to share all.
Everything was yummy. It wasn't THAT slow, but it wasn't enough to impress me. Maybe I'm just crabby that it's Tuesday and I have to go to work today after the three-day weekend.
Great local place for a burger. You can build your own burger or try one of their specialty burgers. I love their sweet potato fries.

Husband and I tried this place on a date night. We got there around 5:15 and it was already busy! Our server was really nice and super quick. We shared an app of pickle chips. They were good-lightly fried-not super crunchy but came with a delicious dipping sauce. I got the Big Kahuna burger. When I first bit into the burger, it was so juicy and delicious. Then I got a bite of the ham and cheese with the burger-even better. Then I got the pineapple and it took it up to another level. The burger was delicious! I did tear off a lot of the bun (it wasn't bad but definitely nothing special). My husband got the Wakey Wakey. I'm not a fan of eggs, but the rest of it tasted pretty good. He absolutely loved it. Their fries are delicious as well, and they have spicy ketchup on the table as well as regular ketchup. Will definitely go back!

Absolutely amazing.  I cannot wait to go back.  I orderd (and highly recommend) a beef burger (they were out of their grass-fed beef), with pub mustard, pub cheddar cheese, and bacon with fries for a side.  It was amazing.  My wife and I each had a burger and fries and I had 3 beers for a total of $33.  That is a great and great food.

I never knew this place existed until the other day. My fiance and I were looking for a place to go after finding out that the place we were intending to go was closed. They told us that there would be a 30 minute wait, but we we were inside at a table in under 15 minutes. The wait for our meal was a little long, but the place was packed! Our burgers and fries were totally worth the wait. Their concoctions are good, but I really love the ability to stack our own burgers. Their list of potential ingredients makes for unlimited possibilities. Our only point of contention was that they brought us our bill before we were done. We were thinking about sticking around a little longer to drink some beer and chat, but that kind of gave us the impression that they wanted the table. Despite that, we will definitely eat here again.

Don't come here expecting a host/hostess greeting you and showing you where to sit. Mediocre service is why this joint didn't get a full 5 stars. If your drink is half full and you don't think you need anything when the waiter stops by, ask for a refill. On the topic of food, however, they hit a home run. The burgers are amazing and like others have said, go for the build your own. The bacon on these burgers is the best I've had at any burger joint. The fries are also great but they are small and get cold quick.

Wholly burger! Yummy! Delicious!  I can't say enough about this place.  Our family pays a visit every time we are in St. Louis and it is always a pleasure. I have tried Fuego every time and this last time I tried the Greek burger, what a pleasant mouth full of delicious flavors in both burgers.  If you are fond of flavor combinations and gourmet burgers, you have to try this place, the best burger restaurant in town.

Love this place. Quit local and quarky dining room. They whould have gotten five stars but my nephew was slightly tipsy on his birthday and they refused ro serve him alcohol. Food was amazing and i love that you can create your own hamburger. Lots of choices to build it and huge portion of fries came with it.  
I will bring more people here as this place is off the hook.
The burgers are awesome!!!  Went during lunch time.  Surprised it wasn't that busy.  The food was great.  We didn't wait long to eat.  I will definitely go here again!

I'm gonna keep this short and sweet. We (4 people) came in yesterday, it was busy... And we got sat right down. The guy who sat us down was awesome & so was our waitress the ENTIRE TIME. Kept our cups full & checked on us! And the food, we did 4 Build Your Owns, which were all beyond AMAZING! We will be back! Such a gem...

This is my new vote for best burger in the Lou. 

I love the neighborhood getting some foot traffic, the staff was great and so was the beer selection. 
Most importantly, awesome burgers. They obviously use quality meat, maybe a local bakery? (Several bun choices - all exceptional) and they have eight or eleven burgers on the menu - and every one is a delicious choice. 
And we started off with the BBQ nachos ... Impressive BBQ too!

Best burger I've ever eaten! I had a plain pub cheeseburger..delish! My husband had a crab Rangoon burger and he loved it.  Everything was fresh,  fries were nice and hot.  Will definitely come back.  Service was a little slow,  but we sat at the bar and she was busy.  I did order lettuce,  onion, pickle on the side which didn't make it on the plate,  but the burger was so flavorful, it didn't need it.  Can't wait to go back!

Stopped in for lunch today. Was told it would be about 5 minutes for two people. We decided to wait. The group of four behind us was told the same. In less than 5 minutes that group was being seated. We were still waiting. At almost 10 minutes we decided to leave. My wife wanted to inform the manager about our experience. Sam (manager) told us that because a four person table opened up while there was a group of four waiting, they would get seated before any smaller group and we were still going to be another few minutes. I told Sam this was the second time in a row this has happened to us. Once I told him we were leaving his attitude got worse. He didn't want to talk to us anymore as if he had better things to do than trying to retain customers.

Delicious. Everything was flavorful, the portions were generous, the price was right.y order was a build-your-own and it came out nearly just as I asked. It was medium well instead of medium, but still juicy and flavorful. My companions ordered one of the listed burgers and the fish sandwich. Both were raves. The homemade chips were pretty good but nothing special, but the fries were great. The guacamole wonton bites were really tasty and well made. Nice local draft list. The setup of the restaurant was a little disheveled and my menu was missing a page, but the sever was great. Will definitely be back. It was crowded at an off-hour, so I wouldn't try to go at a normal dinner time without expecting a long wait.
Amazing! I love the turkey burger! I think the burger of the month concept is awesome! The

I live in Chicago (but I am a St. Louis native).  I was in town over Thanksgiving and ate at Stacked with a friend.  I am often puzzled by the proclamation of "the best" laid upon various Chicago restaurants.  For example both he Food Network and Bon Appetite Magazine named Au Cheval's burger in Chicago "the best burger" in America.  Perhaps the critics should dine at Stacked STL and discover an even better burger!  It was delicious - one of the best burgers I've had in a very long time!

Just when I thought Stacked could not get any better.  The burger of the month is basically Thanksgiving on a bun.  I was never big on turkey burgers, but let me tell you. A freshly ground turkey burger, seasoned to perfection. Cornbread stuffing, cranberries and a gravey.  OMG , you HAVE to go and get this, or you will regret it.
Great food and service! Nachos, chicken sandwhiches, and gucamole bites are delicious.
Googled best burger in ST Louis and it brought us to this place.  Google wasn't wrong !!! Must try they won't disappoint !!

I got the black bean burger. It was pretty good and thick. It would've been better if it was crispy on the outside. It was messy to eat but I was pleased. They give you a huge heap of fries too. The spicy ketchup is pretty good too. I'd return.

I loved it. Tried them at the Burger Challenge and thought they were ok, but picked up a menu while we were there and they have a burger with jam. I had that while by hubby had his with egg. He tried mine and loved it so much more. Monday was buy one get one half off so that was an added bonus. I think it is my best burger in the area hands down.
Wings are great, burgers are amazing. Tried the Hawaiian and the burger of the month. The wakey wakey stoke the show. Perfection.
We have been here a couple of times now and have not been disappointed. Absolutely try the burger of the month even if it sounds weird. It always seems to work.

Went on a Tuesday at around 1:30pm.  It was busy but we were seated quickly and after ordering our food arrived within 15 minutes.  We were seated at a 4 top by the front door, there was a vent under the table blowing cold air the whole time.  If you don't want the huge burger just order the children's.

This is one of the very best burgers in St. Louis. I've been a dozen times and the burger is always perfectly cooked. Wide choice of toppings. Very good fries with house-made spicy ketchup (along with regular ketchup) on the table. Two dollar house or caesar salads. What's not to like? The neighborhood is old and totally charming with two triangular parks, a fountain and a theater housed in a handsome old church. Shhh, don't tell anybody, it's crowded enough as it is. A real treasure.

I have to say that this is now my favorite burger in St. Louis. We went on Saturday night before a show at the Ivory Theater (right across the street). It was PACKED - three rooms and a long wait list. I don't think it's as crowded on other nights. We ended up sitting at the bar to eat to save us some time. The bartender was amazing - she juggled drink and food orders and bar tabs and described what beers are on tap for about 20 people at a time and never stopped or made a mistake. I wish I had gotten her name to thank her here. The burgers on the menu were too much for me so I opted to build my own. You get to pick what kind of burger, cheese, bun, and other options to stack on top. I stayed with a simple grass fed beef burger with cheddar and it was delicious. They offer a full bar, lots of beer choices, and non-mainstream soft drinks. I definitely intend to go back, probably not on a Saturday night, though!
StackedSTL has become my go to when I want a burger.  I've recommended them to so many people and no one has been disappointed. Love my create my own burger so I just order it every time!
You can make your own or order a specality burger.  Either way, you have to try the sweet potato fries and spicy ketchup.

Stacked is simply amazing!  They always have a different burger of the month,or you can select one of their listed burgers on their menu, but you can't go wrong with building your own burger as another option.  They give you the option to select whatever you want on that bad boy and it's awesome.  You have choices from what kind of bun you want (pretzel bun is great) and you get to choose their wide variety of sauces (sauce it up) or also stack it (selecting toppings).

I've been there around 15 times and it beats pretty much any other  burger place out of the water.  It's only competition is honestly Layla's that I've experienced (which is a tie, sorry).  Regardless, you can't go wrong with stacked. Nice staff, clean place, great burgers!

The BLT Burger is quite possibly the best burger I've ever eaten. My sweet potato fries were the perfect amount of crispy and the spicy ketchup complemented them well. I loved everything about this place.

I ordered food to go and it was horrible. the en fuego burger with fries and wings. I ordered my food late at night about 8, maybe that explains why it was cold and tasted like it was sitting around all day.
The burgers are the best.  They need to move. Location sucks. Also, they way too slow.

Came in for lunch with my brother one day. He has been raving about this place for so long, so I had to give it a try. Id actually give it 3.5 stars.

Came in and sat at the bar. Didn't have any ciders available, so I was a little bummed. We asked for a few minutes to review the menu and no one came back to check on us for 20 minutes... typically I'm not that upset about this, but when you are hungry and waiting it totally sucks. We ordered two burgers and I didn't love either of them (en fuego and wakey wakey).

Stacked is our "go to" burger joint. We love it. I've never had a bad burger at Stacked. Last week I tried their housemade black bean burger that was fabulous! The plethora of topping choices continue to grow. We will continue to spend our dollars at ths delicious, locally owned burger joint.  If you haven't tried Stacked, you are missing out.

This place is stellar. Good atmosphere, friendly service, and the burgers were as good as advertised. My girlfriend and I both ordered our burgers medium rare and they were cooked to perfection. Only negative, my cajun fries were very salty. It is a quintessential south city hidden gem. We will definitely be back!

Stacked is great. All of their burger selections are awesome but the build your own burger is the reason we keep coming back. The burgers are big compared to other joints in town (cough cough Baileys Range). 

Pro tip, on Mondays they do buy one, get one 1/2 off. With two well built burgers, a shared order of chili cheese fries, and two sodas we were out the door for around $30. Hard to beat that. 

Overall, a great restaurant. Their location is also in the neat little tucked away neighborhood of Carondelet, gorgeous.
Love this place! If you eat gluten free, nearly everything is safe. They also offer a gluten free bun.
One of the best burgers in St. Louis!  Stacked has great service and great food every time.  The burgers on the menu are delicious or you have the ability to create your own.

Because I work nearby, I am able to stop by Stacked often. The food is always excellent and prepared quickly. It's nice to be able to find a restraint that my son and I both love that isn't fast food. We like to get the Hawaiian burger and split it (yes, these burgers are that huge, though I could probably finish one alone if I was feeling motivated ;-)) The bar tenders are usually not overly friendly, but make you feel like you're in a very small, neighborhood dive bar, which is true to an extent. It is in the middle of a neighborhood, but not too far from 55. Highly recommend people trying this place soon!

Wonderfully crafted menu which includes some of the best burgers you have ever seen. Everything we tries from appetizer pretzels to bourbon bacon brownie for desert was off the charts good. Certainly not an inexpensive place to eat, but in this case I have to say the product justified the price. 
The layout is bizarre and doesn't seem extremely functional. But the staff was super friendly and gave excellent service. They have events and special themes on some nights that I am eager to try also. Plus, they have a full bar to make any wait for a table go smoothly. 
This hidden gem is sure to do well.

Big ole nope.  Went last night with a friend,  and both burgers were wildly overcooked and dry.  But the real deal breaker -  everything that was fried (fries,  fried pickles,  burger toppings)  were cooked in extremely burnt oil. Inedible.  

The waitress did give us her employee discount -  even though she never checked on us and never gave us the opportunity to voice our complaints until after the meal was over. 

The vibe was cool,  however. 

Won't be back.

The BLT burger with goat cheese is by far the best burger I've ever had. I can't help but order it every time. They also make some incredible handmade cocktails that are also always delicious. If I had to suggest anything else, I'd say the honey mustard chicken salad and wings would be my go too! But the BURGERS!!!!!! One word: Amazing

The staff at a local brewery recommended Stacked to us. We thought they were open a little later, and arrived right at closing. The staff welcomed us in, and happily served us. They had a very well cured draft selection of great locals and other crafts. Our awesome bartender was happy to go over the beers and make recommendations. We took the bartenders suggestion on burgers, and they were absolutely perfect - top quality ingredients in fun and creative burgers. I have never been so welcomed by a staff when they are close to closing time. They were passionate about serving us and making sure we had a Stacked burger. I will be back. Make sure you visit this place!! It is definitely now a must do for me in STL. You will find a restaurant that is clearly a part of STL food culture, with a staff that loves what they do.

I've recently discovered fried pickle chips, and it's been life-changing.  The pickle chips here are great, albeit a tad oily towards the end (totally worth it).  The goat cheese and bacon jam burger is my favorite, but it also can get a little hard to eat towards the end since it doesn't stay together as well as I'd like.

We went with another couple and all agreed it's the best burger we've ever had!  All the burgers were cooked to perfection.  We did the "build your own" burger and each got exactly what we wanted.  Cute ambiance, ice cold beer, lots of fun!  Come here if you want a fabulous burger!!

1st visit. Great reviews by friends. I had the Greek burger, cooked medium, and perfectly. It was huge, good bun, spinach, goat cheese, hummus, pickled cucumbers. Homemade chips on the side....enough for 3. Great food. Great value.
An awesome burger, built my own. Was juicy and great flavor. Recommend everyone should try this place.

I'd been hearing about this place for a while and since I live in an adjoining neighborhood, thought I'd stop by for a meal. The wait staff was very friendly and made sure I understood the concept when ordering. Food and beer were brought out promptly. The burger (on brioche bun with pickles, grilled onion and mayo) was good. Not great, but very good. Unfortunately, I had ordered mine cooked rare and it came medium. My dinner companion ordered hers medium and it came out well done. Even so, the burger was tasty. The spicy ketchup on the table was a treat.

For sides we had regular fries and sweet potato fries. Both were good, but again, not special. If you like Steak 'n' Shake fries, you'll love the fries at Stacked: thin strings of fried potato with a good amount of grease. The sweet potato fries were okay, but I suspect they were frozen and not fresh cut. They also could have been improved with a sprinkle of sea salt.

I'll definitely go back, but it isn't going to take the place of O'Connell's burger for me.

Definitely one of the best burgers I've had in a very long time.  Very crowded on this Sunday, Cards Opening day, so many of the patrons were eating before heading to the game.
