Since I was a party of 1, I found a seat at the bar pretty easy.  This place is not very large on the inside so if you go during peak hours, prepare for a wait.  Beverage special this day, Cardinal Red Margarita.  Top 1/2 mango bottom 1/2 strawberry.  Tasted really good.  I could have taken just a smidge more tequila though.  lol.  

I opted for a custom order burger, 3 cheese sauce, bacon and side of chipotle mayo w/fries.  Loved it!!!  It was cooked to the perfect medium well that I asked for, right amount of cheese to burger ratio and 2 large slices of bacon.  The chipotle mayo was a nice added flavor, I didn't need alot which is why I asked for it on the side.  Fresh cut fries....fresh cut fries, the absolute best!  They are shoestring cut and  a little nubby, but that makes for being able to eat a nice fingerfull at a time.  Wonderful experience and will go back.  Would love to see an expansion into Mid-STL or North.

My boyfriend and I had lunch here based on the reviews from yelp.  This place is awesome!  
He had the wakey wakey with regular fries which was amazing.  I haven't seen people comment on the regular fries, but the ones I stole from him were awesome.  I had the created my own and was very satisfied.  The sweet potato fries I had were perfect. 
We came at lunch, and the female bartender/server was handling the whole place.  She was awesome.  Great service and quick fresh food.  We will be back!

"Burger, you come into my belly!" That was my thought when I had my first bite of their custom burger. This place located at a not so safe neighborhood but they sure make some incredible burger. They offer different types of custom burger or you can customized it yourself. I like the customization but what comes out on the plate is what I really want to rave about. Their meat is cooked to perfection, full of flavored and very tender! 

This hip burger/ sport bar is a cozy little place and sitting is quite scared. But if you are looking for good burger to indulge, then this is the place to go!!!
Stacked is a unique city diner in South St. Louis. Their burgers are really different and delicious. The atmosphere is friendly and homey. A truly good place to come to.

I went with my mother in law on a Monday night.  It was pretty busy but we got a table fast.  The waitress was very friendly and showed us he menu and the create your own burger.  That's what I ended up doing.  The burger was really good.  It came with a ton of French fries.  The fries were good too, salty and greasy, as fries should be.  We also had fried pickles as an appetizer.  They were just ok.  The coating was a little bland in the pickles.  Overall it was a decent meal.

We had the Mac and cheese balls which were awesome and served with a side of extra cheese sauce. Their burgers are DELICIOUS and super juicy but I wouldn't recommend the wings. Our groups had two orders of wings one plain, and one with garlic Parmesan and they were all burned...but again, the burgers were amazing.

Not bad burgers.  Love the variety, if you are looking for a chance from conventional burgers, but aren't crazy about chains like Red Robin, look no further. Staff if pretty friendly, love the plentiful options for sides, including sweet potato fries.

I cannot believe I have never reviewed this place!  It's probably because I'm too busy eating here on a regular basis.  Let's start with the good points.  First the staff is awesome! I have no idea if it's because I come here often, but I remember them being just as friendly on my first visit.  Second and the most important is the food.  It's delicious! You can get your burger anyway you want.  They do have some options for those that are adventurous or indecisive (depends on how you look at it).  Third is the fries. They are shoestring natural and not soggy like some other brother burger establishments (aaaaHEM) So Good!! Fourth, it has a bar, and a well-stocked bar. I hear the beer selection is good if you like the froo froo beer that comes with a dress! 
Speaking of adventurous they have a burger of the month! Each month it's an awesome freaking burger.  It's perfectly put together from its toppings to its bun to the type of meat that the burger is!  Let's just say that you will won't go wrong there. 
There is one flaw to this place; they don't offer refills on anything but the soda ..... sad panda.

Fingers crossed this place lowers their prices soon! I really wish this place would have opened in the summer like the website said for months. All well. This location so far is great and their staff is really on top of their stuff. The management here is way better than their Edison location. Please keep up the good work!

Came here for the first time last week. Our party had a lot of fun. They have heaters set up so despite the cold weather it was very comfortable. Their margaritas and mojitos are great. We also ordered food. The nachos were just ok. The burger and potato tots were yummy. We reserved a bay ahead of time for extra $ but the place wasn't full when we got there. Probably could've saved a few bucks. Overall we had a great time and plan to come back again soon.

I had a great time earlier this evening with my wife and daughter. We played for a full hour in the arcade nature of the golfing game had us all engrossed. The workers there were spectacular and helped us and answered all our questions and answered some that we didn't even know we had. We had a blast for the hour we were there and we'll definitely will be back. Fast attentive service as well for the time we were there!

I knew that we would have fun golfing...but I was so surprised at the delicious food and attentive service. We ordered a number of selections from the menu to share. Our servers were readily available and very friendly. We will definitely be going back to top golf!  I just wish there was one closer to the Lehigh valley!

Just went to the topgolf tonight (tuesday night) at 8:00 for half price golfing. I walk up to put my name in for a bay and they tell me 2hr 30 min wait which should bring it to around 10:30. I decided to just leave after I put my number in because I wasnt going to wait all night for a bay. 

Next thing you know, I get a text message 45 minutes later saying that your bay is ready and to make your way to the front desk. Im aleady home at this point! 

Point here is to not tell somebody 2hr 30min wait when it going to be ready in 45 minutes, very wrong to do. Since the staff there can not give me a resonable time, they now lost my buisness tonight because of the wait time being way too long but I will never return to this TopGolf ever! Not right at all to give somebody a 2hr 30 min wait time but text them in 45 minutes letting them know their bay is ready! 

Thank you very much TopGolf

Update: Still dissapointed in general but an incentive was given to at least bring me back next time! I appecreciate topgolf team at least reaching out. Star moved from 1 star to 3 stars. :)
Sandwich extremely small, bowls good but it's basically a frozen protein shake with fruit. It's expensive for what you get but I also believe the ingredients they use are costly. I wouldn't go back.

Stopped in to order a juice before an appointment a few doors down. After waiting 20 minutes, I was going to ask for a refund, but then saw my order was next. It didn't seem busy out front but it seemed a little chaotic & disorganized in the back. I think there were a lot of pick up orders being prepared. Hopefully that will improve, but I don't think I will be returning any time soon. At least the employees were all friendly.

Amazing !!! This review is for Carmel location. I recently began regular visits. Now addicted. Very healthy. As we health nuts know, The most important thing about nutrition is nutrient density not calories. These bowls are well worth the price because they are packed with tons of nutrition. The Reason these bowls taste slightly bland is because acai fruit by itself is bitter,  so the fact that the bowls taste slightly sweet without any added processed sugars except for a little bit of honey is incredible.  I love the smooth frozen Texture of the blended bowl ingredients, making it both a dessert and a meal (particularly the large serving).  Atmosphere and decor are fresh, colorful, and positIve.  Bathroom is clean.  Service is consistently amazingly friendly, which tells you owners must value service, it must come from top down. Parking is easy, just park on Main Street one or two blocks west of the store.

I rarely meet a smoothie I don't like, but I did here... Which sucks, because I really love smoothies and acai bowls! 

First things first, the smell is not the realist! I'm not sure what it was but the moment we walked in it smelled like.... My fridge after I leave fruit in it over the long weekend. I even mentioned this to the worker and he said others have complained about it as well. 

The price of the bowls were steep compared to other places in Indy I have visited. 

I got the tropical smoothie, which was really bland. 

I may make a visit back, but probably would stick to my favorite downtown location before making the trip back up to Carmel. 

Note: parking is a bit of a hassle as well.

One of the best Acai Bowls I've had! Stays thick and frozen for a long time, with delicious and fresh fruit, this Tropic Bowl was a great way to start the day. And while a little pricy, it's a great treat.

This place is a total ripoff. I paid $5 for a peanut butter, honey, and banana "panini". In my view a panini has always been a grilled sandwich with some nice bread. In this case it was literally cheap, spongy sliced wheat bread from the supermarket with the fillings inside, served cold. The sandwich was fine, but please don't falsely advertise your product and sell something with $0.60 of ingredients for $5.

I love acai bowls.... but I live on the northside so getting downtown to 22 Juicery isn't always an option for me.

I am delighted to have an acai bowl place in Hamilton County. It's soooo delicious. I had a dragon bowl, I was in the mood for pitaya because, why not? I got the regular sized bowl - it was massive. I can't even imagine trying to eat a large bowl, but I bet they're perfect for sharing! I also met the franchise owner - sweet as can be, and told us about their plan for expanding. Even the bowl maker came out and told us her favorites (spoiler alert: it was anything + peanut butter).

So much love, I can't wait for the weather to warm up so we can have the perfect summer treat.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE açaí bowls so this place to me was sure to be a hit. I popped in after doing some zip lining at eagle creek state park and it appeared everyone had the same idea. 

I had two friends with me as well. Since the breakfast bowl is typically a favorite that's what I ordered. First it took about 30 minutes for our bowls to come that was a BIG turn off. Second my friends ordered paninis as well. They never told them they were out of salami instead they had to ask about it. 

The final thing that really irritated me was we asked for our bowls to dine in and when our name was called it was given to us in to go bowls in a bag. EXTREMELY annoying.

But I love the breakfast bowl. They made a delicious error and put peanut butter in mine. Though I thought it was delicious I can only imagine how it could've went south if someone had a nut allergy and expected a nut free bowl. BUT the peanut butter addition was delicious with the strawberries and banana as well as granola. I will give them another chance. Hopefully I'll have better service the next time.

The smoothies are fantastic and I am happy that they list the nutrition info visibly on the glass in front of the counter. However I have been on multiple occasions and the service is always very slow. I know it can take a few minutes to make a smoothie, especially if others were in front of me,  but it has been 15+ min on every visit- so be prepared to wait. Also this place is pretty pricey- but considering the quality of the ingredients I would recommend stopping in.

Hooray for healthy quick options on the North Side of Indy! Perfect location, close to the Monon. I can already picture myself in the need of nourishment after a robust jog, stopping in for a Acai bowl for a post workout snack. 

Last week I quickly stopped in for lunch and ordered a small Detox Bowl to-go. What I liked about the Detox Bowl was it contained Kale and Spirulina. For those unfamilar with Spirulina it's a super food high in protein (vegan/gluten free), it contains beta carotene, vitamins, good things that make you big and strong. The sweetness from the fruit in this bowl masks the kale flavor so you don't even taste the kale. Great way to hide your veggies. What I didn't like about the bowl was it was more of a frozen dessert consistancy due to the usage of frozen fruit verses fresh fruit. I had also planned on this bowl being my meal for lunch and it didn't fill me up. I ended up having to go out and buy more food to fill me. I can see myself coming back and pairing it with one of their paninis as a lunch option maybe or making this a breakfast/post work-out option only. As the bowl is more of a frozen dessert consistancy it seems better suited as a snack/treat option rather then a meal.

This place is great in the sense of ingredients. They have all natural whole ingredients which I love. The downfall- the price. In order to have quality ingredients you have to be willing to pay a quality price. Personally I think it's worth it but only on occasion.

I wasn't at all impressed. staff seemed like they were guessing on the health properties and the acai mix was like eating ice. It was expensive enough that I managed to eat it but it was almost too cold to taste anything but the cold.
Very good! Love the healthy options. The bowls have great ingredients. I left off some of the sweet toppings so it wouldn't be so much sugar but it was a great option for a healthy meal!

First time stopping in today after passing by many many times! We decided to give the smoothies a try-I had the powernator and my roommate had the hulk! 

Being our first time in we were a little overwhelmed by the menu but one of the employees was great and took the time to give us a run down and share his favorite smoothie!

There is no joke you can definitely taste the kale in the hulk but it's done the right way! I loved the powernator and personally think it has a stronger banana presence which I love in smoothies. 

We will definitely be back to try a bowl!
Food is pretty basic but ok. The service staff seems a little aloof as there is no one but us in the place and they forgot things on our order (that they got wrong).

This is my new favorite place!!  I had the large Dragon Bowl and it was soooo good! I dream about going back and eating it again. We have been there 2 times now. I hope to make it a part of our routine on the weekends a few times a month. I love the fresh fruit. It's like a super pumped up smoothie with fruit and granola and nuts on top. My bowl had almonds and goji berries. The large bowl was super filling too. My husband got a smoothie and a panini . He enjoyed both. 
It's a little pricey, but it's so good and healthier than just about any fast food place I can think of. I would rather go here any day of the week!
Loved the nutty bowl! They also have very good juices! I come here quite often, one of my favorite jucie bars in the area. Great location as well.

A-sigh-e, say it with me, A-sigh-e, reminds me of NA-mast-t follow me and you'll see where I'm going. Stopped by here last week, in the Carmel Art District (popisticated) and I stop in to this fancy pants shop looking to get my A-sigh-e on. Seems everything has Acai in it, even the acai, so I order an acai and get it thrown in to a plastic bowl. Product comes out beautiful, taste is fantastic, I got the warrior, wife the vitality bowl, excellent. Get the small, more than plenty, price is slightly high. 

Here's my rub,I'm a clean eater and my intake of sugars are really low so it pains me to find something (relatively) clean that makes me feel bloated and tired. I even opted for PB and whey protein to slow down some of the sugars. I get it, I get it, it's fruit sugars, America is not fat because it eats fruit, maybe too many simple sugars for me.

I'd hit this up again if in the area, and try out one of the higher protein combos, I have a pretty good feeling for me this place is just too sweet for my tastes.

This would be a favorite place of mine if I lived in the area. The acai bowls are excellent. Great place to refuel after a workout. But the service was AWFUL. The workers go in the back and stay there for eons with nobody out front. I wanted to get some extra granola and stood at the counter for five minutes. Nobody came out and I just gave up. The second time we went there it took 18 minutes to get our acai bowls. I don't know why it takes 18 minutes to make an acai bowl when the place is basically empty. What are they doing back there???

So the acai bowls are the hype of this place but my review is based on the experience I've had eating the salami panini and black bean soup as well as drinking the tropical smoothie. The salami panini was good. Good is about the only word I would use to describe the panini. It's nothing out of the ordinary. It just tastes good. The black bean soup was somewhat gross... I mean it looked like chopped up dog food that had been blended with corn and beans in water. It has such a strange dark brown/gray color. And the meat looked canned. I would not recommend ordering any of their soups. My friend got the tomato basil soup and it was chunky and a brown/gray color as well.. I mean what could they be putting in there to make a tomato soup brown/gray colored? I didn't finish the soup. The tropical smoothie was tasty and the perfect amount of sweet so I would definitely order that again. I would like to return to this place to try one of the acai bowls. I would also reorder a panini as I thought they were decently tasty.
Really cool concept with pretty good smoothies. I haven't had a "bowl" yet but I heard they are pretty good. Worth a few more visits in the near future.

You have to get a Vitality Bowl, their smoothies are just okay; you're missing out on the whole experience if you don't get one of their Acai based bowls. I personally get the basic 'Vitality Bowl' and add kiwi which always hits the spot. I usually get it to go, and add extra granola and honey at home. Watch out they're highly addicting but they aren't easy on the wallet!
Good acai bowls, but pricey. Worst part is timing----they need more blenders or whatever it takes to take less than 15 min for an acai bowl during lunchtime.

I adore Vitality Bowl and its plethora of options. Their smoothie variety always hits the spot - whether I am looking for something savory, chocolatey, fruity, or robust. The only reason I don't rate this location a full five stars, though, is because sometimes the smoothies aren't fully blended. It can be a little unsettling to slurp up a slick piece of banana through your straw. 

What really draws me in are the acai bowls, full of fruity goodness, granola, and honey. YUM! They claim to provide you with a day's worth of vitamins, and I certainly feel fantastic after eating one. Perfect for hangover days, quick but filling breakfasts, general pick-me-ups, or simply something tasty. If you like fruit, then you will love the offerings. 

I have also tried the spinach panini, which was flavorful but kind of lacking in substance. I was hoping for a larger sandwich for the price, but wasn't overly worried about it. I think you can also add a panini for a reduced cost if you purchase something else on the menu. 

Overall, great place to eat with friendly staff!

Wow, I love this place. I always go here when I fee like I just need a good meal or cleanse from the food at college. I always get the "vitality bowl" and it's so delicious every time. The staff is knowledgeable and attentive. I completely understand why it has to be a bit pricey but that is the only minor downside!!

I got one of the bowls and it was tasted good and fresh, but I can only give three stars due to an overall feeling of unwelcomeness by the staff. The cashier was not friendly and said some things one might take as rude. She just did not seem happy to be there. The panini was not worth the money. Open to giving it a second chance, but hoping for friendlier service!

Let me start off by saying I have a big fat (more like skinny/healthy/guilt-free) crush on Acai bowls. I say "skinny" because these are one of the healthiest yet filling meals you can find. (learn more about acai bowls by searching "acai berries") I am happy to see this addition to downtown Carmel. (Thanks for keeping me in the know, fellow Yelpers).

The friendly young gentleman at the counter did a great job of explaining the ingredients and offerings. The bowls include everything from peanut butter and coconut milk to broccoli, spinach, bananas and blueberries. I'm a big fan of bowls that include spinach and bananas. Thicker, filling consistency. The ultimate bowel cleanser is what they should be called. (go ahead, scrunch your nose - we all know you poop too). 

Go for the smaller bowl - I promise you'll be filled. However, if you go for the big one and finish it, consider me impressed :) Bowls cost between $10 - $12. My only disappointment was that they use apple juice in some of the bowls (not the fresh kind).

This is my juice spot in Carmel! Friendly service, good selection, and they have great acai bowls! Wish they would open up at 7 or 8 instead of 9 am though. Give them a shot if you want to eat healthy! Great little spot!

I've been to Vitality Bowls twice - the first time with my parents for brunch to try an acai bowl because they looked amazing, and the second time because I was nearby and hungry and got a bowl to go. Most of the bowls are somewhat similar but all sound great - they're basically a smoothie in a bowl with tasty toppings. I got the Warrior Bowl first and the Detox Bowl the second time (because both have greens and I don't eat enough greens). Both were delicious, but I think I liked the Warrior Bowl a little better, it just had some more complex and interesting flavors going on. I only had to wait about 10 minutes to get my to-go order, as it wasn't too busy. I've gotten the Medium bowl both times and it's huge, especially when you're eating something frozen that you'll take your time on, it's very filling and I felt great afterwards. It's a bit pricey and takes longer than I would expect if it's at all busy, otherwise Vitality Bowls would get 5 stars!

I use to eat here all the time. Big fan of the breakfast bowls.  I ate there last night it was good so I decided to eat there again this afternoon before my dentist appt.  I got a breakfast bowl... 
it was horrible   not only did I find a white per hair in the strawberries, I also found a long piece of plastic in the bottom of the bowl.... now I was wondering how much other plastic I was eating.  So much for healthy. I took it back to show the girl just because my daughter loves this place and I wanted them to be more careful opening up plastic packages. She kinda gave me a blank stare and asked if I wanted a refund. I replied no and walked out. It was useless. Bottom line... there are too many young kids working there that really don't care. They go in the back to make it instead of making it in front so you have to wonder what they are doing. I debated on telling my daughter this story because she loves this place.... but it is going to be a longtime before I come back.

I still like Vitality Bowls, but it's fairly expensive. My most recent visit included a smaller portion of the Kids Bowl that really surprised me when they brought it out to our table. In fact, it is not technically a bowl anymore. The Kids Bowl was put in a drink cup. Yes, a drink cup. But the price is not any cheaper for getting less. It is still $5.99. I think the prices on the adult bowls may have gone up, but I can't confirm. Either way, I think the prices are high, especially if you're going for lunch. And they don't offer any kind of rewards card that will earn you points and discounts. 

Another thing that annoys me a little about this place is that there never seems to be any adults working. Every time we go, the only employees there seem to be high school or college students. I think it's great that it employs young workers, but I would like to see that there is some adult management in place.
Love the acai bowl - healthy options, plenty of choices. If parking were easier I would eat there more frequently (daily?).

Love this place! Have been coming here since they opened. By far the best place for acai bowls & a good smoothie. Ive had many different acai bowls from different places & theirs remains the best one! Also, management is great. I love this place :)
Great staff and great, healthy, food. Can never go wrong with the Warrior or Dragon Bowls (add Peanut Butter!). Sandwiches are light but great with the pesto/Dijon spread.

This place has really filled a fatty void in my life.

Being a native northsider, my options for acaí bowls has been limited. Nil, actually. I would take a 45-minute drive downtown to satiate the craving for a trendy, sweet, GREEN, thick smoothie served in a bowl with a spoon. No longer!

VB offers a huge selection of acaí bowls, I had some trouble deciding which to choose. I got the Warrior Bowl, since it had some green in the mix. It was excellent. Fruit, fruit/vegetable mush, granola, and honey tantalizing my palate. 

This place really fills a market gap in Carmel, and I hope it really takes off as the hot Summer days begin to ramp up.

Delicious & nutritious way to refuel after an Incycle spin class. I chose the small nutty bowl (which is generous in portion) that comes in a stainless steel bowl that keeps the froyo-like smoothie consistency perfectly cold. Granola, slivered almonds, banana and honey adorned the top. 

The reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because of the branding and decor. The menu and marketing materials cheapen the value and message of the nutrients. The inside is reminiscent of your average froyo shop.
You can't go wrong with me and acai bowls.  Service was super slow and place was particularly nice.  By the time I got my bowl, it had almost melted.

Problem: You want to go out to breakfast/lunch, but you don't want to be a complete fatty.  What do you do?

Solution: You go to Vitality Bowls.

I ordered the Dragon Bowl (Dragon fruit blended w/ Açaí, Mango Juice, Coconut Milk, Banana, Pineapple, Raspberries & Immunity Boost; Topped with Strawberries, Kiwi, Almonds, Goji Berries, Bee Pollen & Honey). I was a big fan of what was the closest thing to a fresh, fruity sorbet sundae.  Although I couldn't find any nutritional information specifically from Vitality Bowls, my research tells me that a small bowl is around 400 calories.  Sadly, piling on peanut butter or granola adds more calories, so I'll be staying away from those ingredients during future visits.  

Fresh ingredients + tasty combinations + easy on my hips = I'll be back again!

If you want something quick, healthy and sweet, this is the place to go. The bowls taste as good as they look! The fresh fruit used, quality of ingredients and crunchiness of the granola is appreciated, as is the added peanut butter options for protein. It is more on the pricier side for a small bowl, but you'll get your money's worth of energy.

The bowl was fantastic! I had the dragon bowl and it was perfect portion size for me. Fruit tasted really fresh and will definitely be ordering the same thing if I come back here. Only giving this place 4 stars because the service was extremely slow and we were the only ones in there, so don't come here if you're pressed for time. Other than that great experience!!

Very friendly staff and great service 

Great idea and super fascinating ideas.  Healthy and wonderful taste!
What a wonderful place! Pure and fresh! First time going and I got a juice and absolutely loved it! The staff was very nice and welcoming. This will be a regular lunch break stop for me!

From the fresh ingredients, to the no added sugars, to the beautifully decorated bowls, and the helpful workers I would recommend Vitality Bowls over and over again. You can go for just about any meal or a snack. If you are in a hurry and want to get a bowl to go they do provide to go bowls but it can take 10-15 mins.

The bowl we bought (tropical) was very good! But you can buy Acai mix at the grocery store for the same price and I'm not sure if it's worth the price of $10. We were the only ones there and the customer service was ok. Not very warm and personable for it being our first time. 

Probably would try again if we were in the area and wanted to splurge for a $10 smoothie bowl.
The food is delicious but the whole place was freezing. Bring a sweatshirt or a hoodie and you'll have a great meal!

This place has awesome açaí bowls! I was confused on what an açaí bowl was at first. The staff explained that it is a fresh frozen fruit base without ice or wattopped with more fresh fruit and granola. I love the vitality bowl and all the wholesome ingredients now! The staff is super helpful when deciding what to order.  Be prepared to wait a little for them to make it all fresh !! I enjoy going in and getting something new every time. They have paninis and fresh juices as well as other healthy options! They have a new loyal fan!!!!

I was super excited to try this place- I wanted something healthy for lunch. I was a little disappointed they don't have more veggie salad/protein options. It's mainly fruit bowls.

I ordered a juice, and added bee pollen and spirulina. My order got skipped over somehow so I had to wait 25 minutes for one juice.

My friend got the veggie panini- listed with spinach, sun dried tomato pesto, cheese and Dijon. It only had cheese spinach and pesto on it.

Another lady's order was messed up while here too.

If you are in a hurry and on your lunch break, I would either call ahead or wait for a time when you aren't on a schedule.

My 25 minute juice was good, just a long wait.

I don't know if I have ever seen a more beautiful meal!  I ordered the dragon bowl and it was so good.  Stephen, the guy working suggested I add peanut butter to the mix and it was delicious.  Thank you Stephen for explaining the menu and making suggestions for my meal!  The pitaya fruit bowl was gorgeous when it arrived to me, drizzled with honey, goji berries, almonds and topped with kiwi and strawberries.  I am intrigued by just about all the bowls and smoothies, and I can't wait to try more menu items.  Great new place on Main Street in Carmel, where the old Huddles used to be.  If you are on the Monon, stop here for a treat!
Not. A. Fan. Overpriced mediocre smoothie dumped in a bowl with some toppings. The granola is very basic-puffed rice-like topping. $10 for a medium (the smallest) portion? Just no.

This place looks like some health nut place. I do care about my diet sure, I'm even a vegetarian. I've been here about two times. It's in a nice spot in downtown Camel. There's not a lot to do in Carmel but this is a nice little lunch spot. So if you're not familiar with Açai Bowls it's when they blend up the Açai fruit and then put a bunch of toppings on top. It's basically just a super fancy smoothie bowl. At Vitality Bowls they basically have a bunch of different versions of Açaí bowls and other fruit bowls. I would give this place five stars, but it's just this is a little overpriced. It's about $11.00 for a small bowl. If you like fruity sweet things this is the place for you.

I really love that they put a healthy, semi-fast food establishment on Main Street. Vitality bowls is super convenient if you're just coming off a walk on the Monon or if you live upstairs (like I do) at Sophia Square. Both the small and large bowls are huge portions, definitely enough to fill you up for a lunch. My one suggestion is that they get some kind of rewards program, like which wich does for the number of sandwiches you purchase. I come in here at least 3-4 times a week, and it's not cheap ($7-$12 a bowl) but worth it for sure. A rewards program would be great for repeat customers. Lastly, they aren't super fast in making the bowls but again, it's not a fast food place and quality food takes time. I will continue to come to vitality bowls!

I love vitality bowl but the Carmel location ran by teenagers who don't care about customer service is the worst.  I will go to the 86th street location from now on.
We placed an online order then went to pick up and it hadn't been started.  After confirming the order had been received the order still hadn't been started 30 minutes later.  Left without order.  A wasted hour

I had never been to Vitality Bowls until this morning and all I have to say after my first visit is that I wish I lived in closer proximity to one.  I had the Warrior Bowl and it was to die for.  The smoothie bowls are organic and everything is made fresh to order.  They contain no frozen yogurt, no added sugars or artificial preservatives; they are natural ingredients and very fresh fruit.  Not only was the bowl itself amazing, but the service was great too!  

The only stipulation I would say is the price, it is a bit pricey with a medium bowl at $11.25.  Countering that, it is a 20oz. bowl so it is like a meal and fills you up and you're paying for the fresh ingredients and antioxidants within those.

10/10 recommend
Takes forever. Got here at 1pm. Got through the line and ordered by 1:20pm, didn't get my food until 1:50. The weird thing is it wasn't even that busy - I was the 3rd person in line when I got there.

My first experience with Vitality Bowl; awesome! What a pleasant surprise. Energy Bowl is a great breakfast/brunch alternative. Dishes are made fresh and are full of flavor and good-for-you ingredients. I highly recommend this as a healthy alternative to other restaurants.

I've only ever had the donair, which was pretty solid, but it gets mega bonus points for being open late and a block from my place.

Update: The food is as good as ever, but the owner gets big time bonus points for calling in the fire across the street, then running over and saving a bunch of people. He even carried a woman in a wheelchair on his back!
I thought I would give the place a go and tried a donair, I was not expecting much but it was one of the best donairs I've ever had in Edmonton, and inexpensive to boot! Would recommend!

Fantastic food, nice staff and reasonable costs.
We picked up two poutine, a chicken burger and a cheeseburger to give the place a try.
They used real cheese curd (which seems to be rare around these parts) and actual gravy (not the canned stuff) for the poutine and it was amazing. As somebody from the east coast, I've been lacking a good traditional poutine for far too long.

My better half says the chicken burger was "so freaking good"...at least she did after she inhaled. It's weird seeing somebody eat that fast with that big of a grin on her face.

My burger wasn't too bad either, and the non-cheddar cheese was a nice unexpected change.

Absolutely recommend it, we'll be going back in the near future to give the donairs (doners if reading their take-home menus?) a try.

Amazing food! Decent prices, and lots to choose from! The location is in the heart of Jasper ave, an upcoming area in downtown mainly focused with pubs and restaurants. this location is open late hence why it's so good!
Was very impressed with the food quality and service. Will definitely go there again.

I've been here a few times. The atmosphere is very "after club need food now" donair shop. It's warm inside, smells delicious and a bright yellow sign outside. You cannot miss the place across from shoppers drug Mart.

Previously I've had Donairs here before and they were top notch and amazing. I love chicken Donairs and this ranks one of my top 10 places. Donairs are punched full of flavor with "give a run for McDonald's money" french fries nicely salted. 
Most recently I tried their pizza and it was ok to say the least. Kinda greasy and I dont know what kind of cheese it is cause it was all flat and lackuster. He did a half and half for me of Pepperoni's and other meats and the other half "veggie" which had olives and tomatoes. I'd say it wasn't my favorite pizza. 

The staff here are the sweetest and most kind people. The man who is mostly in the store is super kind and seems like the kind of man that would give anything for anyone to be welcome and at home. 

Overall this place is fantastic and I highly recommend the Donairs .... Only.

Stopped into Maximo's Pizza & Donair after the Edmonton Opera for a late night bite (almost 1130PM) on our way home.  They are located on Jasper Avenue right next to Buddy's Bar.

The staff were friendly and informative and let us know they changed ownership last month (new owners are from Queen Donair).

We opted for a Super Donair with Cheese and a Mexican Pizza.

The Super Donair wasn't the tiniest bit greasy - 2 thumbs way up!  BUT we hardly noticed the sweet sauce or hot sauce we requested.  They make the donair in the back as opposed to right in front of you so you can say more of this, less of that, etc.

The Pizza was qutie good but again - described as having some spice, it did not.  They happily provided us with a chili pepper shaker to shake away.  And the pizza was not greasy at all.

I would absolutely come in here again for a late night bite!  Only downside was when they opened the door at one point, the wafting marijuana and cigarette smoke came pouring in.  Fortunately, there were a couple of extremely drunk girls also waiting for a pizza that threw a royal fit so I didn't have to say a word - they doors were closed moments after being opened.

The prices are a tad higher than what I'm accustomed to but that being said, I agree with Yelper Andrew M. who noted mega bonus points for being open late!

I'm sure I'll be seeing you after another late night show in no time for another donair!
Fantastic poutine. They could use a better patty for their burgers but the other ingredients were very fresh. Good price.

There were menus from maximo's left in my apartment lobby 4 days ago, normally I'm not one to save up menus, on my way out that day I grabbed one put it in my purse. I just ordered  (delivery) a jumbo donair with fries and gravy. the donair was delicious, best I've ever had in my life, excellent service and great prices. oh and the fries and gravy were good too.

Maximo's is just a half block out of my way on my commute home. And they have a take-out special of a large, 2-topping pizza for $9.99. And their pizza is much tastier and more interesting than the nearby chains with similar walk-in/carry-out deals. Their sauce is tangy and their crust has a nice balance of chewy/crispy. I regret that it took me so long to give Maximo's a try. It's now one if my favourite take-out places for a quick, inexpensive meal in Oliver.

This place is absolutely awful and I will not be back. Despite the fact that it's a two minute walk from home. 

If you want donair meat that's been sitting in a plastic bin at room temperature for who knows how long, this is the place for you. The fries sat in the basket for the 15+ minutes it took for the employee to make my cheese donair. He then debated selling me the fries from the bowl sitting beside the deep fryer, which had sat for longer. I know this, because I watched him assess them and pause for a moment, notice me watching, and then grab the fries from the basket. He left my pita on the grill too long and it was crunchy. The meat was bland, and the cheese didn't even melt properly because the meat was lukewarm at best. Absolutely atrocious. 

To top that all off, he didn't wash his hands between using his till and the phone and making the food. Nor did he wear gloves. The health inspector seriously needs to pay a visit to this guy, because the standards were way below par. 

I ended up paying for food I barely touched. I took exactly three bites of the donair and ate a few fries before giving up on the inedible excuse they call food. 

I'd rather walk for 15 minutes to avoid food poisoning or pay for delivery. Avoid this place at all costs!!
Prices are good, however the food is terrible. Their salad is disgusting, all the veggies are soggy and the gravy is beyond gross. I will never be ordering here again. Biggest donair joke ever.

First off, I'd like to say kudos to the Owner for being a local Hero in helping People get out safely as the building they were in across the street was on fire!

However, unfortunately the food is not that good! I have eaten here 4-5 times, and each and every time, I am hoping the food will be better, sadly it doesn't.

As well, for example they seem to not listen well when You specify what You do or do not want on Your donair.

We recently ordered on Skip the Dishes from Maximo's, a large poutine, and small pizza, it cost $25 with FREE Delivery! The poutine was awful, and the pizza was worse than a delissio!

I suggest going else where if You want a donair, poutine or pizza, especially from Skip the Dishes!

Was up early and decided to grab some breakfast instead of cooking myself.  Decided to go to this place because I like this chain when I am on the road I wanted to see if they were good at home as well.

The service was outstanding, the wait was short (they even apologized for that).  Tried one of their omelets and it was very tasty.  The coffee was a little acidic as it sat in the pot too long, but the refill was less so like it was from a fresh pot.  

On their menu they list biscuits as the breakfast bread of choice with everything, but you can substitute toast with instead (which is what I chose).  I got my plate and it was hot, the service as I said before was awesome.  The only gripe I had was getting my bill and getting out of there.  if I was with my wife I would not have minded the wait so much since I was by myself it was a little awkward.

I would definitely recommend this place.

It's Bob Evans, who doesn't like Bob Evans. My mom and I went here last weekend for breakfast. We needed to kill about an hour so we stopped in for a bite to eat. My mom got hot cholcolate and they put whipcream on it, it's so yummy. I ordered the sunshine skillet, it was amazing. It's like and egg bowl with filling. So yummy. Will get this again for sure.
Damn this was good!  I had the turkey dinner with carrots and mashed potatoes. Turkey and stuffing were really good. For ten bucks! Yeah we will be back.

This is the Bob Evans I always go to and there service has always been great. But today I had the best service I have ever had! Michelle was phenomenal!!!! Very attentive and helpful and polite she went above and beyond! Thanks Michelle!!!

I ordered a wildfire chicken salad.  I didn't know it comes slthered in a bbq like sauce:(  I'm trying to warch my sugar intake and would have appreciated a server who brought this to my attention when ordering.  That way I could have opted for no sauce.
The food is good. Restaurant seems to be very clean. The menu is a bit limited and they seem to be short staffed. They have the BEST homefries. Will return.
Great 'Classic' breakfast this morning.  Friendly greeting and prompt, efficient and happy waitress.  Highly recommend this restaurant to start the day off.

I arrived at my hotel next door (La Quinta) a wee bit early for check in (7 hours early.. lol) but I'll go into that in that review. I felt bad eating the free breakfast when I hadn't checked in yet so I decided to walk next door to Bob Evans.

I've never eaten at a Bob Evans so I didn't know what kind of food they served but I quickly found out it's like Cracker Barrel and Denny's had a baby. Like Dennys, you get your check and pay upfront. It also has the same layout. But like Cracker Barrel their food leans to the southern/comfort food style. They even sell candy at the front like Cracker Barell does.

When you walk in the server seats you and within no time the waitress is there to take your order. I've got to say she was the friendliest,  most enthusiast waitress I've ever had. Our drinks and food came out within no time as well.

My boyfriend ordered the Sunrise skillet, which had eggs, homefries, sausage and a bread item (toast, biscuit, pancakes, etc). He liked it. I got the rise and shine with two eggs, homefries, and bacon. Simple but good. What I loved were the biscuits, made fresh daily. 
Overall, I would recommend this place for your typical American breakfast and comfort foods. Nothing fancy about it, classic, cheap and fast.
While the food may be offered at a discounted and inexpensive rate, the quality varies and ranges from terrible to good. If you are staying at a nearby hotels, eat at the hotel. Otherwise go here

I actually like Bob Evans a lot. They have a lot of breakfast options, and if you sign up for their emails you get great coupons. I do not like to go to chains often, but I would definitely go to Bob Evans if I am in the mood for breakfast, and have the perfect coupon. They are also very reliable and have great service.

Been having breakfast here almost every morning on a recent business trip to Tampa.Server Veronica has always been smiling and given me superb service.Everything on the breakfast menu is delish! Enjoy...

We dined at Bob Evans on Wednesday evening, June 20, 2018, party of 4. My 12 year old daughter ordered the chicken tender meal - 3 tenders and fries. She ate one and a half of the tenders, I finished off the rest after I had already eaten my meal. As soon as we arrived home from dinner, less than one hour after eating, I was on the toilet. She was up all night vomiting and with diarrhea. I was spared of the vomiting, but have been in and out of the bathroom over night and appears to be continuing this morning. We both woke up with lingering stomach pain. She'll miss a day of pre-paid summer camp (non-refundable) and I'll have to struggle through a day at work. The worst thing a restaurant can do to a customer is mishandle food and make them sick. I have had cold food, mediocre quality dishes, and poor customer service, but making a customer ill due to food mishandling is simply unacceptable. I am extremely disappointed with Bob Evans as we were long time customers and unsure we can trust their food handling and preparation to consider ever returning. I do not think we are permitted to state the names of the persons at the restaurant, but our male waiter's name is shared by one of the 3 Musketeers.

Newly renovated!  Iced coffee is always great.  Normally servers are very quick and accommodating unless they are extremely busy.  Food is always consistent-my husband enjoys the  omelets,  I always get the sausage gravy.  Rita was our server and she was great!  You can even take a quart of gravy to go for only $5 if you wanted so extra!

thank you for a great lunch and for being right off 75 on the way home ...

to the young lady hostess - we had a brief conversation about Jesus ....

good for you! continue to call his name ... give praise !!! you are doing a great job feeding the masses ....

great BE location ....

food served hot and fast ....

thanks!
I stopped by this place while I waited for maintenance at one of the nearby dealerships. Great place for breakfast, free coffee refills, baked goods.

My daughter and I had brunch here last week.  When we ordered two cups of the "Summer Special" flavor of soup, tomato basil, which they are promoting heavily, the waitress told us there was only one cup of soup available and one of us would have to choose something else.  

It was 10:30 in the morning....before the lunch rush....and they were already out of the "special" soup?  

A few minutes later she brought out two cups of soup and said they were "able to find another one."  

I wish I'd been given the alternate soup I had chosen.  I normally like tomato basil soup, but this was just awful. I'm wondering if they threw together a quick batch after we ordered it.  

To me, it tasted like just-opened canned tomatoes, raw garlic, and fresh basil that was heated to the boil and served.  Any tomato-based soup needs to simmer for a long time for the flavors to blend.  This was overpoweringly tasting of canned tomatoes -- acrid, bitter, and pretty unpleasant. Oh, and so, so, so salty.   I'm not one to send food back, so I added a pack of white sugar to my bowl and stirred and stirred until it was palatable.  That really cut the edge of the bitterness off.  

I also got a loaded baked potato, which was excellent, and my daughter had half of a turkey bacon melt, which she loved.  

The restaurant has plenty of parking and was clean (restrooms, too) and well-staffed.  I'd like to try one of their breakfasts sometime when we're on the road (no locations near where we live in SC.)

This place is so popular that at 11 AM there was a queue for a 15 minutes and the parking full. There are three inns near, so you might have to book a table if you out of time.

Serving was fast and food was great, definitely will returns here.

Fast and easy breakfast chain.  This was a breakfast of opportunity we yelp-found while heading north on 75.  Plenty of parking, but a little difficult to navigate to; down a dead end road.  Service was great - food came out quickly and the refills were always there.  My wife had the French toast and I had the  
Border Scramble Omelet.  Both were good, not necessarily great.  But it did the trick and we were back on the road quickly.  Inexpensive too!

Before I moved to Tampa, I probably went to Bob Evans 4 times in my whole life.
Now, this location has become my standard because I love the iced coffee, the servers are always genuinely fun and pleasant, and the food is dependable.  I literally ask myself when I try a new restaurant here in Tampa, did I waste my money or should I have just gone with old trusty???  If in the Brandon area, the answer is pretty much, yes, just go to Bob Evans.

Horrible customer service. The waitress rushed everything and my food was burnt!!! I ordered (2) coffees one for my husband and one for me, with a strawberry lemonade on the side for my husband. I explained it to her when she took our order. She came back, placed the coffee down hurriedly and said simply "oh I don't remember who had which coffee", like it didn't matter. 

This Bob Evans sucked in comparison to the one in Seffner. This military family won't be back at this location here in Brandon, Fl
Clean, friendly and delicious! Always pleasant and makes us want to come back all the time.  Love the new décor also. Never rushed.

My first foray to this chain, Bob Evans did not disappoint.  

Not sure why it took so long to try them.  Meals taste home-made, ingredients fresh, and staff was exceedingly nice and attentive.

The French toast are thick pieces of light, fluffy bread.  It was quite delicious!

For price, amount of food is just right.  I feel full and have just about finished my meal - a sign that portions are just right!

Definitely going back
Bob Evans is good! better version of Denny's i think.
Can't go wrong w/a Bob Evans and this one doesn't disappoint.  Staff is great

Today started well. We quickly were seated. The waitress however, seemed to not have any personality and seemed to not want to serve anyone. The food was good and filling. However on my burger they forget the mayo. This was the first time in the countless times I went that they forgot something. Soon I ran out of my drink and asked for a new one and they told me that the sprite was getting changed. I then finally got my drink after the check was given.

Have not been here since last year but omg! We waited for our table less than 5 mins then the hostess went to seat us at table, I went to pull my seat back then I immediately felt the nasty build up on the top of the chair also seat had food on the chairs and floor. Then she wanted us to sit at a table next to the dirty one which was just as nasty, sticky and food encrusted it was clearly visible! We just left immediately! Oh I forgot to mention the hostess and waitresses were arguing at the hostess station before we were seated.

It's been at least 15 years since I've dined at a Bob Evans. It was a holiday staple when we visited KY. Within walking distance of our hotel, so we wandered over for a late dinner. It was clean, well lite and the staff was welcoming and friendly. I went for soup & sandwich...... Baked potato soup and grilled ham and cheese..... a perfect combination. Our waitress even threw in a basket of bread, biscuits and pumpkin bread for everyone.
$10.04, dinner and a beverage.

So, a year ago we came down from Phoenix, Az to visit my best friend. He brought us to Bob Evans. We had the candy bacon and fell in love. I've been talking about this bacon for a year. We are back in town for vacation again and we came here to eat because of the candy bacon. Our waitress Julie told us that they stopped serving them about 6 months ago. This broke my heart because this bacon is amazing. I asked to speak with the manager jokingly. She then went and grabbed the manger. Hilary came over and apologized that they stopped serving them. She then offered to have them made for us since we came all this way. They are amazing here and we will continue to come back. Thank you for the love 

Julie & Hilary!!!!!!

this was our first time at Bob Evans and it will not be the last .we tried the breakfast and my wife and I were very pleased with the food our waitress was very nice and kept our glasses full. We came back the next day and tried there dinner menu, this was fantastic food and it  arrived quickly . I wish we had a BOB EVANS in my area in Va. I would never go back to Denny's

This is my go to when I want some quick, friendly breakfast. Sure, it's a chain restaurant. It's also less than half a mile from my apartment, is reasonably priced, and doesn't make me want to go get an STD check like walking into any Waffle House makes me want to do. Okay. A bit dramatic. 

My favorite things here are their pancakes, and omelettes. I can't speak to anything other than these things, but I can assure you. The breakfasts are delicious. They fill your omelette up the way it should be. 

They have a large variety of desserts and sweets as well, but I'm not adventurous enough to take a dive into those yet. Anyways, as far as chain breakfast places go, this place is a solid four. Service is always spectacular, and the food comes out as expected. Nothing more, nothing less. :)

I'd like to preface this by saying that I've eaten at Bob Evans (this location) countless times and I've never really had a problem or a complaint. The strawberry banana crepes are incredible and the chicken salad sandwich is fresh, chunky, and delicious. I'm a little disappointed that they don't seem to have the strawberry lemonade anymore and it only irks me slightly when I still try to order it and get a twisted face asking, "Rasberry lemonade?" However, my last visit to Bob's left me with a taste so foul that even the crepes couldn't save them. They were experiencing kitchen difficulties leaving them with only one working grill which is why our lunch took 30 minutes to be delivered. No biggie except that we only learned about this after the endless wait when we overheard our dipstick server tell another table. I'm convinced that the poor experience was due solely to the server we had - she was awful. My grandpa-in-law ordered a water and got a coffee. He ordered the pick 2 (soup and salad) with a baked potato on the side and got his meal sans the tater. When he said he'd ordered it her defense for not bothering to write it down was that it was a pick 2 and the potato wasn't included... Now I hate to pull the old "I used to wait tables" card, but hot damn. The attitude she assumed and the way in which she addressed a customer (actually saying, "What don't you get? It's a pick 2, not a pick 3") almost made my head spin. She was rude, disrespectful, and sloppy. She didn't even send a manager to the table to resolve the situation. She disappeared for a time and came back saying the manager was busy, but we could complain on our way out if we wanted. I won't even mention the ice I kept slurping hoping she would bring the refills I requested. Okay, maybe I will. Long story short, we complained on our way out the door (after my ninja-like father-in-law had already paid the bill) and received an apology from the cashier (who may or may not have been a manager) and received a few $2 off coupons for our next visit. I don't think Bob would have been happy. The only reason I'll go back there again in the future is because this was one snafu in a list of many pleasant visits. But I've got my eye on you, Mr. Evans.

If you don't mind waiting 40mns or more for your food.. I guess. I went on a Sunday early afternoon. The service was horrible!! Food was mediocre at best. I ordered the Farmers choice & the pancakes were "crispy"? Don't waste your time here.

Here in Tampa for the bar exam. My hotel is right next to this restaurant. The hotel's milk smelled rancid and the coffee was not that great so I decided to pop in here. 

The coffee was fantastic and my server Dora made me feel right at home. 

I am still here actually looking over materials and refilling coffee. 

I got the biscuit and gravy. It was a little salty but still good. The biscuits were great. The gravy was brown - no biggie - I'm used to white gravy but open to new experiences.

Bob Evans is always a good experience.
Tried breakfast today, it was really tasty and inexpensive. More of a home style feel and flavor. Will definitely be back soon.

Overall just not very good. Very standard run of the mill breakfast place. Their healthy options are limited and aren't very healthy. Not egg whites. Some sort of artificial light eggs and they were drenched in butter. The turkey sausage isn't good. The coffee was very bitter. Maybe I was expecting too much.

If I could give this place minus stars I would. We've eaten there several times and each time we got the same waitress who totally ignored us and I'm not one to use the race card but it felt racist I would not normally eat at a chain restaurant but who can really mess up breakfast and it was my husband's idea we will not be going back.
Every time we have eaten there we have watched our waitress cater to her other tables while ignoring ours and not only that we have watched as other diners who were seated after us get served before us. After the second time we walked out the underlined tone felt racist so if you're Chinese like me just know that if you're not white they will ignore you and that speaks volumes about this restaurant.

Pleasantly surprised!

Great service from Shirley (yes, she's tired of Airplane jokes) and really fast delivery of our breakfasts. We both opted for scrambled eggs w/cheese, bacon and these really wonderful multigrain cranberry pancakes. The bacon was thick and crispy, but a tad salty for me (my usual complaint in restaurants). The eggs were great, although they forgot my cheese - I opted to skip a re-grill since I was on a tight schedule.

They have a sugar free syrup if you want it, we didn't... 

I had never eaten at Bob's - my only real opinion of this place was "Gee, my grand parents ate there all the time" Heh. The interior is cozy. Kind of Denny's meets Cracker Barrel in where I would position them. They even have a little pantry/store area at the front with canned and jarred goods. 

Yeah, I'll eat at one of these again. I like it WAY better than a Denny's or an iHop, thats for darned sure.

Quick breakfast .
Hot fresh , how do they make eggs taste so good ? Very large sausage patties , excellent flavor . Great service .

First for the record, they close at 9:00pm and not 9:30pm as the internet states. We've passed by this place plenty of times and never stopped to try it until yesterday.

We got in about 8:30pm and were greeted and seated quickly. The hostess/cashier told us that Nicole would be our server so we waited patiently for her. About 15-20 minutes passed and no one had come by. I was starting to get irritated and a lady pops out and says, "Oh!" and returns to the back. She then comes out and asks us what we would like to drink and checked up on her other couple customer. It was not off to a good start but it got better as the time went by.

We ordered off the 3 course dinner menu.
ENDLESS DINNER ROLLS WILL KEEP ME COMING BACK. BEST THING THAT NIGHT.
Country Fried Steak with mashed potatoes and fries - That was good but nothing superb.
Chicken tenders with mashed potatoes and green beans - Fresh out of the fryer! It was delish.
For dessert, we got a cookie and ice-cream sundae. Since we were there for closing time, she ended up giving us one of each cookie which was nice.

Overall, it was a great experience. She did forget to put in our to-go order but we gave her a break because it was closing time so her mind must be elsewhere but still tipped 16%. Definitely will be back!

I had one of the burgers (sorry can't remember it's name but it had a spicy sauce, bacon and fried onions). The patty looked like one of those frozen ones they probably just threw on the grill. IT WAS STILL GOOD. Fast service. Went an hour before closing so, very quite. Son's chicken tenders were stale though and he said "the ones from Cracker Barrel have more flavor". They have snacks that could possibly be for traveling such as gummy worms and large dinner mints in those gas station type, 99 cent bags. Looks like some what of a bakery as well. They have an menu so my other son was able to get his wish; pancakes and bacon for dinner. Our waiter had to warm up to us for some reason though. Maybe I don't look like a good tipper :-)

Great service from beginning to end. Love the menu options and treats available for purchase in the foyer. Home style food takes the dining out feeling away. Treated like friends instead of customers. Clean environment and ample parking. Great place to grab breakfast, lunch and dinner.

First time here - similar to Denny's chain.
Breakfast was good - brioche French toast
, 2 eggs and ham - tasted good - coffee - eh - had a metallic taste - also wifi pretty slow.
Not that I wanted more coffee- but wasn't offered, otherwise service ok - everyone friendly.

This Subway location is usually clean and the staff is always very friendly.  The food is mostly fresh although they often take knives that have been in the trough behind the cutting surface with the cuttings of vegetables and other leftovers and they wipe them with a rag and use them making me wonder what bacteria may be on the knives.  They should provide tea through closing time.  My wife and I have often arrived after 6pm and the tea is often gone - taken down for the night (this is pretty early).

The staff is friendly here.

The sandwiches are  the standard Subway sands.  

I do wish Subway would carry regular Mayo.    Let me make my healthy choice, I'm skipping the chips, let me have real mayo.

My client is super happy the sourdough is back.  :)
I feel like this is the best subway in reno! The customer service is wonderful..even when the place is packed for a lunch rush I'm out of there in usually 5 minutes.

I come here often and the staff is always nice and make my sandwich exactly how i like it but i notice that every time i come in, it is a new face and i never see the same people working there twice. Theres always a ton of people ordering when i go in but only one or 2 employees who look like they could use an extra set of hands

I love how you get a coupon in the mail that says 'ANY FOOTLONG FOR $6' then you go here and they're like, "Sorry, it's only for the regular subs." *sigh
The service is good and the food is decent but the topping are a bit simple. Some of the other Subway restaurants have cilantro and other veggies that this place doesn't have. 
When I walked in there were a bunch of guys talking in a different language at a table and it seemed like they were talking about some financial matters. I thought they were customers until one of them went behind the counter and made a sandwich. It was kind of weird! 
The prices are expensive if you don't pick a sandwich from the weekly menu (whatever happened to $5 footlong?) and lets face it nobody wants to get stuck with the tuna fish sandwich. Lol
The place is pretty clean and the staff is friendly.  It's one of the only non smoking places that are open late in the north valleys.

(The new owners are awful! I wont be going back. I feel like thry are trying to scam me for more money. Also very rude! They use to be the best when it was the previous owners but now has gone down hill.  Very disappointed!

Went to this new location with a group of 15 people. The servers were accommodating and even replaced a dish that someone found to be too spicy.
The location is super cozy.  There is a little bit of outdoor seating.
The menu could be more specific because we didn't know the spice level of any of the dishes. A few people found their dishes to be too spicy. I'm not sure if the level of spice can be changed to accommodate different palates.
The food came out quickly and the servers were constantly refilling our water glasses and asking if we needed anything.  They were so sweet.
Needless to say, there are tons of vegetarian (vegan actually) options.

This food was absolutely wonderful!  Come expecting finger food and the spices!  Heavenly but could be a little warm for some people!!   I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone that's not tried Ethiopian food!
Food is delicious and service is friendly. Love that you can pick what goes in the combo platter.

Husband and I felt adventurous and came here to eat Ethiopian food. The waitress explained the dishes and our delicious and well-spiced food was brought out quickly. This restaurant is very clean and friendly. There were a lot of people here for a Tuesday night.

The food were absolutely wonderful. We ordered sampler platter in both vegetables and meats. My favorites were the lamb and non-spicy chicken. I loved all the vegetables dishes. The flavors were spicy, warm, and comforting at the same time. Services were great as well. Good job Zemam's !
Like the concept of the samplers, makes a crowd favorite. Absolute a fan of the fermented bread, kinda sour but add a refreshment to all the spices.

Delicious! Staff was great, and food was fantastic. The teff injera (make sure to ask for it!) is naturally gluten-free as are all of the meal items, so celiacs can eat across the whole menu.  Our party was mostly people who were new to Ethiopian food, and they are all converts even though mouths were a little fiery.

Zemam's and Zemam's too are basically the same thing, for anyone trying to decide.

Food: consistent and always very good. If you're not used to ethnic foods, this is a good place to start! Always order one less thing than you think you'll need.

Atmosphere: the one on speedway seems almost always empty. Both locations seem to be houses converted into restaurants. Servers are very friendly and helpful in the ordering, but service itself is VERY slow. But I think that's part of the charm :) 

Great for long, lazy dinners with a group of friends. Also, very cheap for an authentic ethiopian meal. One of my favorites in Tucson!

Great new location, same great food.  I went a few days after it opened on a weeknight and I don't think they were prepared for the amount of business, a bunch of big groups came in and it took a little while to get our food.  However, we brought bottles of wine and enjoyed ourselves while we were waiting and the food did not dissapoint.

For lovers of the original Zemam's, there is one major reason to try Zemam's Too at least once: You can choose the Gored Gored as part of the sampler platter. I'd always been curious about it, but I just couldn't abandon my beloved sampler platter. It's so good. Anything on the menu is fair game for the sampler, including some fish and lamb options, which you won't find at the OG Zemam's.

For the uninitiated, Zemam's Too is a great restaurant for people who 1) love bold flavors and spice, 2) are open to an interesting non-Western dining experience, and 3) aren't too fussy about ambiance or getting their hands dirty. Like its predecessor, Zemam's Too is now in the top tier of my favorite restaurants in Tucson. I prefer these restaurants over Cafe Desta--the Zemam's dishes really hit you with flavor like a truck, which I absolutely love.

We drove by this restaurant every time we came to Tuscan. Today, we decided to try it for lunch....and we were pleasantly surprised. The food is delicious and the service is great. We had a meat sampler and a vegetables sampler because we wanted to try as much different things as we can. They were both absolutely delicious. 
This will be a regular stop for us in Tuscan. Highly recommend this restaurant for anyone that is familier with this type of food, as I am, or a novice.

After exploring vegan dishes at other Ethiopian restaurants, I am not nearly as enthusiastic about this one as I was at first.  Though I did think their food was good, and they do have lots of vegan dishes, they aren't the best place in town for this cuisine. Their service is great and I still recommend the Yetakelt Wat, Gomen Wat ( spiced collard greens)  and Gomen Alicha.  Their injera is rubbery compared to other restaurants'.  The atmosphere here is a bit dull as well.  If you like Ethiopian food, or if you're looking to try new plant based dishes, give this a try....but try others next.

So many tasty choice, and a few new if you have been to their other restaurant. If you don't believe you like vegetarian food you have to try Ethiopia. And if your carnivore you have to try at Ethiopian as well. If you like food you can't go wrong. The staff is always friendly and upbeat.

Just like the original the food was delicious! I believe it was the owner who waited on us, he was very friendly and the atmosphere was very cozy. I'm very happy to have this just a few minutes away from our house :)

I'd been wanting to try Zemam's Too for some time (it's very close to work) and last night I got my chance.

The food is wonderful, with a wide variety of spices and level of heat, yet every dish is compatible with the others, no matter what spices are used. The communal style - no cutlery, and it's served on a big tray over a spongy sourdough bread (tortilla thickness) with a thicker version of the same bread on the side. Not everyone will take to the sponginess of the bread but I love it!

My friend and I ordered the lentil stew and non-spicy chicken - they came with side portions of the green beans, the red lentils, a cabbage/carrot dish that I had also wanted to try, and a potato/vegetable medley. We shared everything very happily. I had iced tea, which is flavored with cardamom and cinnamon. It was yummy, very satisfying and relaxing. There was no dessert option, but I realized I didn't really need one!

One final note. Our server, Lucas, could not have been more helpful, more knowledgeable or more authentically charming. He added immeasurably to our enjoyment of the evening.

We'll be back, and we'll make sure we're hungry!

Great food, refreshing oasis ambiance, attentive service -- we order a spicy chicken, a spicy beef, collard greens, roasted cauliflower and the chef added lentils, spinach and a couple of condiments -- so very good!  Because the design and the very comfortable chairs are in this second version of Zemam's, I liked it even more than the Broadway location.  Best value in Tucson!

Sooo good. And the people who work there are really nice too. 

I wish they had a really affordable lunch special or something, because I think then I'd be there everyday.

We loved the food! The vegan platter was plentiful, delicious and filled with flavor. Even the Ethiopian-style coffee was delicious and comforting! We thought it was a really cute little place with good food & service, not to mention lots of vegan options (which we love)! I give only four stars because even though the gluten free substitute bread was very yummy, and, according to my partner, tasted the same as the real stuff, I got very sick later on that evening. Don't get me wrong...this place is not claiming to be totally gluten-free/celiac safe and I was the one who took the risk. However, I'm not usually super sensitive and can usually get away with eating gluten-free items at non-dedicated places every once in a while and feel totally fine. It felt like I got some pretty serious gluten damage somehow. I'd recommend to people with gluten issues to skip out on the bread all together. Celiacs...y'all would probably be best off going somewhere else.

A great place for a vegan to eat..Love the veggie sampler and the veggie options. I just dont understand why all the prices change from lunch to dinner for the same food. Do they give you more? I will have to call and find out. We got the veggie sampler and two veggie options for about thirty dollars including drink for dinner. Just the veggie sampler is good for two if not starving..if you want to stuff yourself...and a friend then get two sides...it should be enough

As good as the original, but when I went they didn't have the spiced coffee they offer at the other store, we were served regular coffee, the manager called the other store to see about that and fixed it with some spices, but it wasn't the same, I love this restaurant, and I love it's coffee, so it is a big deal to me that it was a plain one, anyway, it's been like 6 months since my visiting (like 2 weeks since my last visit to the original), hopefully this has changed

I really liked Zemam's and had been many time to the Broadway location. When I heard of the new location I was pretty excited to check it out. The atmosphere is different, less like a home and more like a restaurant but it still one my favorite spots in Tucson. I take my from out of town here all the time, just great!

Not to be confused with the other Ethiopian restaurant in Tucson with a similar name, Zemam's Too is the one very close to the U of A campus. It's a small comfortable joint, and the owner is very kind and generous. 

I've been here a couple times now, and each time have ordered the spicy tilapia special. It comes served on the spongy, slightly sour injera bread, along with your choice of 3 vegetables. I usually just ask for the owner to pick them for me. This particular instance, I received some stewed red lentils, green beans cooked with carrots, and a stewed chicken. Both the sides and the fish itself were extremely flavorful cooked with a myriad of spices, as you'd expect from any Ethiopian restaurant. The fish was particularly soft and flaky, a very generously large filet portion. Although I am not an expert at judging African fare, I can only say that personally I really enjoyed the food at Zemam's. It's great for groups, for dinner, for anything. Definitely worth stopping by and experiencing the joys of an Ethiopian dining experience, grabbing food with injera by hand and sharing great conversations with good people.
The atmosphere and staff are very warm and welcoming! The food is fantastic, especially the #17 beef option. The experience was a first for us using no silverware, but we really enjoyed it!

Zemams Too had a really comfortable atmosphere and played great music. The waiting staff was exceptional! Our waitress Elen gave great suggestions about what to order, was such a vibrant and cutely dressed worker. We got the 2 veg 1 meat sampler, enough to feed four, super delicious and came quickly. 10/10 would recommend.

I've been a fan of the original location for eons, but as a West University homeowner, I was thrilled to have the second open here.  I'm not sure why I haven't written a review until now, as I've eaten here dozens of times, so I'm long overdue.

My sons are adopted from Zambia, and I spent some time in Africa (though not Ethiopia), and many of the items on the menu take me back to the bustling marketplaces and street-side huts of Lusaka and villages in Botswana and Namibia.  I could eat my weight in the green beans (which you can't get at the Broadway location)!

The owner (Amanuel, I believe) seems to always be there (while his son seems to perpetually staff the Broadway location now), and he is always so courteous and attentive, smiling every time we've come in - even at moments before closing.  The portions are fantastic, and the price is insanely reasonable for what you get.  (I'm vegetarian and always end up getting the sampler with friends, so I can't speak about meat dishes, though my non-veg friends have enjoyed them tremendously.)

There is something sacred about a shared meal, and the way everyone eats off the same plate (and then eats that "plate") is incredibly special.  I used to be neighbors to one of the original servers at the Broadway location, and she told me stories about the owner's kindness, as well as incredible tales of his efforts to be a bridge between families torn by the conflict between Ethiopia and Eritrea.  Knowing that the owners are great people makes the food even more sacred to me, and I feel good supporting a local business owned by a family that is doing genuine good in the world.

Both locations are fantastic, and I still go to the Broadway location fairly frequently, but because of slight differences to the menu, I prefer the Speedway venue.  That being said, both locations are real treasures, and better than Ethiopian food I've tasted in major cities like DC, NYC, and San Francisco.  We are so fortunate to have such authentic and delicious food here in Tucson, made by salt-of-the-earth types of people!
Lovely atmosphere, awesomly FRESH & seasoned cuisine! Owner extremely pleasant & informative. Perfect for a family feast or an intimate date night. Prices are right for the amount of food you get.
Friendly service, delicious food, great ambiance, and clean restaurant. A wonderful and yummy place.  Definitely go.

This was my first time ever eating Ethiopian food and this place was absolutely delicious. I ordered the vegetarian plate with gluten-free bread and it was out of this world. I was really nervous about trying this type of food, but I will definitely be back. The service was excellent and I was really impressed overall.

I have been eating at the original Zemam's location for years. It is one of my favorite Tucson establishments. And so I was thrilled to learn that the owners had opened a second restaurant, and closer to the University of Arizona campus and Interstate 10. 

I opted for a dinner with a friend. 

First things I noticed: 

1. Same wonderful and warming service. 
2. Great, open space. Lots more room. 
3. Slightly more formal than the Broadway location. 

But I found that not only is the menu a bit more limited when it comes to my favorites, the prices, at times, are slightly higher. One of the things I absolutely love about the original location is the option for the sampler, which comes with great variety and sizable portions. 

The verdict: The original location is still my favorite spot.

Always enjoyed this Zemam's! 
I try to visit when I'm back in town, since where I live now does not have a single Ethiopian restaurant. I miss Zemam's Too.
