I was ready to be super critical of this place, as the original Zemam's is my favorite restaurant. Well, in-my-face, because this second location is somehow even better. AND no one knows about it yet, so it's not busy (which I don't think will last long). The shiro and gomen alicha are the best dishes, in my opinion. 

The very nice owner will also check-in and see how everything is. I really like places that respect their customers, so I appreciate this and am happy to support this yummy restaurant.

I took my parents here while they were visiting Tucson last month and they were shocked about how similar the cuisine is to Indian food. I've had it before and had a feeling they would enjoy it and of course they did. I love their shiro and all of our dishes were very flavorful and some also had a nice spice to them. We were also checked on several times throughout our meal. I like that they give you small portions of dishes you did not order as "sides" in addition to your entrees when they bring you your platter. I was glad I got to try almost all of the dishes on the menu since we got a few extra tastes. The injera was a little soggy compared to other times I have had it, but I wonder if it was a one time thing or just a different style.

This is one of my favorite places in Tucson to eat, for many reasons. 

First, of course, is the great Ethiopian food! I have had just about every dish available on the menu and they are all very good. I usually get the veggie sampler so I can have three different flavors at one meal. And the total portion size of the meal is large enough that I always have leftovers to take home for the next day. If you like spicy food, get the red lentil dish or the spicy boneless chicken - absolutely delicious! Also, try the Ethiopian ice tea - it is very tasty and smooth! 

I also really like the ambiance of the restaurant. It's just a nice, relaxed atmosphere since it is a smaller sized restaurant and not a chain restaurant. There is plently of seating available but it is arranged nicely. 

Lastly, the staff there are always very pleasant.

The other Zeman restaurant on E. Broadway is also very nice and has the same qualitites... good food, friendly staff. But I do like the one on Speedway better, maybe just because it was the first one that I went too.

I've eaten at many Ethiopian restaurants around the country, none of them even compare to how amazing Zemams food is. Not even close. Incredible food, great eating experience, caring and friendly staff! I eat here at least once a week, the food is that good. My favorites are 1, 5, 12, and 15!
Always delicious.  I go for the two samplers 21 and 22 I think and usually let them pick whatever items to include and have yet to get something that's not super tasty.

This food is incredible. I have always been a pretty picky eater, and was a little unsure of Ethiopian food the first time I came here, seeing that I had never tried it. That being said, it has become my favorite restaurant. I have gone through phases where I eat here daily (I'm currently in one of these phases). The people who work here are friendly and great, and the food is unbeatable. Great place to go with friends, and great take out!

I've been to Zemam's Too twice in the last few weeks: We went there for my husband's birthday, then last night I met a friend for dinner and suggested that we meet here. Both times I've absolutely loved it.

My favorites are the vegetarian dishes, ESPECIALLY the yesimir wot (I hope I spelled that right!) and the green beans, but the spicy boneless chicken is also very good. 

One thing to keep in mind: The portion sizes are quite generous. This is generally a good thing, but if you don't like to waste food and are headed somewhere so you can't take leftovers with you, keep it in mind. The sampler is supposed to feed one, but when I came here with my husband, I ordered the all-veggie sampler and he ordered the all-meat sampler (although we both ended up eating some of everything). We were both very hungry and I think between the two of us, we could only eat about half or 2/3 of what was served. 

Service is very friendly, prices are reasonable, and the food is excellent--all in all, this place is great!

The waiters/waitresses are so nice and friendly! The food was also quite good. My Ethiopian friend could not stop eating and confirmed the authenticity of the food. Great restaurant, but it is more on the expensive side.

Ok. Tried their new location. Clean. More parking. Food portions more generous than previous experiences. Food tastes good!  Had coffee. It was real good. Only thing was their chicken dish...the chicken was dry as a bone. And it was boneless. Other than that. Good. Delicate flavors.

Anyone ever notice the martini glass on their sign? I drove by it for months not really looking at it and finally I see the glass. What's that about?!

Anyway....

24 hours
amazing pancakes
cheap

What more could you want?!
Great place for breakfast and the coffee is fresh and hot.  Great staff very friendly an always willing to help.

I had a good experience here.  I know some other folks haven't but maybe they should try NOT coming to Bill's at 3:00am.  
We went for a hang over killer breakfast at a descent hour this morning.  That is, we actually went home and went to bed, then got up and had breakfast.
Everyone who works there is SO friendly.  The older lady at the front counter seriously made me miss my grandma-- that's how sweet she is.
Prompt service.  Great coffee-- much better than any diner type place I've ever had.
I love the atmosphere too-- diverse, lotsa families.  Felt so homey and close to the neighborhood and without any hint of pretention.
Now mind you, I'll never hit this place up at 3:00am because I don't want to spoil the innocent charm.  I mean, come on, everyone looks bad at that hour of the night.

Very pleased. You should check this place out! Party of 8 seated immediately on a Saturday. We had a lil bit of everything for breakfast! Pancakes on point. Waffles really good. Hash browns perfect. Skillet looked as good as it tasted. Eggs done right. And the bacon...what else is there?  The bacon was everything!  If ur in the Lou, make ur way to Uncle Bill's! We did.

it took me 6 years to get to this St Louis institution. What a shame! It reminds me of the steakhouses and hotel restaurants of my childhood. As a matter of fact, I'd say the last renovation was done by Disney set builders at some point in the '70s. I honestly expected mediocre, over salted food with bored service. Instead, I got delightful red flannel hash (!) and beverage refills without being asked! it was great to finally share this wonderful place with my native south city husband. perfect, just as it is. :)

I am. Sshh dToday

Hi I'm Mike in south city. You seem like a terrific girl and you're quite attractive if I may say so. I'm into playing guitar, books, film, theater, sports and history. I'd love to meet for drinks soon.

Sent 1:14 PM

Okay...where to start. A friend and myself went in around 10:30 pm on Friday night because we were craving waffles. I want to start with this- this place is a dive. It smells funny when you walk in, everything is sticky, and it's decorated like that trashy great aunt's house you had to visit as a kid and she just never seemed to give up on the Nixon era. Our booth didn't have cushioning and there were flies everywhere.

That being said, it's kind of part of the appeal? If you're into that sort of thing. If you're expecting a clean, totally sanitary, updated eatery don't go here. 

My biggest problem was that the prices didn't reflect the atmosphere. Usually dives price according to their appearance, the grosser the place, the cheaper the food. I got the pecan Belgian waffle with a small milk and one slice of bacon and one sausage link and my total was $15. (They automatically add a tip between 10 pm and 7 am or for parties of 5 or more, be warned- I almost didn't notice. They also add a 10 percent tip on all to-go orders as well). 

The waffle was amazing and had tons of pecans in it, which was great. The bacon was crispy with little to no fat on it. The syrup is served warmed and they bring you a whole little jug so you don't have to worry about messy packets. I had to take home leftovers. 

I thought the service was really good- the server was very personable and fairly attentive. Our order was correct and there were no issues with the food or the service. 

I also used the free WiFi and it was good- no connectivity issues. Parking was also good- they have a large lot with plenty of spaces. 

When we were leaving around 11:30 it started to get crowded - I think it was homecoming and high schoolers were looking to hang out after the dance. When you're leaving, you take your order ticket to the front where the cashier rings you out. You have the option to leave additional tip, which we did, at this time.

Also- note- it is now 24/7. They no longer close on Sundays, so that's awesome. One of the few late-night places in South City. 

Overall, I would go back. The food was good and the atmosphere was very low-key and divey. However, my biggest complaint was that the prices were a lot higher than I was expecting and you do have to have an appreciation for grungy places in order to like this place.

great old time local hangout ....you can smoke inside, that's how old school it is.  you get the traditional truck stop food, you know, the sloppy eggs, house potatoes, biscuit, gravy and a slap of american cheese melted all over the top....your greasy spoon and then some.  open ALL THE TIME

Came here for a late breakfast on a nonstop cross country drive.  The biscuits were truly beautiful and we got into a spousal theological argument about the sausage gravy.  I thought that it was truly awesome and that the sage from the sausage made it aromatically wonderful.  My wife likes her sausage (and her gravy) less sagey.
The pancakes were fluffy and good enough so that I forgot the syrup.  The eggs were perfectly cooked.  The country fried steak was tender, crispy, and flavorful -- all that you can ask it to be.  The ham was outstanding.  It was meaty, not watery, flavorful, thick, and nicely browned.  It was what ham should be but seldom is.
The hash browns were merely good.  They were flavorful, not over-oiled, and partly crispy but they would have been potato perfection if they'd been crisped a bit more.
The restaurant was clean and pleasant, the waitress was courteous, efficient, and answered our questions, and the restrooms were clean.  A place we'll remember the next time we're in St. Louis.

Tons of sweet pancake and waffle options, along with just about any savory breakfast food available 24 hours. 

Also, great for people-watching, especially late-night.

Although I haven't had Uncle Bill's after a long night out, I was on the hunt for food and was craving breakfast for some odd reason. Uncle Bill's isn't usually the first place that comes to mind, since I live so close to Courtesy.

The atmosphere is pretty much what you'd expect for a 24-hr diner. It is dark and smokey, and looks like you have stepped onto the set of a 1970s buddy cop movie. When I visited, it wasn't very crowded. That might be due to the fact we actually visited during dinner hours.

The food was better than expected. I had biscuits and gravy, hashbrowns, and some bacon. The gravy was nicely seasoned and a good consistency. The biscuits were fresh. The menu offers a wide variety. You could go every night of the week and not eat the same thing twice.

A large choice of inexpensive food at any time of the day. What more can you ask for?

LOVE this place!  It's very much old-timey in that they're working with the same menu from decades ago.  I've only eaten breakfast there, but it is definitely the most delicious B&G I've had.  Food is fast and the service is great.  You're seated quickly, even though you may wait in line for a couple minutes during the busy weekend morning hours.  This is my go-to breakfast venue!

I am a huge breakfast guy, and this definitely the best breakfast in St. Louis.

Fun fact: I had my first date with the woman who I'm now engaged to here!  Bet you didn't know THAT!

Anyway, this place is great if you love greasy, traditional American breakfast, like I do.  I highly recommend the Supreme 2x2x2x2: 2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, and 2 pancakes, with hash browns.  It is really, really delicious, and super cheap!  The best part is the pancakes... they are what Uncle Bill's does best.  Other things on the menu are good, but I recommend the pancakes with whatever you get.

Very tasty.  I hit it up every time I pass through St. Louis.

Always love this place. Usually there is a line, but they move you through pretty quickly! LOVE the chicken and waffles! Would say it's better than Roscoes! This place is open 24 hours and if you come after 10pm-6am they will add gratuity to your check.

Great apple pancakes!  Typical American diner, no frills. The coffee is good, and the service is adequate. My husband ordered the 2x2x2x2 and substituted apple pancakes, I just had wheat toast. The toast was not good, doughy and barely toasted.
For it being 2:30 in the morning and only having one server on the floor it was great service. The food was good.

an okay place. food is great but the service was awful. for having pancakes in the name the pancakes were not that great. our server was loud and rude when we asked what a dish was with no explanation. there was a strange ambiance- no music and extremely awkwardly quiet the whole time. bottom line: good food, impatient/rude staff, borderline expensive.

Uncle Bill's - a staple for me when I'm St. Louis, mostly because I like their food and know where they're located, a little because I'm from out of town and not familiar with many other breakfast joints. 

I'm a 'basic breakfast' guy - eggs, bacon, hash browns, French Toast, & coffee, and they do it all justice. Their bacon is amazing. But my daughter had their hot chocolate which came piled high with whipped cream, and she said it was "amazing!" 

My buddy brought me here years ago, and now I bring my family whenever we're in town. There's a reason for that!

The corned beef hash and buttermilk pancakes are the best and no one in St. Louis can match this superiority. 

Yah the booths are falling apart, new carpeting, new entrance, complete rehab of dining room is needed, but would change a lot of the positives.  

4 stars for the pancakes, corned beef hash, and friendly service.
This place has pretty solid breakfast food. I don't know if Uncle Bill is a real person, or his nephew runs it or something, but real or not they seem like great people.

Stopped here en route to the airport- was way early for a flight and decided to find a diner for some breakfast.  24 hours- check, diner- check, cheap- not so much, but man, was this a good choice.  Better (and less greasy and smelly) than Waffle House, and more nostalgic than Cracker Barrel (both of which prevalent in the area).  My ham and cheese omelet was fluffy and enormous.  Biscuits were warm from the oven, coffee strong but not too, and service was o-ok.  Menus are on the place mat at your table which adds to the ambiance, and with tip, my bill came to $11.00- what a deal.  They do have early bird specials and combo deals, but I wasn't into one of everything for breakfast- you sure could load up there if you wanted.

My favorite diner in St. Louis. :) 
The lines are pretty crazy for Sunday brunch, but oh so worth it. I make it a priority to visit this place every time I'm in STL, especially after a night of dancing.

10 years ago, I would write a Far different review.
Now that I know what to expect, Here goes:
First, its a classic place, that all "st Louies" know about.
Its the place that is open at 2am, that will sell you enough breakfast food to gorge your not so conscious mentality on.
The food is just OK, they do 1 thing great, and its so great they should change the name of the place.  It should be Uncle Bills Waffles.
their belgian waffles are good, better than the pancakes, which of course are good, how can you screw that up?

The Servers are usually South side hoosiers, who come packed with more attitude than you do, and  you are drunk... so this makes for some fun people watching when it gets packed.
The Coffee is very strong, I guess they had a guy pass out in his pancakes once, and ever since been serving the coffee at double strength, so they dont have to cart you to  your car(damn drunks, lol).

I'll go here again, but dont like to spread that around too far.
If you like Greasy Spoons, this place is for you.
or- Maybe you were looking to buy some eclectic handmade goodies, like some Ceramic Cherubs. (they have a small craft window in the front, always selling some crafts?)

Overall:
2/5 on the food, with a 2 thumbs up to the Waffles
2/5 on the service, sorry It bothers me when you smoke while taking my order, but you do it politely!
2/5 on Presentation, it looks sadly like a antique.

Here on a business trip earlier this week and didn't want the hotel continental breakfast so the front desk recommended.

I'm very picky about pancakes but I was hungry for some and decided to get a stack.  I was so happy that the pancake was cooked thoroughly.

I have had far too many hung over mornings in this very establishment.  I remember, quite vividly, a painful morning the day of my 21st Birthday.  Though I could not even think about Uncle Bills for years after that painful morning, mostly spent in the bathroom, I have ventured back, because it's an institution, and the pancakes are quite simply delicious.

This place is odd, for sure.  The morning crowd tends to be a lot of families, on Sundays, a ton of people head here after church (so expect a pretty painful wait) but at night time, the place is filled with a rag tag bunch of characters, guaranteed to keep you interested while you pack down hash browns and cup after cup of not that great coffee.  

I know it's not necessarily that different than a Denny's, but Uncle Bills has more character to it.  It is the same place I have been eating since I was a baby and my parents let me gum pancakes to keep me from crying.  The décor really hasn't changed much, and I love that.  It's got charm...even if it's not so charming.

Very good 24 hour diner style restaurant. Clean, affordable, polite. 

I had the "slingshot". STL favorite.

Recommended and I will eat here again.

We went late night (2:00 am) on a Friday. They had a reasonable crowd. The pancakes were amazing and the scrambled eggs were perfectly cooked. The hash browns were tasty...crunchy on the outside and tender underneath. My only complaint was the bacon was a little tough. I think they probably had cooked it ahead for the 1:00 am bar crowd. My companion had a hot ham and cheese and said it was very good. Our waitress was nice and very attentive. I would definitely recommend Uncle Bill's.

Best greasy spoon pancake house in St. Louis.  The yelp menu is not accurate at all.  Why would there be no pancakes on a pancake house menu?   Uhmmmm....think people.  Anyway, lots of good food for around 10 smackaroos.

It's like a good-quality diner blown up to crowded restaurant size.  Good pancakes, good chicken, large menu, some good other stuff.  There's nothing I'd drive across town for, but if I lived next door I'd eat here quite a bit and not really complain.  That type of place.

From my experience, the waitresses are predominantly in that 40-60 age group and of the type that will call you 'hun' with hostility rather than welcome feeling.  The decor is from the 80s and the place has a permanent smell of smoke that will probably linger years after the place closes down.  Classic Americana. 

The clientele is a healthy cross-section.  Last time there a guy sat near our table who looked like like a former convict with mental deficiencies.  He stared at our table non-stop.  He ordered a grilled cheese sandwich (perhaps from the children's menu) and stared at our table as he ate it.  He finished half of it, got up, and left without paying.  The waitress came over 10 minutes later and complained about the "ol' dine and dash game" and how he just walked right out past the front desk.

Yep, it's that type of place.

I've only been here for late-night dining or use this place as a greasy hang over cure. Both are great for that.

First: be prepared to wait in a bit of a line. Waiting in lines for food is almost unheard of in St. Louis City, especially for some pancakes.

Second: try the pancakes. They're wonderful, light fluffy and the perfect medium for what you really get pancakes for: butter and syrup.

The late-night crowd is typical late-night, up-all-night, coffee-breathing, red-eyed atmosphere. It's like being in the County and going to a Denny's at 4a.m. You get the social scene kids, and the late-night drunks... As much can be expected of any place serving syrupy pillows of yum, with bacon on the side.

Fast forward to the morning, where the families start coming in. That always seems like a longer line and louder room with all the kids.

This is one of those places in St. Louis where EVERYONE has a story... Or should have a story. They usually go like this: "Man, last night at Uncle Bill's, we saw..."

Oh my goodness. Talk about a gem in the rough!

Our ongoing tour to sample some of the top rated restaurants in the Lou brought us to the door of Uncle Bill's during the Fourth of July weekend. 

To be honest, I wasn't really expecting to be wow'd. I have pretty high standards when it comes to breakfast; there are two restaurants total which have knocked off my proverbial socks, and I wasn't confident that this was going to be one of them. 

There was a small wait for a table on Sunday morning, giving us a little time to glance around the rather odd decor, which made me feel a bit like I was transported back to the 1970s. Once seated at our table we were presented with menus with a LOT of options, all reasonably priced. It didn't take me long, however, to reach my decision. I was there for pancakes of course!

I choose a western egg white omelet, with a side of pecan pancakes. My partner chose an dish called 2x2x2x2, which came with eggs, pancakes, bacon and sausage.  The service was decent in taking our order in a timely manner and delivering it fairly quickly.

My breakfast companion was pleased with his standard American breakfast fare. The bacon was to his liking and the eggs nice and fluffy. He was a tad disappointed in the pancakes, which were a little too done for his taste. 

As far as my dish goes - it was the best omelet and the best pecan pancakes I've ever had. A nice light omelet with ham, onion and peppers, with melted cheese (perhaps Velveeta?) creating a cohesive little bite of heaven with every forkful. The pancakes, topped with butter and sugar free syrup, were light, fluffy and stuffed with just the right amount of crunchy pecans. 

Pair it all with a decent cup of coffee and I definitely had the most deliciously satisfying breakfast I've had in awhile. 

100% recommend stopping by Uncle Bill's, any time of the day or night!
I got the young spring chicken but the name is a little scary. The fried chicken was good. But the cole slaw was discussing. Fries were good.

LOVE Uncle Bill's! This is a DINER-type restaurant, folks. If you are looking for fine-dining experience, this is NOT IT. Uncle Bill's is a tradition with many St. Louisians, and continues to be with my family. Very reasonable prices, and service is solid... maybe not always super-duper quick, but the ladies do their best. The food is always above average. My favorite: Crepes Paree (crepes with strawberries and whipped cream), bacon (they have the very think, long kind) and hashbrowns.  Other family favorites are omlettes, pancakes and french toast. Set your expectations appropriately (DINER with DINER-TYPE service and food) and you won't be disappointed!
Good food but super slow service. Our waitress acted annoyed when we asked for more coffee and soda when she hadn't checked on our table for over 20 mins.

Uncle Bill's Pancake and Dinner House use to be a great place to go for breakfast or brunch.   Be prepared to stand in line for a short time, it moves quickly.  Sunday we decided it was brunch time and since it was my birthday I decided to go here.  Why did I want to go here?  I love their corned beef hash (I think it comes out of a can, but I love it).  

Uncle Bill, Uncle Bill, Uncle Bill. Why was it me that got the burnt corned beef hash?  Shame on Annie, our waitress, for serving that to me and shame on me for not sending it back.  If I sent it back, the rest of my food would have gotten cold plus an additional wait for it.  His omelet was good and there was no problem with it.  I have never been so disappointed in the food at Uncle Bill's. 

Would I come back here?  No, this place is off the breakfast list. There are too many places that serve brunch and breakfast.

I will definitely be back. I live in the area and this was my first time visiting. I have no complaints. Our coffees were kept full and hot. I ordered the 2 eggs and Canadian bacon. The biscuits are fluffy and flavorful, pancakes are amazing. Canadian bacon was crisp and the eggs were a greasy, yolky delight. Bring your kids, bring your families, or bring your date.

The food was just as good as anywhere else. The service was so terrible, we waited 10 minutes & finally got someone to stop to at least pour coffee. At 15 minutes our server came to get our order. Since the food quality doesn't really exceed anywhere else, I won't go back.

I've been here twice. No real big complaints but nothing to rave about either. The quality of the food matches the price on the menu. Traditional style breakfast/brunch food that is prepared for the large crowds that come in for the deal. Staff is very friendly and nice but do need some work on their serving skills. 

If you go try to order the pancakes or waffles. Their batter is delicious. Their eggs and meats are subpar at best and their cheese is like plastic. 

I recommend for a hungover morning. Not my first choice but certainly not my last.
This is our go to place late night.  Awesome diner with pretty good service.  Love the grilled chicken and eggs, absolutely fantastic.  Highly recommended!

I love going here for breakfast or any time of the day! Servers are nice and friendly I would recommend Uncle Bill's for breakfast, lunch and dinner! The ambiance is not great but makes up for the food!

I go here maybe once every couple of years,. This place has really gone downhill. It still stinks of ciggarette smoke and the coffee is too darn strong to even enjoy. The food is crap, atleast it was last night. Eggs were old and looked like rubber,  bacon too well done, and toast that looked and tasted like straw. 

I was also taken aback at how filthy they have become. Plates and glasses were dirty, the table was stickey with syrup, and the chairs had food stuck on them. Bathrooms are so nasty I just held it till I got home. NASTY  won't be back.
Always love Uncle Bills! They've earned multiple awards, which are displayed proudly on the wall. Best place when drunk, or just up at 2am and want some breakfast!

Tried this for breakfast early on a Tuesday morning. Place was really quiet and staff was attentive and friendly. Fast service and good food!
Pancakes were good, coffee was good and biscuits and gravy were solid. Exactly what a 24 hour breakfast place should be like - nothing fancy but covered all the basics!
Sabrina did a wonderful job taking care of us.
Told about this place by coworkers. Breakfast if awesome!!!! Definitely must try this place. Large portions. Only down side is they could have better coffee.
love,love ,love this place, fvery retro1970's diner, they have best pancakes, maybe even better than Lou mITCHELL'S  in chicago.. highly recommend to anyone,.

On my first two visits to Uncle Bill's, the coffee cups they gave me had lipstick marks.  I love this place.

The food is actually kind of gross good, and it's open 24 hours, and they allow indoor smoking.  However, it's not as cheap as I always expect it to be.  I mean, it's not expensive by any means, but I feel like I should be able to get a decent meal at this kind of place for $5 or 6.  Never happens at Uncle Bill's.  

I like it anyway.

NOTHING wrong with this place but, then again, nothing spectacular either.

I visited this joint at the recommendation of the Riverfront Times 'Best of' list.  So far, that weekly has delivered a very average burger, pizza, and breakfast.  Maybe there is no good food in St Louis?

My waitress raved about the bacon so I ordered it along with two eggs, hashbrowns, and pecan pancakes.  Meh.  Nothing special about the bacon.  It's not like the maple bacon at Lucky's Cafe in Cleveland.  The pancakes weren't bad but there are a hundred better pancake places across the country (Brownstone Diner,Jersey City; Chance's,Bellevue,WA(Seattle); Delucci's,Pittsburgh; etc,etc . . . hell, even the Original Pancake House chain).  

It's clearly better than going to a Denny's but there's liitle (or nothing) that seperates this place from most other of it's ilk.  

3 stars

If you are looking for great, buttery pancakes, this is the place!  If you are concerned about the looks, smell, cleanliness... this is not the place for you.  Lucky for me, I care more about the taste of the food than the ambiance!  Best breakfast deals and variety in St. Louis!  You will not be disappointed!  The omelettes are one of the best bang ofr your buck meals... you will have lots to take home.  Enjoy!

I've always been a big fan of Uncle Billy's ever since my grandpa went here for breakfast every single day. Some of the best diner-style breakfast food; perfect for recovering after a long night. 

I would shy away from the lunch/dinner menu, as the breakfast is what they've nailed. My personal favorite: western omelet (which is huge) and pancakes (which are my all-time favorite)

A great place for great food, any time of day or night.  I'm usually here for brunch, and there's occasionally a ~10 minute wait.  There's several large dining rooms, with nice German-style decor inside.  Good service, good portions, and good prices, you can't go wrong.

Tasty food and servings big enough you won't finish. Uncle Bill's is a good place to go at 4 o'clock, am or pm. The food is better than most diner fare. This is pretty much what you'd expect from the ideal greasy spoon joint.
Great food and service, great place to come for late night or after the bars and clubs close.

I believe this place has the world's best pancakes...and most items on the menu are served with a side of pancakes. It's perfect.

I noticed some of the other reviews of Uncle Bill's made a reference to what time you should go. I recommend going at several different times of day and different days of the week. The character of the place seems to change with the clientele, which changes with the clock. At 3am Sunday morning (after most bars close) you're going to see a much different crowd from what you will see at 9am Sunday...which is even different from 6pm Thursday. Just go a bunch of times and see what you like best.

No matter when you go, the food is always delicious and served pretty quickly.

Starting with the negatives....it's overpriced and horrible service and attitude. The mandatory tipping for groups or after a certain time is probably because they know nobody would tip them for such horrid service if left to their discretion. 
Positives...the food is pretty good. The bacon is especially good...but at that price it should be!  It's open when there are not a lot of other options and certainly is a South city landmark.  
When it all balances out I would rate it right in the middle. I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to go there, but I wouldn't refuse to resort to it as a late night out on the town option.

I've lived in St. Louis all my life, and I've always wanted to check out this place based on what all of my friends and family have told me over the years. Now that I finally came here, I'm sorry to say I was completely disappointed.

Our hostess sat us without saying a word. Not a hello. Not even a hi. Just showed us the way and didn't even look back. The food was, at best, meh. I got the chicken fried steak, which was all right, but definitely not worth the price. However, the stack of pancakes that came with it were excellent. If you plan on eating here, just stick to the pancakes and you won't have an issue. 

The coffee was just your standard, run-of-the-mill diner style. Not bad, but not really good, either. For me, good or bad coffee makes or breaks a restaurant and whether I'll make the trip back or not.

*Spoiler alert* I won't be back

Uncle Bill's is a place that really *is* everything it appears to be. It's a family eating establishment that specializes in pancakes. That's about it.

As you can probably imagine, it's not a culinary juggernaut, and it's not very expensive. I've tried lots of things on their menu, but nothing really grabs me... except for their breakfast foods. Even as I think about it, I'm not exactly sure if there's anything remarkable about this place, but I somehow keep going back, almost every week.

Every week, I order the Supreme 4-D. I eat 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 sausages, 2 pieces of bacon, and some hash browns. I always feel *immensely* satisfied. It tastes wonderful. The Burgers? Not good. The chicken fried steak? Not good. BUT... the breakfast? *That's* good. You should definitely eat at Uncle Bill's.

Just make sure to get the breakfast.
This place has delicious pancakes! I would recommend to anyone for breakfast. I haven't tried anything on their lunch or dinner menu.

The biggest plus for me is that this place is open 24-hrs.  The food is not fantastic, but it's not terrible.  Obviously during late hrs, you can expect to find an "amusing" crowd (mostly the drunks on their way home), but this place does get a crowd during the wkds, so be prepared to wait during "peak hrs".

Become a regular and the staff will treat you like family, even in the latest of the night. Great service and food.

dp

It was a circular route I took to get here but I tend to roam drive until I find a restaurant that looks promising. Started at hotel at 26th and Lafayette - to Edward Jones dome area (bad mistake - there was something going on tonight (02/06/10) caught up in traffic mess - head down along Arch / Sullivan Blvd -Chouteau Avenue (100 west/route 66) - Grand Blvd - Lindell (still looking for SOMEPLACE to eat) - Kingshighway - ahh keep heading south and after crossing i-64/i-44 - there is Bill's Pancakes.

Had: veggie omelet (egg whites)/hash browns/dry wheat toast/oj/tomato juice.   Food was good and hot and restaurant pretty empty at 800p CST.  The menu had alot more food varieties then I expected and the best thing: 24 hours.

This is the worst Uncle Bills I been to. My food was horrible, tasteless, and drenched in grease. The price was ok. The bus boy person knocked over all the glasses and broke half of them and just left them on the floor where a waiter had to come sweep it up 10 minutes later. I thought they penny sign was rude if you need three pennies get a job but waiter was nice
Service was excellent. We had the pancakes and apple crepes. Yummy! I'm really picky about my pancakes. These were fluffy and buttery. The crepes were delicious. Not soggy and very flavorful.
Heaven on earth! This place is great no matter what time it is! I love all their food! Uncle Bills is great!

I've eaten at Uncle Bill's once during the day. The rest of my visits have been late night occasions.

-If you go at night or very early in the morning, watch out for vomit in the bathrooms.

-Sometimes they forget to give you things like napkins and silverware. If this happens, just take it as a sign that you are not meant to have manners at that certain time. Everyone else is doing it, so why not?

-I went there last night. Got the Chocolate Alaska, but I got the Alaska bit on the side. Alaska, if you weren't aware, is made of ice cream, chocolate sauce, and whipped cream. The other part is four pancakes. Alaska on the side is delicious, but may be stomach ache worthy in the morning. Or maybe just contributes to the hangover.

-The women's restroom actually has two tiny stalls, so don't be fooled if someone goes in there. You might actually get to pee together.

-I think they stop serving mashed potatoes at ten. Which is why there aren't five stars here. Oh, and because there's smoking allowed, so it is inevitable that you will smell like cigarettes. At least if you're a smoker they have a cigarette machine.

You're hungover, it is sunday and you can't remember really what happened last night so what do you do? Wake up the guys on your couch and floor, figure out who is the least drunk/hungover to drive and head out to Uncle Bills to see if you can remember anything that happened the night before.  

Whether the above scenario applies or if you are bringing Grandma to brunch for her birthday, Uncle Bill's has always been a great place to get some good breakfast food and converse with your company.  The pancakes are amazing and fluffy, served with a side of sweet cream butter.  Their bacon is not too crispy but not too chewy.  Their sausage has just the right amount of spice.  

While the menu does have several other offerings besides breakfast and brunch, I've always gotten breakfast here and it has always been fantastic.  Sure the place gets crowded but that is how you know it is good.  Also, they have redone their parking lot so there is a little more parking now which was a nice surprise.

The only time we come here is late at night, after everything has closed. It  reminds me of Waffle House back home in Atlanta. The 4D Supreme is the way to go for this, and the price is reasonable when you consider the amount of food that you're getting.
     I once saw the Alaskan crepe (or something like that), and I must say, that is one of the best looking desserts that I have feasted my eyes upon. I'm definitely going to try that that next time I head over there. 
     Great for large parties and very accommodating. Friendly staff and a very unique atmosphere. It's good ol' fashioned cooking.

You know a place is an institution when you can bond with complete strangers by reminiscing about each of your memorable, wonderful experiences inhaling breakfast food at said establishment. I've bonded with so many people over Uncle Bill's. No matter what stage of my life - late night post-drinking feasts in college; breakfast-for-dinner with my new husband; sun-up cabin fever escape with the kids - Uncle Bill's has always been there for me. Thanks for delivering the biscuits and eggs over easy I've always needed.

The food well what can say it was big and also tastey!!! Would I recommend it to a friend well you know that the answer is a "YES".  First I had panckes and they were good also big.  Then I had a hamburger also but the thing was it had no bun but that is how it come because it is breakfast hamburger combonition.  Well anyway it was so good and also nice!  The service well what can I say because it was good?  Yes!  Thanks Bill you are so good!!!

I suppose when you roll into this place during the night, your really not looking at the decor, neighborhood, or anything at all. The food, while plentiful and the pancackes are delicious.... the place itself is lacking. Once, when we went in it took the waitress 15 min to come even say hi. (this was NOT on a busy night at all). Regardless of that i do like their pancackes and they have some tasty omelettes.

Although not a place I would take my boyfriend's parents to impress, Uncle Bill's provides friendly, no-nonsense service and low prices. They are flexible with changing the menu to suit your personal wants (can I sub fries for my hash browns? And biscuits and gravy instead of toast?  Yes?! I love you.) and they turn and burn till the wee hours of the night. They are cheap, have weird decor, and the same food as Ihop, so why not!

They have horrible customer service....when making a To go order your left on hold for upward of 20 minute while they go get a waitress...today I called to place an order and was placed on hold, I had to hang up and call back because of the wait time was longer than usual.  Upon calling back I could hear the hostess and waitress making snide remarks about me hanging up and calling back...at this point I had already wasted my time on hold and driven to the restaurant.  when I got there and asked for the manager she was not available...this is the last time I waste my money on piss poor service.

Uncle Bill's Pancakes & Dinner House Quick Review. (First time eating here)

I am very picky when it comes to eating breakfast, lunch and dinner. I always drive by Uncle Bill's Pancake & Dinner House and never adventure to go in. I decided to give them a try. Let me start by saying that their breakfast game was on point. I had the Supreme2, 2 eggs (cooked just right), 2 pancakes (best pancakes I haven't had for awhile), 2 bacon strips (their bacon game was on point, crispy just the way I like it), hash brown (we're golden), 2 sausages (not the best but not the worst either). I also had a cup of coffee (the refills were amazing). The service overall was GREAT for my first time been here, returning customer for sure.
Never disappointed. The pancakes are amazing. Service is great. Food comes out hot and fresh. Love this place.

I texted my friend to tell him I was at Uncle Bill's and he texted back: "Cool. It's tacky in all the right ways." 

I would agree -- especially with their faux English Tudor-esque architecture. It's kitschy and a bit run-down but comforting. 

Food-wise, the breakfast is solid - fine eggs, hash browns, but I've had better biscuits. There wasn't enough fluff to them. I also thought it was a bit overpriced at $10 including tip.

I want to give at least three stars but there was a visible hair in my friend's hash browns. At least the waitress was nice and took it back immediately, very apologetic.

Went here with a couple friends. It's your typical diner food. There were three of us at the table and we all shared with each other. Biscuits and gravy were the star for me. Biscuits were nice and fluffy, and everything melted in your mouth. French toast was delicious, but I think mostly because it was smothered in sweet whipped butter. Everything else was tasty, but just basic. Could've been a little cheaper. Maybe courtesy diner next time.

Ohhhhhh Uncle Bills, words can not express how much I love you . Whether I come stumbling in after a long night of a drunkenness or coming in for a quickie on my lunch break, you are always amazing. Coffee? Yes, please! Chicken Strips with Honey Mustard? Of, course. 

What I love about this place is that when my friends want breakfast and I still want dinner, we never have to compromise. Also, the service-it's amazing. Forget City Diner or Jack in the Box, it's all about Uncle Bills.

Hands down best pancakes I have ever had in my life. Basic breakfast staples are done very well- crunchy hash browns, salty bacon, and perfect eggs. All for a reasonable price!!!!

One of my favorite things to order is the fried chicken breakfast meal. The fried chicken is SO GOOD.

Also, it is open 24/7 so that I can get pancakes at any time of the night. Keep in mind though, that this is a basic diner. So if you're looking for fancy brunch food, this isn't the place.

I had the Corned Beef Hash, which I really enjoy, except that this version looked and tasted like it was out of a can. If I had wanted that I would've stayed home. I don't think I'll be back. Everything else was fine, but this restaurant will not be my first choice of places to eat.

Me and 2 of my friends went here for breakfast Sunday. The food was really good, I had pancakes and one of my friends had chicken strips he said they were good. I like that the entire menu is available all day. The atmosphere was a little depressing and the service wasn't great. The food and prices were worth it, I'd go back.

I go to Uncle Bill's sober. That's right, you heard me.

I always see IHOP ads and get a serious pancake craving and am driven into the arms of their local competition, Uncle Bill's. I get exactly what I came for: a diner-style breakfast of gargantuan proportions (as if the name '2X2X2X2' didn't give you enough of an idea already). The eggs are cooked like I want them, the hashbrowns are great, the pancakes are good. Go ahead and get those biscuits & gravy, too. Want a slinger? OK. Ran out of plate room on your table? It happens.

What I like about Uncle Bill's is that it looks like it hasn't been renovated since 1962. It's dark and cozy inside, just perfect for tucking away into a booth and carb-loading until your heart's content. It also smells like coffee and cigarettes. The run-down, tiny (I mean, like, Harry Potter-Cupboard-Under-the-Stairs tiny) bathroom is kinda gross and dubious, but isn't that what you expect in a place like this?

Uncle Bill's gets a few more points for their efficient and sassy service. A recently overheard conversation: 

"I want a ribeye, cooked really tender, like, medium..."
*Waitress cuts guy off* "You need to go to a steakhouse then."

A St. Louis institution. There's always a story attached to a visit to Uncle Bill's. Good times.

End of an Era.

I went to Uncle Bills after the bars closed in 1966, it hasn't changed, who cares about the food this place should be in the history books.  Long gone is the Tack Room at the Chase, enjoy it while you can.
Dwaine San Francisco, Ca

This is a place you go after the bar, not so much a place for lunch. I have been to the one on Manchester, but never the original. When you walk in you can tell it's been there awhile, with the old style wood paneling and the smell of grease in the air. They took the order fairly quickly but we sat there from a good 40 min before we got our food. Eggs and pancakes are pretty easy to make, so I have no idea what took so long. The food was as good as what is expected when you go to a place like that. It met my expectations, just the wait was a bit long. 

I filled the craving of breakfast that I was having, so it served it's purpose.

Terrible service and worse food. If you want to get raped on prices go on down to Bill's. The food was cold coming out but our waitress was not available to send it back. They couldn't explain why our bill was $10 higher than it should be. We won't be back. How many people do you overcharge daily?

Well Uncle Bill's has been around for spell and I have enjoyed it every time I went the food is tasty the services are nice the menu and prices are fair and the atmosphere is clean and relaxing. It's kid and family friendly so go give them a try and see what you think.Yes I recommend Uncle Bill's Pancake and Dinner.

This St. Louis landmark was on our bucket list after recently moving to the area. Uncle Bill's is a no-frills breakfast joint that had all of your staple breakfast foods. Quick and fast service -- the kind where you can feel at times rushed and not at all waited on with patience. However, the pancakes were good and our waitress was still nice. We were in and out with full bellies. 

It's not expensive, but it's not necessarily cheap either. While the food was pretty good, I do know that I could get better quality breakfast food for the same price elsewhere.

I love Uncle Bills. I've been going here for weekend breakfast since I moved to St. Louis. 

They have easily the best pancakes I've ever tasted: fluffy center, golden-brown, crispy shell, buttery taste. And they're consistently that quality, which is huge. Mouth-watering just to think about. I personally go with a short stack,  b&g's, bacon, hash, and eggs. Granted, I don't eat for 3 days after a visit, but it's totally worth it.  

Only complaint: going Sunday mornings and some Saturdays can be a pain due to crowds and waits. I've waited 25-35 mins for seating on occasion. That being said, usually the wait, if any, is under 5 mins.
Whoa, this place has the right environment and delicious food! Portions are great for this big water. Pancakes were perfect and the surprise were the buttery potato hash browns - boom!
Food is amazing and our waitress Shellia was excellent. Supreme 2x2x2x2 was great - come hungry!

This is another post-drunk/beginning stages of a hangover hot spot in the St. Louis area. I don't recall ever venturing too far from the breakfast menu. The omelets are flippin' huge! It's relatively inexpensive considering the amount of food they serve up. The service is questionable depending on the volume of patrons at any given time. When it's moderately busy and/or they are short staffed, the service suffers immensely. When it is slower...obviously the service is more prompt. The only beef is that I feel like I'm going to hack up a lung after I eat there. The ventilation system isn't the best, and the smoking section is right next door to the non-smoking section with no protective barrier. I'm fine with smoking as long as ventilation is in full effect.  Either way - it's a nice place to fill up that tank then go take a long nap and sleep it off.

Someone else already said it:  what a dump!! Worst dining experience ever in St. Louis; musty smell, sticky seats, over-priced menu, week-old lettuce on cold hamburger bun with one thinly sliced tomato and grilled chicken breast, and cole slaw that made me ill.  A guy with a really rank smelling mop came by even while we were eating to wipe the floor(ugh). And if that wasn't enough, we had to listen to our waitress verbally abuse a customer when he discovered she had made a mistake on his order! A real nightmare of a diner.
I ate a country fried steak here that could be cut with a fork..The service is polite and the food is awesome....

The decor is very outdated but not in a good way. I have eaten there a total of three times and I will never eat there again. The food was just ok the first two times but it was late which is why I agreed to go. The last time I went I got very sick the next day!!!! Here is the biggie the person I went with went to the restroom and saw one of the cooks use the bathroom and not wash his hands. YUCK!!!

I have been coming here since I was born, I loooove this place. They are open 24 hours, and there always seems to be a parking spot open no matter the time of day. They have a pretty large diner menu that is also your placemat. The staff is very nice and they are pretty fast. 

Food I've tried that I love:
The chili dog with fries
Diced ham n eggs (my mom has gotten this everytime for 30+ years, trust us, it's the bomb.com)
Cube steak with baked potato 
Apple sauce
Ice cream sundae
Cheeseburger with fries
Pancakes
Baked Alaska 
Cheesecake

This place is great, I was going to write up a pros n cons but I can't really think of many cons.. We love uncle bills.
Great place to detox after you've had your drink on. Waitresses don't take no guff and the biscuits and gravy are yummy. Avoid Sunday mornings after 8am.

Humm. Can you say glorified greasy spoon. I will just say if you are looking for mediocrity this place is it. The food is always so so. I do really enjoy their pecan pancakes but that is about the only reason I would recommend going here. That and they do have a pretty quick turnover of customers so while the other, more trendy restaurants are packed you can usually get in the door here. Service is usually pretty good, not the best, but it is quick and they will be all over your coffee refills.

If you like a greasy-spoon diner, this is the place to go. No, it's not the most modern of interiors... in fact, it hasn't been updated since about 1970... but the food is great and with fair prices. It's especially a good place to go the morning after a Cards/Blues game, when you maybe had one beer too many that night before.
I used to come here a lot back in the 90's.  Solid late night diner food and good people watching after a night of drinks.  I'd recommend the pancakes, waffles, and hash browns.

I'm not going to get into too much detail here.  I'm not proud I ate here at 330am...  But damn that was great chicken & waffles.  Listen... it happens... you find yourself out past your bedtime and you're 30, single, had a few drinks and now you're starving.  This is where Uncle Bill steps in and lends you a helping hand and solves all the world's problems albeit for just a little while.  I gotta give 4 stars for a place that serves any kind of decent food at 330am no matter how bad the service is or how long the food took.  SO WHAT I waited an hour for Chicken and Waffles... It was 330 in the !#$% morning!  I don't care, I'll be back... and Uncle Bill will be there... like a trusted friend.

Want a different involvement other than Denny's.  Uncle Bill's has that home feeling.  The pancakes loom like you made them at home, eggs cooked to perfection, bacon or sausage a little over cooked.  But food tasted deliciously.  Nothing fancy.  Waitresses were freindly.

This is the greatest place for any hour of any night or day. It sucks that they add on gratuity during the night shifts -- but I guess it was necessary for the staff. I'm glad they're open 7 days now! The bacon here is insane and the maple syrup isn't that cheap watery crap. It's the real deal. The portions are all huge and everything is good. Every single darned thing is good. Even the coffee is good. I HIGHLY recommend this spot. MUCH better than Courtesy Diner. I saw another review about the crappy and outdated decor -- and that is true -- but I think it makes the place seem charming. Especially the front room with all the wood, and the back wall made of stones. Honestly though, the food is so good I wouldn't care if it was just a dirty haystack.

Uncle Bill's is your standard greasy plate 24-hour breakfast place. They have your standard American breakfast plates with eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, etc. they also have some sweeter options for breakfast like the crepes and French toast.

I ordered the Uncle Bill skillet (for me) and the Pee-Chee crepes (to split with the table for breakfast dessert). The skillet is pretty good and very filling with a variety of veggies, ham, and cheese scrambled into the eggs. The crepes are decent but nothing to rave about.

I have to give Uncle Bill's 4 stars, based on nostalgia alone. 

I can't tell you how many nights me and my friends hit up Uncle Bill's after a night of late night partying at SLU. Oh, college...I miss you so. Now that I'm older (and wiser?), my partying days are far behind me, so there will be no Uncle Bill's trips in my future. However, I can still reminisce, right? 

I can tell you a few tips to make your Uncle Bill's trip a pleasant one:

1. NEVER come here sober. Just don't do it. Things that would normally bother sober!Stephanie (dirty carpets, smoky interior, sticky chairs) don't bother drunk!Stephanie. 

2. Order the pancakes, bacon, and hash browns. When you're hammered, nothing tastes better than buttermilk pancakes drowning in butter and syrup. NOTHING. 

I wish I could speak on the service and/or prices, but every time I've visited here, details like that seem like a blur. Really, the only proof that I ever visited Uncle Bills lies in the inevitable stomachache I have the next morning from all of the grease. 

And I kinda like it that way.

They have great food! Come here if you want a cheap, home cooked meal like grandma used to make:)
P.S Also try the breakfast skillet!!!

Went for breakfast on a Sunday, business was very busy. Service was a little slow to take our order, but like I said it was incredibly busy. Overall wait staff was courteous and friendly, plus they made sure my coffee cup didn't even hit the half way point. Pancakes were delicious and had the ability to soak up a cup of syrup, perfect ! Would definitely recommend this establishment.

How can you stay away from Uncle Bill's Pancake House.  I can't and I'm glad to say I had a much better experience than the last time. We got there early on a Sunday but still had to wait in line. Luckily the line moves at a fairly good pace. 

Annie took care of us again this time. I ordered my usual. Eggs with corned beef hash. It comes with a side of hash brown potatoes and toast or biscuit. I was thrilled when my order came out and everything looked delicious. It also tasted delicious. 

Would I come back here?  Yes, I'll see you on the flip side.

Excellent pancakes and REAL breakfast food (I'm looking at you IHOP). It is good food without being heavy.

The service is generally good but patience is required during busy times. Seating can be a bit cramped at times and it isn't the cleanest establishment - but it doesn't feel dirty.

Also, be prepared to experience a wide range of patrons, especially later at night.

The food isn't the best and Uncle Bill's looks like it hasn't changed in the last thirty years.  But I guess that's what gives it the charm. What I really like about this place is that it's open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week - generally a great go to if you're a college student and need some food or coffee at an awkward hour.  If you are unlucky enough to find yourself here during reading week or finals (and you're not a student), you'll probably not get the best experience.  If you're a student, you'll definitely see a handful of classmates, probably also studying for the same exam as you are.

 A group of us decided to stop by on a late evening.  We were seated quickly and the place looked fairly empty.  Our server was really sweet and took great care of us!  She recommended the veggie omelet.  When it came out, I was shocked by how huge it was. Plus, it was served with three buttermilk pancakes.  Geez! The omelet was okay.  Note to self for future: order it easy on the cheese. And the pancakes were delicious.  I definitely had enough food to take home for breakfast and lunch the next day.

Like Aimee mentioned, I would reserve my trips here for late night (or early early morning - depends on how you look at it) runs.

I've heard good things about this place so I decided to try it out and was very disappointed. The inside was pretty cool and we were excited to be seated, but everything went downhill from there. The service was really bad and slow, and she NEVER filled our drinks. The food was so expensive and decidedly mediocre and both me and my friend felt really sick for hours afterwards. Go to courtesy diner- so much more worth it.

This resteraunt is simply beautiful. From the service to the delicious food, it is a wonderful place for a family meal. This is definitely one of my favorite restaurant. I would definitely visit here if you live here or are from out of town.

So many people in St. Louis say, something along the tune of "I only go to Uncle Bills if I am drunk".  Not me however, oh I will go there when I am drunk, or hungover or stone sober.  I honestly enjoy the food out here.  I think it is a pretty solid place to get breakfast, or even a burger or the various other items on the menu.  

The omelettes out here are some of the fluffiest around, a great taste.  The pancakes are always very well made, the hickory bacon is delicious, and the coffee is not too bad.  I have had a burger at Uncle Bills once, and it was okay, but the breakfast food is definitely the best thing there.  

The service has always been very good every time I have been in there.  Yeah the place is old, and is very drab and plain looking, but so what.  It is an old time breakfast place, just a simple place to get some good food.  

So check it out anytime of the day,  you may just see me in there enjoying a late breakfast at 10:30 AM.
It was what I expected from this dinerisque restaurant.  The food, pancakes and omelette were ok and I liked the fact the pancake were not thick but crepe like.  Service was friendly

First time here. We were craving breakfast in the afternoon. After parking, we noticed 2 cooks outside smoking. The door for the kitchen is a few feet from the entrance. We are both smokers ourselves, but still, I dont want to see you smoking. Eh. Not a huge deal. 

Inside is very....old. definitely could use a remodel and facelift! I get that it's a popular old joint. But it had a smell and many eyesores. 

Our server was so so. Cant remember her name. But she wasnt super friendly like I would expect at this sort of place...

The food is what saved it! I got the 2x2x2x2 supreme. 2 eggs, two sausage links, 2 bacon slices, 2 pancakes and hasbrowns! Pancakes and sausage were my favorites! I also got the "large" grapefruit juice. It was a very small for a large. Oh well. Hubster got eggs, sausage, and hasbrowns. It came with your choice of like 2 biscuits, 3 pancakes or toast (they dont mess around with portions!)  He got biscuits and added sausage gravy. The gravy is one of the best we have tasted in a long time! The bill came to about 40 bucks with tip. A bit pricy for diner quality food but it was at least delicious!

We wont go out of our way to go back but would probably stop in if we were in the area.

Way overpriced for the quality of food and service. Probably the worst coffee I've had in my life, unfriendly waiter, spent 30 bucks on a cup of coffee, a fruit crepe, a bagel, and an order of hashbrowns....Which all tasted bland and lifeless mind you. Skip uncle bills and go to courtesy diner down the road!

rude, slow, roachs on the walls, 
mandatory tip, it has been bad everytime there. i no longer go there.  if i want pancakes, i will go to Dennys .

Eh.  It's a dingy old grandma's house breakfast place.  It's supposed to be home sweet home style cooking.  The parking lot is always full and the place seems to be hopping but I was not impressed.

The inside is dark and dingy - I get the look you're going for, but, come on clean it up a little!  You can be "grandma-y" and still clean and nice.  

I couldn't decide what I wanted.  I went with the Belgium Waffle - my go to at any breakfast place as I'm not a big fan of pancakes.  The waffle was disappointing.  I-Hops is better!  I'm not sure what they put in the batter, maybe a little too much buttermilk because that thing sure was TANGY.  Who the heck makes a tangy Belgium Waffle?!?!??!? umm GROSS :(  I don't like maple syrup - I know gasp, shoot me.  Instead I coat my waffles (and pancakes) in butter because I'm a butter freak!  But, the butter wasn't even enough to mask the oddly tangy batter.  

The saving grace was the place isn't too pricey.  Kevin liked his meal.  The bacon was nice and thick and pretty good.  Would I come back?  Meh, only if Kevin wanted to because quite frankly I was not impressed one single bit.

Uncle Bill is always where I go when I'm craving some simple just good eggs, bacon and super fully fresh pancakes. It's like walking into a time machine lol not much has changed in that building, but it's good hot and easy stop. Lunch or breakfast. Plus they do to go.

rate based on late late night experience- 
not exactly my idea of a nice brunch spot and eating here will probably take a year off of your life...but awesome for late night post bar munchies. i was surprised by how many people were there at 4am. our waiter alex was great and fully in control of our large party of 15 keeping our coffee cups filled to the brim. the portions are large. i got the corned beef hash scramble. it was sinfully delicious.

I love this place because it's been around for a long time, and you can feel that history when you're there. They have pretty good diner-type food, and exceptional pancakes. This is a great place to go if you're looking to have a more"traditional" breakfast amongst the locals.

This place is gross. The food is hit and miss. When the pancakes are good they're great, when not they're terrible, as is everything else I've ever tried on the menu. I'm not even going to get ino any other aspects of this restaurant. If you'd have to ask why I'm giving it one star, you'd never 'get it' anyway....

And I like diners, even some dirty ones....but not this one.

I need more greasy diner food in my life.  Well, most of the food I would be able to pass over... but as far as breakfast foods go, I need more greasy diner food in my life.  I have been on the bad side of "You have never been to Uncle Bills?" for a few years now.  I guess now that I have been, I can turn around and use this on other people.

Unfortunately my first visit was not one where I was completely drunk... because I understand in general that is the time to go.  But here's hoping for next time.  This time was just breakfast.  It was the best option for a Saturday morning after a long Friday night out.  

There was a bit of a wait when we walked in the door, which I assumed was normal, but I didn't really understand the line part.  Everyone waits in a line that is marked off by a little barrier to separate the entrance and the exit areas.  I can't tell if there is usually a line, and the line was not very long, but it was there.  We waited about ten minutes for a table.  This was totally reasonable.  But then it seemed like we were waiting at the table for quite a while before a waitress came over.  Or really before anyone brought coffee, which is a critical play in a situation like this.

As for ordering, the name of the place has the word "pancake" in it, so that is what I went for.  I was between blueberry and buckwheat, which I think is a generally overlooked and underrated pancake choice.  I went with the buckwheat, and it was a good choice.  The blueberry got knocked off the list because of the compote, which means probably no blueberries in the pancakes, but maybe a solid try for next time.  My breakfast eating counterpart got the pecan, which I will admit here, but never to his face, that I was pretty jealous of when they came out because they smelled absolutely amazing.  Also on the short list of choices for next time.  

Once the coffee started coming, the staff kept the cups pretty full, which is good because the only thing that knocks down my reviews of breakfast places more than an empty coffee cup is nothing.  Full, in fact, I like it when they have a roaming robot with a carafe filling the cups.  Ok, that has never happened, but it is a solid idea.  The staff here was as remarkably close to those robots as I have ever seen, and I loved it.  

As for asthetics, you can't really get better than wood paneling and carpet that looks like it has been there since 1961 when the place opened.  The big question that I have is: Is there just this one carpet company that is supplying old timey restaurants with new carpet to make it look like the carpet has never been changed?  Because even if you are open for 24 hours/7 days, for 50 years, that carpet has been changed at least every ten years.  I need the number for this carpet company.  The panelling I am certain is original.

Now that I have been, I am pretty sure I am going to have to go back.  I love breakfast.  I am going to have to walk my way through most of the breakfast menu.  I will be sure to keep you posted Yelp.

We went in on Black Friday about noon, the wait wasn't too long.  But the place was packed.  Our waitress was fantastic, you could tell she was a pro.  Always on her game and from old school days.  Loved it.  The portions were huge. Sure wish I would have gotten the omelet, but went with the chicken fried steak, eggs over medium, hashbrowns, and pancakes.  Delicious.  My boyfriend got the Supreme 2x2x2x2 and he loved it.  The coffee was good too.
Uncle Bill's has great food - especially their thick-sliced bacon - but what really makes them great is the decor that is perpetually stuck somewhere between the 1950s and 1980s.

Pros: Amazing pancakes unlike any others in STL. Fast service even for large groups. Lots of seating. 24 hours. Free wifi.

Cons: Anything besides the pancakes is not worth ordering. Service abrasive and not hospitable.

Went on a Saturday morning at 10:30am. Crowded but no wait to sit down. We were served quickly and efficiently with no nonsense... Somewhat abrasive. The buttermilk pancakes and blueberry pancakes were AMAZING, but nothing else was remarkable. Definitely below-average diner except for the pancakes.

Overall, if you have a craving for pancakes, this is the spot to get them. Otherwise, take your diner business somewhere else.

I don't even know. It was late and after a much needed Mardi Gras nap, I wanted breakfast for dinner. The greatest of meal agendas. 

It wasn't busy so I figured a quick in and out bite would be the bargain to get my boyfriend to eat here (who was already freaked out by the hostess and tired looking interior). I scoped this place out beforehand and most people seemed to really be into it. 

For being a rough 3/8ths full as it was, service was s-l-o-w. I would hate to see this place busy if it's anything like my visit. Food was verging on a half hour wait by the time it arrived on our table. The drinking glasses are for children. I would be surprised if they actually held eight ounces of water. Don't expect refills on a frequent basis, sip slow friend. Food was decent, not the best or worst I've had. Eggs, corned beef hash, sausage, hash browns, AND PANCAKES!

On the other hand, the pancakes were perfect. Little fluff monsters slathered in butter and suffocated in syrup. I was so much of a little gremlin, I stole some of my boyfriend's pecan pancakes.

WOW!! Great pancakes and great service. This was our first visit but won't be our last! The bacon was thick and chewy and the link sausage was zippy and perfectly cooked. I can't wait to sample some other menu items--and since I keep odd hours, the 24/7 hours works for me!!

As Bette Davis said in Beyond The Forest, "What a dump." However, in the case of Uncle Bill's, it gives character. I can honestly tell you that UB has not been remodeled or redecorated since I moved to STL in 1979 and that is part of its charm and ambiance. To be honest, it had been at least 8 years since my last visit to UB's and when I walked in for my recent breakfast it was as if things had never changed. That was because they hadn't.

We were quickly seated, which surprised me since it was a Sunday and around 9:00AM. I guess everyone was either at church or sleeping in. The restaurant was still very full and the tables are cramped very close together. Keeping the closeness in mind, you may want to keep that in mind when picking your subject of conversation. The lady next to us was telling her friend about her son in prison. I had to bite my tongue, I so bad wanted to ask her if her son had a bitch or if he was one of the other inmates bitch. 

Our waitress was very attentive, made sure we quickly had our morning coffee. She also had a good sense of humor, she chuckled when I asked if there were any off the menu specials. Since they had no specials we went with the Country Fried Steak and the 2 Pork Chop Breakfast. Both came with two eggs and hash browns on the side. In addition to these hearty breakfasts, we shared an order of biscuits and gravy. 

The Country Fried Steak was very good, a nice big piece of tender beef breaded and covered in flavorful milk gravy. The pork chops were not as good, they were a thin cut and overly cooked making them dry and tough. I was hoping for a thick, juicy chop. Our eggs were  cooked over easy and done well, as were the hash browns. They're not your traditional hash browns, but are more an American Fries.

The star of the breakfast was the hearty serving of biscuits and gravy. We got two huge flaky biscuits covered in milk gravy filled with pieces of sausage. Next time I need a comfort breakfast, I may just come here and order Biscuits & Gravy with a side of hash browns.
The service we received was great but the food was only decent. It was warm and had a decent flavor but nothing out of the orinary and we never had the feeling that we 'had to come back for more'.

As a resident of South City, an Uncle Bill's visit is a must at some point. My brother and both of our significant others decided to try it out after a Blues game one night a couple of months ago. The first thing I noticed was the cloud of smoke that enveloped our party as I opened the door. Normally, that would be enough for me to turn around, but I wanted to give Uncle Bills a chance. When we were seated, I asked to be seated in the non-smoking section. I was notified rather bluntly that the booth was in fact in the non-smoking section, even though we were 5 feet away from a woman lighting up. At this point, we all reeked anyway so we decided to order. The silverware was dirty and our waitress had a few teeth missing. I decided to chalk this up as one of those "adventures" that we could remember for a while. The food was okay, nothing out of the ordinary. I was concerned about the cleanliness of the staff and the building itself. I don't think I'll be going here again unless I've had a few drinks.

By far the best pancakes I've ever had at a restaurant.  Food is always hot and delicious, a little pricey for their sides and drinks, considering the size of the glass they give you and call it a "large".  Still worth every penny though :D

Uncle Bill's is your standard 24-hour American diner, complete with a dark, dingy decor circa 1970 and permanent musty smell emanating from the carpets and walls.

Catering to the masses at all hours of the day, silver-haired waitresses dole out inexpensive, heaping piles of pancakes, eggs, and bacon while keeping your coffee cup full. The dishes haven't changed much, as evidenced by the 1960s-era menu displayed near the front door.

The kitschy-named Panama pancakes, probably one of the healthier selections, come stacked three high with banana slices baked right in.

There was a guy in a Batman costume the first time I walked in here at midnight on a Saturday which kind of sums this place up fairly well. It has this universal appeal that I can't explain. The food was really good, and my experience was really enjoyable. I'll be back.

This place reminds me of 1975 and it has the decor to match it. The food is great and it's a real greasy spoon diner that I'm quite fond of. Prices are reasonable and they add a 15% gratuity on the midnight shift I guess to deal with the drunks. But this place has the most awesome food.

I have never been here during the day and I wouldn't even think about doing that!  This is the best place to go after the bars close and you realize just how good pancakes would taste at 3 in the morning...and they do...

The service isn't great but at that time of day, and with as annoying as all the drunk people are, I'm not sure that I would be either.  But that's almost better for me in that state anyway.  Take my order, give me my food, and leave me alone to try to keep the room from spinning, please.  Always get the coffee.  It doesn't sober you up any quicker but does make you feel more awake.

And for future reference, Uncle Bill's is just as good at 5am as it is at 3am when you wake up from passing out on your friend's couch and realize that you're too hungry to wait for a proper hour for breakfast.

Uncle Bill, whoever you are, a heartfelt thank you from all of us who have capped off a wonderful evening with you!
Awesome waffle with ice cream, awesome fried spring chicken!! A great place to go after clubbing even if there might be a line to get in. This diner is Da BOMB....

Love Love Love the pecan pancakes here.  Do not like the buscuits and gravy. 

The rest of the reveiws will tell you that the place is a dive...and it is.  It's dark inside...and may have been nice in it's prime....40 years ago.  But against today's standards the decor is ancient and unless you are in a small town somewhere.  But...maybe that's part of the charm.  

Overall, I like going to this place.  The food is good, the people watching is even better.  It's reasonably priced in my opinion.  And now that I convinced a friend after has past negative experience to give it another try, I think I've converted him.  :)  

(FYI....people have tried to convince me that another pancake house very close is better, and I've had both....I think Uncle Bill's is better myself.)

I really don't know what the big to do about this place is, hubby and I had breakfast here the other day and it was mediocre at best. The pancakes fall apart when you add the syrup, the biscuits are dry and not great. The drinks come in these little child size glasses as you're expected to pay $2 for it!! The best part was the thick slice bacon. The prices aren't terribly bad but for the same price or less you can go to Waffle House or Bob Evans and leave a lot happier! Needless to say we won't be back!!

I adore this place. It's so unabashedly unfancy. It toes the edge on "dive" in the most perfectly awesome way. I really think an update on decor and furnishings would make Uncle Bill's lose half its charm. I've only ever gone during the day or early evening, but I'm certain the people-watching in the wee hours is most spectacular.

There is nothing better than Uncle Bill's pancakes. They're rich, fluffy, spongy, and they soak up butter and syrup without completely surrendering their cakey goodness. The bacon is always crisp, the eggs always arrive flawlessly over-medium (runny whites bum me out, but solid yolk is even sadder), and the hashbrowns are the perfect balance of crispy and tender.

My husband loves the chicken-fried steak, and I always steal a bite of his because I'm too loyal to the 2x2x2x2 to stray. (It's fabulous and just as hedonistic as a diner-style chicken-fried steak smothered in gravy ought to be.) The coffee is mediocre at best, but it's certainly drinkable and plentiful and it gets the job done. 

Service at Uncle Bill's has ranged from delightfully surly but attentive to friendly to slightly indifferent. The prices are more than reasonable. I think most people would end up paying more at a chain breakfast restaurant, and the food wouldn't be nearly as good. Go! Eat pancakes! Huzzah!

How can you miss the mark on coffee and eggs? I ordered scramble eggs but, got fried. The coffee was...blah. No flavor at all. Of course, I had high expectations for the pancakes and UB certainly delivered! 

Their hours are very convenient 24/7.

My wife and I visited Uncle Bill's for brunch on a Monday before flying out of town.

PARKING - As we approached the parking lot looked full but we managed to drive right into an open spot without hunting.

SEATING - We were greeted and seated as soon as we entered the establishment, no waiting.

SPEED - A friendly waitress visited us almost immediately and took out orders, the coffee was fresh :-)

MENU - There was such a wide variety it was almost hard to choose.  I ordered eggs, bacon, hash browns and pancakes but my wife doesn't eat pork so she ordered the turkey sausage with eggs.  I'd love to come back for dinner the next time we are in town. 

ORDER ACCURACY - Our orders were 100% accurate! 

THE FOOD - At our hotel buffet the hash browns served were pale and unappealing, they were under-cooked; Not at Uncle Bill's, their hash browns were perfectly browned, crunchy and delicious!


OVERALL - Our visit couldn't have been better, I give it two thumbs up!
