We were seated immediately and asked for our drink orders. After ordering a water, the waitress informed me that they were out of ice and out of plantains, two important staples in a Dominican restaurant. (Strike One) 

When the waitress returned and I ordered the pollo Guisado (stewed chicken), the waitress hesitated as if she was unsure if they had that in the kitchen. After jokingly laughing and saying, "don't tell me you don't have chicken either!?" She ran back to the kitchen and confirmed they did in fact have chicken. (Strike 1.5) 

The food comes out, and looks delish! (Ok, I'll take back a half a strike!) but then the waitress disappears for about ten minutes without giving us napkins, forks or knives. (Back to 1.5 Strikes) there also was no salt or pepper on the table. 

Finally dig into the food. The flavor was delicious. The meat was tender and flavorful and the rice and beans was the perfect compliment. Even despite not having the staple plantains it really was a delicious meal! 

Overall, If you want good food and are willing to sacrifice for terrible customer service, this is your place. I would normally rate this experience at a 3, but I've taken one star off for the waitress, who made several comments in regards to not having items - "I just work here, hunny!" I plan to spend my money at places who at the very least take responsibility for not delivering on the products outlined in their menu. May the plantains be with you if you do go!

I stopped in here a few weeks ago as I drive down Pennsylvania Street often, and noticed there was a newly opened restaurant.  

I tried 2 Chicken and 1 Cheese Empanada w/ Rosemary fries. As I am an Empanada addict, I was really excited to try theirs, but disappointed at the same time that they didn't have Beef Empanadas on the menu. 

The Cheese Empanada was good, but I couldn't bare the taste of the one with chicken. It had a weird sour taste that just didn't agree with my palate. I wasn't too enthused by the dipping sauce that came with them either. It was more of a creamy mayo based sauce, and I would have preferred a tomato sauce. I did absolutely love the buttery flaky dough on the empanadas though! The fries were just... well... fries. Nothing spectacular. Didn't even taste the Rosemary. 

If I visit again, I'll try something else instead.

I tried this place out for taco Tuesday. It is in a weird location so I never really noticed them, but I am glad that I decided to visit. 

I had the pork, chicken, and the plantain tacos. The pork Taco was my favorite. The meat was very tender and I liked that it had a hint of ginger. The plantain taco would be a hit with vegetarian patrons. It's filling and very sweet. I was not a fan of the chicken taco though. It's like chicken salad on a tortilla. I appreciate their spin on it, but I will not have it again. 

The restaurant was not busy, so I expected to have pretty quick service. The kitchen was very slow in getting out the order and that was very disappointing. The server on the other hand checked on us frequently. I could tell that she was concerned that we didn't get our food in a timely manner. I would like to go back and try their other dishes, but they need to step their game up.

Excellent food and a very friendly staff. I brought my wife and son and we all enjoyed our meal. I would highly recommend this place to someone wanting something different. It was my first time eating Dominican, but it was a pleasure.
They have a great menu with lots of choices. The food is always delicious and the staff is very friendly. I've been here for lunch several times now and will probably be back even more.

I REALLY enjoyed my food here. Everything I tasted was a solid 4 stars. However, the service was not great and the ambiance left a lot to be desired. My date ordered the sausage entree with plantains and it came out with about 10 very little sausage "nuggets" and 6 plantain chips. There was just almost no food on his plate and not worth the entree price for such little food. We literally stopped to get him a second dinner elsewhere after. My entree (chicken stew) was fabulous, though came out without beans or avocado (I had added avocado). I asked about the beans and avocado and server/chef brought them out, but gave them to the person across from me. Very strange. If my date had more food on his plate and if my food had come with everything it was supposed to, it would be 4 stars. We had the place to ourselves on a Friday night. I really hope we just caught the server/chef on an "off" night because the food was really good. I would give it a second chance and hope for better service and that everything comes as ordered, the food really is good and I would like to see the business do well.

Had no idea what I was walking into.  Oso's Republic is a Dominican restaurant with an American twist.  I got the Cubano, and my lady got the tacos.  I'm not exaggerating when I say the pork was the most tender, well seasoned pork I've ever eaten.   Coupled with the red cabbage, cilantro, and avocado, those tacos were absolutely delicious.   The Cubano had on it delicious persian pickles that really complimented the chunks of pork. The American twist? Came with delicious French fries sprinkled with light cheese and a sided with a tasty aoli.

Oh my, the flan dessert just now arrived and it looks like a work of art. 

Do yourself a favor and come check out oso's for lunch.

Ordered some lunch to go. The front staff is awesome. Very friendly and inviting. Really like the openess of the room. super clean environment. I purchased the chicken street tacos with rice and beans. The ingredients are very fresh. The tacos had so many wonderful flavors without being over powering. I will definitely be going back.

We love Oso's! We eat here all the time and have yet to have a dish we didn't enjoy :) Staff is great and the food is amazing...and you can't beat the prices! One of the best kept secrets... and best chef's in the city.

Hits the spot every time!

If you haven't tried Dominican food, this is your best bet in downtown or just Indianapolis. 

The natural juices are to die for and the food takes you to the island and back. Flavorful, hearty, and fantastic portions make me come back once a week. 

For anyone that lives in the area and hasn't tried it, you're missing out!

I suggest the tostones and the fried cheese or any empanadas for a quick bite. For dinner, try the bistec encebollado (steak w. onions) or the pollo guisado. 

Hidden gem of downtown Indianápolis!!

This is my sister's friend's dad's restaurant and I came here for the first time and I loved it!! I really recommend the California burrito. It's sooooo good and it fills you up so much!! I will definitely be coming back here!
Food was not good. Lacked flavor!! Goat stew was  terrible. And the goat and the sausage were over cooked or not cooked right.

Empanadas were hot and good but a bit American pub foodish without a unique or amazing flavor.  3*

The stewed goat was perfectly cooked falling apart and off the bone with a depth of rich flavor. 5*

The fried plantains were great but the dipping sauce is very basic, it would be better with a garlic aioli or a fruit based chutney/salsa/sauce. 4*

Sooo happy to have another dining option close to work. Especially one as delicious as this one! Prices are very reasonable for quality and quantity of food you receive. The Cubano sandwich is fantastic, as is the iced coffee.  

The iced coffee comes sweet and with cream added.
Delicious Dominican food.. Delicious juice although expensive. They no longer serve shrimp which means i will no longer eat their...Please bring shrimp back... Best plantains ever!!!!

After trying to get into the Plow and Anchor yesterday, my wife and I had lunch here. Plow and Anchor was closed for lunch without explanation. What great luck when we found Oso's Republic just across the street.

I'll start off by saying, I might have given Oso's five stars if we didn't have to endure listening to Scoobydoo cartoons during our entire time there, and they are greatly in need of some decor improvements. That said, the food here is fantastic! 

I had the Oso's Cubano sandwich with rosemary fries, both done to perfection. I think my wife had the Pollo Guisado and plantains. Now I have never liked plantains, but these were done savory, and completely changed my mind about how plantains can actually be prepared deliciously.

As we were leaving, and gushing compliments about our meals, the waitress said we should try the goat next time. Now, I loves me some good goat, and couldn't believe I missed it on the menu. I'll be back soon to try it, and everything else I can. Don't miss out on this hidden Indianapolis gem.

I met a friend for lunch at Oso's and was really impressed! I wish that they weren't off the beaten path, keeping those less adventurous from discovering their delicious dishes. The menu is rather small, but for the indecisive, this is fantastic. This also means that everything they make is on the menu for a good reason. My friend has been there several times and loves their Santa Fe salad. The diners at the next table had the Yaroa and raved about how good it was, and that the portion was large enough that he'd eat the rest for dinner as he'd done in the past. I try not to eat too much bread, but the Oso's Cubano sandwich sounded really great. When I said I didn't want a bun, he suggested using the fried plantains as bread (which would also make it gluten-free). They are lightly fried, and solid enough to use as a bun. When I told him how good it was, he was excited about having another option on the menu. The Jibarito is one of the Dominican entrees, which also uses the plantains.  The rosemary fries were really good, too. I will definitely take my husband back to try more - I'm looking at you, Maduro Tacos and Sweet Chili Wings.

Stopped by for a quick dinner - what a lovely experience it was! The pork sandwich was very tasty and toasted perfectly. The plantain chips were to die for (seriously, try them instead of the fries, you can get fries anywhere, you can't usually get these). The service - personable and friendly. Five stars!

"Rosemary" fries had no evidence of rosemary and were clearly from the freezer, topped with a spartan amount of Parmesan, served with Thousand Island dressing. The California burrito was circular and looked like it had been folded by a blind person who was vaguely familiar with the concept of a burrito. The filling was just okay. Service was fine. My wife thought it smelled like an armpit, although truthfully I didn't notice a smell. Would not go back.

The food I got was extremely heavy.  I guess that was my own fault, since I ordered the California burrito and the fried plantains.  It was delicious, though! 

The woman working there was really friendly.  She was helpful and made me feel comfortable.

Unfortunately, the atmosphere of the restaurant left a lot to be desired.  It was dark and had very little decoration of any sort.  Also there was literally no one there, which made it feel a little depressing.  I have a feeling more people get take-out orders than come in to eat there.  I ordered take-out myself, and while I was waiting, saw a couple people come in to pick up orders.
I am obsessed with the cheese empanadas,  the rosemary fries, and the sweet chili chicken wings. The music is great in here, too, and the service is fast for made to order.

Oso's was a wonderful find for us!  My husband and I were very pleased with our dinner choices. I had the Jibarito and my husband had the California Burrito. Mine had a bed of lettuce with a delicious dressing and the burrito came with Rosemary fries. We will definitely be back and would encourage all to give this terrific restaurant a try!!

My friend got a Groupon so we decided to check it out. We almost drove away because there was no one else in the restaurant, but we were in too big a hurry to find another place. So we sat down. The lady who attended us was quiet but friendly. The manager/owner stepped in when she heard we were in a hurry and was very competent and helpful with the menu! We had delicious chicken empanadas for an appetizer. My friend and I each ordered the stewed chicken with white rice and beans. Her husband got the stewed goat, which we all agreed was the best dish of the night. My husband told the manager/owner to surprise him, and he was served a stewed steak dish. She threw a plate of fried plantains on the house. Everything was absolutely delicious. All the meat was cooked to perfection, and the plantains were the best any of us had EVER had (We've traveled to Guatemala, Jamaica, Honduras, and Belize, so we've had our share of plantains).
I can't believe there weren't more people in the restaurant! Come out and support this place, folks!

This was my first time trying this place! I ordered the California Burrito. To my surprise when I bit into it, it was full of fries. In the description it doesn't say fries are in it. Kind of ruined it for me. I called to double check, they said that's how it comes. Elizabeth apologized that it didn't mention that in the description. 

I'll try something different next time for sure, if I return. But I wish the menu online was updated. That would be very helpful.

Closed at 2pm on a Saturday  - no sign on the door - nothing on social media. The menu on the website clearly says that they are open at 11. Things happen - but you hang a sign to let people know. 

Biggest pet peeve ever since I do not live downtown and hate looking forward to going to places that can't be bothered to abide by their own stated hours. Applebees wins every time a local restaurant does this.

Tucked away right next to the Central Library, Oso's food is a gem. If you even remotely like Central American / Caribbean food, you're not likely to be disappointed. They do have a few more traditional Americanized items (wings, sandwiches) but the menu will reward the more adventurous eater.

Plantains are the vehicle of choice for the sauces (savory but not too spicy) and meats (juicy and tender) on the various dishes. We had wings, empanadas, tostones, and a pork dish. All were good but the last one was the best. 

Portions were generous, pricing reasonable, and the food was out quickly. No reason not to go back!

The mofongo was really good and the picadera reminded me of the picaderas in my country. They have desserts on the menu and when I asked for dessert they didn't have any. Also, I think that if it is a dominican place they should male the environment more dominican. Overall the food was good and I would return!

This place has some amazing food.   I just wish you knew what they have available before ordering.   I wanted the stewed goat, but the waitress came back to our table (after everyone ordered) to inform me that they were out of goat.

Then I ordered the stewed beef and asked what side would go best with it - moro or rice & beans.    The waitress told me to go with the rice & beans.   After going back to the kitchen, she returns to our table again and tells me that they didn't have rice & beans (but the cook told her that moro would go better with the stewed beef anyway).

When the food arrived, I couldn't be happier, though.   It was excellent.   There's something I truly enjoy about stewed meats and the beef here was no exception.

After our meal was finished, our waitress asked if we wanted dessert.   She told us the next time we come in to call first to see if they have the caramel apple empanadas (of course they didn't have them today).

This could be an amazing restaurant if only they actually had all the items on their (already limited) menu in stock.

We ate here initially as part of a Groupon deal. The photos we saw on yelp didn't look promising and we didn't have much other than menu descriptions of foods we had never heard of.  Unfortunately the server wasn't all that helpful either.  She's very nice and pleasant but not experienced.  I took her recommendation of sweet chili wings and I'm glad i did.  They weren't the crappy looking nuggets in sauce that i saw on here,  but rather they were large, meaty, traditional wings and tasted great.  This was originally served with the rosemary fries but as of this writing they went to 6, 12, 18 portions that do not include fries. I was fortunate to catch these during a half price special. 

Overall,  I like this place.  It's really casual and the food is quite good at a reasonable price.  Sadly, I don't think they will survive but I hope I'm wrong.  A good marketing campaign directed at downtown library patrons might help

Usually I would never review a fast food joint. But if you spend a lot of time on Baltimore Pike it's good to know what is good and what isn't (there's a whole lot of shit). If you want great fast food, this Chick-Fil-A delivers. I've eaten there countless times and they've never gotten an order wrong. Food is always fast and fresh. Staff is young and friendly. You won't get a typical nasty drive thru experience (maybe it's those Sundays off). It's a pain in the ass to get in that Target parking lot, but it is so much better than  any other drive through on the Pike.

I got reimbursed fully from Chik-Fil-A today cause their frozen coffee machine wasn't working.  They even gave me a card for a free sandwich.  I still got a biscuit for free that they didn't have to reimburse me for on top of that for breakfast.  Yay!

Stopped by here while driving to see what the crazy lines were about. Well, the hype is for real and the food is delicious. The employees are so friendly and did I mentioned how good the food was? I got the spicy chicken sandwich, which was delightful. Wl definitely be back.

This location has plenty of parking since it's in the same lot as Target.

The inside is not very big and there is no playyard for the kids (son's complaint).

Lunch/dinner sandwiches are always amazing.   Waffle fries are good but I prefer the longer fries.   The chicken tenders are on the small size so cross your fingers they give you bigger pieces so your kid is not hungry :)

Drive thru customer service is top notch.  They have a well oiled machined which is perfect for two ordering windows.

Had breakfast here this morning to check it out. Not impressed.  Had the chicken, egg and cheese on a bagel.  Chicken and egg were tasty.  The bagel not so much.  It was soggy/squishy almost like a bun texture.   

I ordered chicken platters for parties and it was a hit.  i will definitely order it again.

I will be back for lunch/dinner but not breakfast.

Hadn't been here for a while but did a stop through the drive through for a fast dinner pickup.  They now have two drive through order stations that moves everyone through even faster.   Same food as one would expect, and STILL polite staff with at least the veneer of pleasing the customer.
Went there a lot since we moved here. Great food. Coke drinks instead of Pepsi. Definitely going back.

Always on point and fast. Both drive through lanes were packed so I parked and went inside. This seems to happen almost every night because the place is so popular. Walked right up, ordered and had my food in 2 minutes. The nuggets and the spicy strips never disappoint. Employees are always so nice, such a change from other places around Delco. Good food and the best customer service. It has been my pleasure to write this review.

We come here mostly lunch after our workouts.I always get the Market salad w/ grilled chicken.My daughter & husband likes the chicken salad sandwich.Half lemonade & half ice tea always a must have for us.We'll be back for more especially when LA fitness reopens.
Fast, clean, ok in a pinch, and they are oh sooooooo polite! Closed Sundays like all Chick fil a restaurants.

This Chick fil A is the best one around, all the other reviews are right! The employees here are so nice and polite, the food is fresh, and they keep the place clean.  The only drawback here is limited parking close to the restaurant, be careful walking across those drive-through lanes! If you go on a Saturday at lunch time, they have people out in the drive through lanes directing the heavy traffic!

I enjoy Chick-fil-A very much!!!!' every time I go the food is hot and quick and good but the only thing is sometimes they forget to put food in the bag and I live in Lansdowne so driving back there is a pain in the butt three times I went  there and I had one or no sandwiches in my bag I only went back once to complain and get the sandwiches and I was rushed to the line and they acted as  if they didn't believe me and got no thing for my troubles. so my Friday night trip there has turned to once or twice a month instead of every Friday because I don't want to have to deal with the hassle that might come my way other than that they're good.

This location and Folsom need to revamp there employees.  On multiple visit now it is nothing but attitude at the counter. I will no longer visit these locations until I see improvement.  I travel often and these are the only two locations I have noticed this rudeness.   Hopefully it will improve soon.

This location is always busy but the staff seems to take it all in stride and as a customer, I don't feel like it is busy. The staff is super friendly and the food is as ordered,  warm food is warm and cold is cold. I do miss the cole slaw. The new sides policy could be better but that is a corporate decision, not the individual stores policy. The 2 lane drive thru seems to move at a quick pace. I eat in and this location is always clean and organized. The staff takes away my trash but doesn't rush me out. Over all, great experience and will recommend it to all.

I must start out by saying "I LOVE CHICK-FIL-A"!!!!!   I visit KOP MEDIA ROYERSFORD and they are all great.   The Springfield restaurant has a managerial attitude and that's what the three stars is all about.  Every time I visit this particular restaurant they NEVER  and I mean NEVER have DeCaf coffee.  It's always "We will make a fresh pot and bring it to you"   It always takes 20 minutes,  they almost always forget about it....and NEVER  serve it in a timely manner as I am always finished with my meal.   I approached two different mangers at two separate times and both said:
"We don't have decaf on hand...we always make it when it's ordered"  Fine if you own a Kerig ( like Boston Chicken)   but I have a hard time believing that decaf is not available....If the Springfield store had DECAF soda as does the KOP MEDIA and Royersford restaurants,   I would order soda because I CANNOT DRINK CAFFEINE!

Both managers really didn't care....they more or less stated....That's how it is!

So If you like Decaf soda or coffee....don't go to this one!

What's not to like about Chick-Fil-A, really?

This location has a 2 lane drive-thru, which is pretty cool and you think that would make the lines move faster. Unfortunately, it doesn't make the lines move any quicker. You are still waiting in line for awhile. Hence, only the 4 star review, rather than 5. The wait is worth it though because the food is good every single time. 

Side note, I feel like this is one of the only Chick-Fil-A's that still say 'my pleasure'.
Clean restaurant, friendly and quick service, and convenient location. Always have a pleasant experience here and really enjoy the attentive staff.

I love Chick-Fil-A! They can get through anything and is one of my favorite businesses (though to be fair they are fast food, I gave it one less star for that. It's shocking how fast I can get food from them... how do they prepare it so fast? Like Mickey Dees, etc. your food comes quickly). 

While like all other fast-foods it's probably processed I still love it. I just ate there and chatted up with a person I didn't know. Nice food, relaxing place to sit in as here there is a variety of lounging areas. You can choose the chairs that are pretty high up, the booths, and the other furniture spots.

I settled in with my grilled chicken sandwich. On a spur of the moment I used half a hot sauce packet then poured a container of BBQ sauce, one of a few you can ask for at the desk when you order. Man, that was good! I hope if you would like to try that one out, go ahead. It sure was tasty!

Then with my meal I had a frosted coffee. Was great too.

Ever since I heard of a competitive restaurant moving in right next to them, I want to help this place out as much as possible! Chick-Fil-A is worth the drive, bus, walk, whatever way you could get there (note to walkers/bussers: Note there is a stop right before the spot. I didn't know that all the other times I've been there so just want to say right at that bus stop there is a walkway that leads to a drive path and then one of the entrances!) it's worth the quick wait for good food!

Fact: fast food is not good for you.
Fact: this is my favorite fast food. 

Chick-Fil-A is so good that if you have not had it you need to try it. This particular Chick-Fil-A always looks clean and the employees are extremely friendly.

Whoever doesn't like Chick-Fil-A is no friend-o-mine.  This location has the goodness you've come to expect, a plentiful amount of overly friendly staff, good quality chicken, and a clean place to park your tray.  This location has it's own goofy quirks, like no direct line from the parking lot to the front door, and the Splenda lemonade is always a surprise...from syrupy sweet one day, to painfully tart the next.  Splenda lemonade aside, I love this Chick-Fil-A and I, like most I'm sure, wish they were open for chicken giving every day of the week.

If I am going to eat fast food I always opt for Chick-Fil-A.  This one is always clean, fast service and the employees are really nice.  My order is always correct and the quality of food for fast food is unbelievably good!  I don't know what they put in their chicken but I always want more!

This was, without question, the single best fast food dining experience I have ever had. And it was the first Saturday in December which would have typically been pure chaos. All of the staff were genuinely considerate, delivered our order to the table, super accommodating of those of us with children, came to the table to see if we needed refills....I have never seen anything like it! So very grateful! We will be back soon!

Chikfila is the best and this one does not disappoint. The restaurant is clean and has plenty of seating. Service is always fast and friendly, way better than you would expect from a fast food place. And, of course the food is amazing. Their chicken nuggets and waffle fries are the best. I also like their warm chocolate chip cookies. Just wish there was a chikfila closer to me, this one is the closest and at least a 15-20 minute drive.

Amazing. Top notch friendly service, excellent food. I mean this is fast food but they treat people very well with the respect they deserve. Other places need to start studying Chick-Fil-A's secret formula for success before the competition gets put out of business. Customer service and quality food. Took away a star after they messed up my order so many times recently.

I really enjoyed this place, the wings are always good. the best thing is that I had a chance to meet people who was working in the area but was from somewhere else. I'm a Raiders but because there was Steeler, Chicago, and Detroit fans there we all just hung together against those dirty Titan fans. lol, Just joking they are cool too.

Buffalo Wild Wings in Gallatin has the best waiting staff. You should request Paige or Desiree for your waitress. Not only are they quick, thorough, and good conversationalist, but also very cute. ( which is irrelevant but a nice bonus). The GM, Micheal, is top notch. I complimented his sweat shirt, and he gave me a lovely Guinness coaster in return. It was a great green color. #sportswingsbeer

Half hour wait for take-out turns to one hour wait. There is no excuse because the restaurant was almost empty with few customers waiting for take-out. When I asked the employee at the register, she said I'm new and the manager is busy inside. Went home after the half hour extra wait and found incomplete order. I called and the employee said manager can't talk and will call you. No one ever called.

Waited 15 mins to be helped, Take out order was wrong, came back to pick up order, had to wait 15 more mins to get the food.  Whoever worked the register didn't even come out to assist me, other waitresses kept telling me she would be out soon to help.
Really sweet and funny staff that do their job very well! Have never had a bad experience. If they mess up something they always fix it plus some!

We come to this BWWs often for lunch, and the service is always mediocre. Today it took 35+ minutes to get our food (which usually only takes 15 at the most) and the restaurant was not busy. The food was not fresh and our waitress was absent the majority of the time when we tried to figure out what was going on. 

When the manager came over, he seemed very unconcerned and said he'd discount our bills, which did not happen. By that time we were just in a hurry to get back to the office. The waitress also tried to accept a $6 tip on a $9 bill by not bringing back change.

A decent place for a wide selection of chicken wings, tenders and sauces. The food is good, but Gallatin has better. The real treat is the atmosphere. TV's, sports, and beer. I can see the appeal of a place like this.

I love BWW and was excited to take my family for the first time. When we arrived we, total of 6 people including a 3 yo, were sat a large circular table. Since my family had never been before they wanted to take their time to look over the menu, especially my mother who is on a relatively strict diet, and the waitress took our drink order and it came out promptly. This was the calm before the storm.. The drinks came out and our order was taken. Then we sat looking at each other for what felt like 40+ minutes with most of having empty glasses. This would not have been a problem and understandable if it had been busy but there was 5-6 tables of guest with us being the largest group and as we continued to wait we noticed the wait staff, including a lady who seemed to be the manager on duty,  gathering in a booth, of about 7-8 people, talking, laying down, on their phones, and etc. Our waitress was not to be found until 5 minutes before our food came out to let us know that it would be a few minutes longer and brought us more drinks. Our food then came out and as usual I was happy with my food, small boneless wings half honey mustard half Parmesan garlic, but my family wasn't so impressed. Let it be known that we did not order much food either for it being 6 people 2 sets of snack sized boneless wings, one small order of boneless, a plain grilled chicken salad, grilled buffalo chicken sandwich, one order of potato wedges and one of fries, chicken strips and 2 apps. of fried pickles. Most of the food ended up being over cooked/dry or sloppily put together. Now, 6 hours later I feel like I have acute food poisoning. I have worked in restaurants and know that unless we were slammed that amount of food should not have taken that long. All in all, I was extremely disappointed in this particular wild wings and believe they need a surprise inspection from corporate and maybe the health department. Very unprofessional, too long of a wait, and food was mediocre at best. I would have been better off going to McDonalds and at least saved a little money and would understand why I feel sick. Like my dad said, it reminded him of an episode of bar rescue that is in need of some serious help !
Great place for game night/fight night or just a fun evening with friends and family. Our server was great
When you go in, ask for Mace. He is a very sweet server and will take care of you.

This owner cheats his community, every time I buy a royal treat they serve half the ice cream and add a bunch of whip cream to hide it, but the problem they can't cover it up because the ice cream really isn't taller than the waffle bowl it's served in.  Does not compare to the picture at all.  For the cost, just under $6, it should look like the picture.  I have bought from this location for two years, we live down the street, its my son's favorite place.  This will be the last time, I can't respect or support business owners and managers that cheat they community.

They place is clean, everyone is super friendly except the older guy that makes the ice cream cakes.

5/11/18 Daughter, Kaylah & I stopped by after dinner. We all got 2 Mint Oreo & Strawberry Cheesecake. It was very filling with size small. It was a busy evening as well. The weather was 84 degrees warm. Perfect for me!
One of the best Blizzards I've had in Indianapolis. Fresh ingredients. Mixed pretty well, despite a couple inches of pure vanilla ice cream at the bottom of a large size. Friendly staff.
Stopped here with my family, and the teenage boy that took our order was not friendly what so ever. I won't be coming back here ever. He made it seem like we were a bother to him. Also, fix the AC!!!
Terrible service the past few times the drive through servers dumped cones upside down in a cup and were very disrespectful

For a place that sale cakes not a ever good place to eat birthday cake. Had to beg for a lighter, charged for plates, and everyone seemed not to know what was going on. This place was not friendly at all. I'd you do spot download the shop spot app. They won't ask and you will miss out on saving

Terrible, even for fast food. The chicken was rubbery, the fries barely room temp. The side of gravy looked curdled, so I changed to the buffalo sauce, which was average. No greeting or thanking from the cashier. Never again.

Nice family spot .  French Fries are fresh and yummy..soft on inside, crisp and golden on outside.  Good burgers.  Kids burger is same as the adult burger.  Kids meals are super deals!  They get their choice of a cone, Dilly bar, or Ice Cream Sandwich with meal.  I think I will do a kids meal next time!  Nice quiet, clean and sunny place to stop and grab a bite while out and about.  Good deal too!
